662046056.name: Beautiful Beach --DANGEROUS SURF
662046056.author: a TripAdvisor user
662046056.reviewBody: Walk in through the palm grove to this gorgeous beach but be careful in the water....known for its rip tides and drownings....please be careful.

659092456.name: Las Palmas - beautiful beach but dangerous
659092456.author: a TripAdvisor user
659092456.reviewBody: We were there yesterday, March 18/19. Beautiful day and very few people. We frequent this beach and love the day spent in such a setting.\nWe watched a couple walk onto the beach hand in hand and remarked at how happy they looked. An hour or so later the fellow was dragged out of the water - dead. Stunningly sad, heart wrenching and sobering.\nThis is a dangerous place to swim. Do not go into this water without a great deal of local knowledge. Most all the beaches on the west side of the Baja have tremendous undertow.

656614791.name: Pristine
656614791.author: a TripAdvisor user
656614791.reviewBody: My favorite playa in the area. Very pristine. You need to be able to read when it\'s safe to swim between the rocks.  Enough said.

642898403.name: Las Palmas.   Palm Beach
642898403.author: a TripAdvisor user
642898403.reviewBody: Well worth the walk to this unique beach.\nNo facilities or vendors so bring your own lunch.\nRecommended not to leave any valuables visible in your car but this is common sense for most beaches in North America.

612618112.name: Nice secluded beach between Todos Santos & Cabo
612618112.author: a TripAdvisor user
612618112.reviewBody: Traveling solo with small dog I discovered this beach when I left Todos Santos for the Cape.  Although it is advertised as a day use the caretaker (who visits daily & only speaks Spanish) will let you camp there for 250 pesos/night with secure parking.  My dog & I camped there 2 days & felt secure.  There is foot traffic going to the beach during the day but at night the only noise you hear is skunks & raccoons lingering around the area. Nice beach. Road can be sandy & bumpy but had no problems in my RAV4.

576343959.name: As described by others, worth it
576343959.author: a TripAdvisor user
576343959.reviewBody: We hunted this place after reading the reviews.  When you leave the highway just a few yards south of Km marker 57, take the middle dirt road.  It is fairly smooth save for a few quite bumpy spots near the first.  It\u2019s not fast going, but worth a 10-15 minute drive to a parking area near the palm tree grove.  The beach is lovely.....with limited time, we didn\u2019t stay long, but would return.  The contrast between the cacti and the palms practically coexisting is a wonder.  And the rocky cliffs with the crashing waves made for a feeling of going outside of \u2018civilization\u2019

566859427.name: Off the Beaten Path
566859427.author: a TripAdvisor user
566859427.reviewBody: We pulled off around Km 57 on Highway 19 on our drive back to Cabo from Todos Santos. The dirt road surrounded by huge cacti started off smooth but soon became filled with large holes and ruts. We turned around for fear of damaging our rental car or being stranded with a flat. I think a 4WD/army tank might be a better vehicle choice. Maybe we just gave up too soon. It sure looked pretty from a distance! Kudos to you that made it off the beaten path.

564943812.name: Hidden Treasure
564943812.author: a TripAdvisor user
564943812.reviewBody:
This is a fantastic beach ! The access road is rough, be prepared for large ruts/potholes.  
Secluded and beautiful.  The beach is a 5 minutes walk from parking.   It is not private land ,  this is a public location. 
No services or facilities. 
So relaxing.

559428657.name: Nice secluded beach
559428657.author: a TripAdvisor user
559428657.reviewBody: The drive is long but beautiful to get there and the beach is beautiful and fairly secluded. Only 10 people there. So very pleasant.

511146583.name: The road is difficult to access and find and worth the drive in!
511146583.author: a TripAdvisor user
511146583.reviewBody: A bit of a walk once we arrived there on a bit of a challenging road which so many of the roads are here! No problem though with our rental car. The huge cacti on the way in were incredible and then arriving with all the palm trees growing everywhere. So pretty as I had never seen palm trees growing "wild" like this before. There wasn\'t a soul to be found on the beautiful beach. The very old and primitive bricks and brick buildings were not expected as we hadn\'t looked into the area at all. Worth the drive in. There are some horses in the area as well and it appears someone is there to look after them.

483866879.name: Nice secluded beach
483866879.author: a TripAdvisor user
483866879.reviewBody: Just to mix it up, we thought we\'d try all the beaches. Nice, scenic spot. Mixed reviews on whether it\'s a swimming beach or not. We were told yes and my husband did swim. Some other people said oh, no, there are undertows there. The Todos Santos map did list it with a swimmer so maybe it depends on the day? Nice large open beach.

478237615.name: Stunning and secluded
478237615.author: a TripAdvisor user
478237615.reviewBody: Like a tropical island! Worth a special trip. We stumbled across this beautiful place and found it almost empty!

473018155.name: Undeveloped shoreline - Great for a picnic outing, beachcombing
473018155.author: a TripAdvisor user
473018155.reviewBody: We enjoy occasional beach picnics here.  Very scenic, with some shade from the palms back from the beach.  There are no facilities, so pack out what you pack in.  The beach has a gentle slope with fine sand providing an easy entry and exit from the water.  There may be days with rough surf, so use discretion before entering the water as there are no lifeguards.  In fact, there may be nobody else nearby on the beach, one of its charms.  If you do leave your picnic basket on the beach to go for a swim, watch out for the feral horses that might swipe a treat.  Note that waves and currents may be stronger at the rocky points at each end of the beach.

467017705.name: Safe swim outside of Cerritos
467017705.author: a TripAdvisor user
467017705.reviewBody: Great spot with a wide flat beach which is swimmer friendly. It\'s the only place in the area besides Cerritos where you can have a fun swim in the waves and not worry about getting smashed. There is a current as you get closer to the rocks so stay closer to the middle and everything will be fine. Very little shade to be found.

466606633.name: Not-so-secret-but-still-wonderful beach
466606633.author: a TripAdvisor user
466606633.reviewBody: I\'m sure before TripAdvisor and Lonely Planet, this was a wonderful local secret. Still, it was very quiet when we visited----about five couples spread out across half a mile of beige sand. As swimmable beaches go, it\'s much closer to Todos Santos than La Playa Cerritos, which we also liked, but is much more crowded, with hundreds of people.

464791652.name: Nice Secluded (and Hard-to-Find) Beach
464791652.author: a TripAdvisor user
464791652.reviewBody:
This is a pretty beach that's off the beaten path. To get to it, pay *really* close attention after you pass Km marker 57 from Mexico-19 ... there will be a dirt path not too far from the marker. (We saw it as we passed it and had to drive a bit for a U turn ... then we drove slowly pretty much on the shoulder the next time to find it).

The road is VERY bumpy and feels like it will never end. (I estimate it's at least a mile.) We didn't have 4-wheel drive but SO wished we did. Nonetheless, with slow and careful driving, we finally made it. You'll see other cars, so you'll know where to park. Then you need to walk perhaps a 1/4 mile through palm trees to the beach.

Even though there were about a dozen cars, the beach felt private because it's large, and everyone was spread out. 

The sand was surprisingly smooth ... no rocks, but also no seashells. But it was a great surface for frisbee.

The water was kind of rough when we went. And of course cold since it was February. Yet there's a little tidal pool during low tide that the kids enjoyed playing in because the water was warm.

459481587.name: Hard to get at, but surely worth the effort.
459481587.author: a TripAdvisor user
459481587.reviewBody: It is the prettiest beach in the Todos Santos area. Used to be even better with a lagoon and horses wandering around but the stream is no more. Stil,l the sand is hard packed at the water\'s edge, great for a walk and later find a spot to have a swim. However, only the mid-section is relative safe to swim. Do not swim closer to the rocky outcrops as there can be a dangerous undertow. \nThe road in is pretty bad and there is limited parking. A short stroll through the palm grove (previously burned a few times) . will get you to the beach. No services or facilities. Once you have made that, going out,  keep right at the first split in the road to get back a bit further south on the highway as the access there is much better then across the defunct botanical gardens.

454023414.name: Worth the drive, worth the hike.
454023414.author: a TripAdvisor user
454023414.reviewBody: Palm beach is a short stretch of sandy beach between two rocky headlands. But what a stretch of beach! Enough waves to be interesting but not so much as to be scary. Gorgeous views. And bounded by very interesting rocks. The drive to the beach is rough but, after you park, it\'s a short walk through a wonderful palm forest that gives the whole experience a feeling of visiting a hidden world. The greenery amidst the dry Baja is striking. And then the beach appears. We spent several happy hours here, watching the waves, swimming in the warm water, and soaking up the sun. There are no facilities, no attractions save the waves, the sun, the sand and the rocks. If this is what you are looking for, look no farther.

451527784.name: Next Stop Palm Beach
451527784.author: a TripAdvisor user
451527784.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with good swimming and phenomenal views. The drive is hairy beginning on a poorly marked dirt road, but well worth the bumps! The hike out to the beach is short and wild in an old palm grove. Don\'t leave valuables in your car...

435838013.name: "Awesome secluded beach"
435838013.author: a TripAdvisor user
435838013.reviewBody: This beach is a hidden gem! Very secluded and beautiful. Great for exploring. Definitely off the beaten path but well worth the short walk to get there. Once we arrived we were greeted with a spectacular view. \n

425441303.name: Serene solitude
425441303.author: a TripAdvisor user
425441303.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the crowds and enjoy a little piece of heaven make the trip to Palm Beach. Right at mile marker 57 follow a very bumpy dirt road and at its end park. You will walk through a palm tree forest ending on a beautiful beach. You might run into several curious unharnessed horses. Once you arrive at the beach chances are high you will be alone to enjoy the sounds of the waves crashing, smell the ocean air and take in the beauty. No pushy purveyors of timeshares or curio\'s just the sounds of nature at its best.

424594837.name: The Best Places in Baja are at the end of the Worst Roads
424594837.author: a TripAdvisor user
424594837.reviewBody: This gem of a beach is at the end of a twisty, turny, rocky and rutted dirt road. But it\'s totally worth the drive as it is private, stunning and pristine. You may find three or four other cars there, but that will be all. You\'ll have this piece of paradise mostly to yourself. The water is warm, the waves are fairly gentle and the palms are prolific. Bring a cooler as there are no services. Just nature at her finest.

405360740.name: Palm trees and horses (that\'s it)
405360740.author: a TripAdvisor user
405360740.reviewBody: This is a lovely secluded beach where horses will wander up curious about what you have in your cooler.  There\'s some ambiguity about whether it\'s safe to swim there. My family mostly just played in the shallows of the water, enjoying the waves without going out too deep. We brought our lunch along because there are no amenities (e.g., rest rooms or snacks), but there are also no one trying to sell you anything. A pleasant experience that is unlike (the more swimmable) El Cerritos beach.

400906204.name: Worth the trip
400906204.author: a TripAdvisor user
400906204.reviewBody: Las Palmas is off rt. 19 at Kilometer marker 57.  Don\'t look for a sign, there is none.  Well worth the bumps and dips along the road to get here.  Beautiful beach, and generally swimmable most days.  Surf can be rough at times, so beware. No worry about crowds at this beach.  Lovely

384598956.name: Pristine and Secluded Las Palmas Beach
384598956.author: a TripAdvisor user
384598956.reviewBody: As with most of the area\'s beaches, this one is down a long, dusty and rutted dirt road, but it is well worth the trip. One of Mexico\'s former presidents is rumored to have owned the hacienda now in ruins next to the parking lot of this gorgeous beach. Walk through an intense palm grove down a foot path and voila- paradise awaits! \nTip: no services of any kind so pack a picnic and be sure to bring plenty of agua.

373407020.name: Alone with the palm trees
373407020.author: a TripAdvisor user
373407020.reviewBody: This is a spectacular, uncrowded beach, at least it was when we were there.  We were the only visitors and had the entire playa to ourselves.  Great swimming, solitude, the occasional pelican.  What else do you need?

358766896.name: Secluded and worth the drive
358766896.author: a TripAdvisor user
358766896.reviewBody: A great stretch of beach at the end of a dirt road and a short walk.  We were there over Easter Week and practically had the beach to ourselves.  Keep an eye our for huge sand dollars buried in the wet sand.  Stay for the sunset, but watch out for livestock in the road on the way out.  While you can play in the shallow water and foamy waves, definitely be cautious about swimming.  Only go in with a board and even then don\'t go where you can\'t stand.  There is a nasty rip current.

357383931.name: Beautiful!!
357383931.author: a TripAdvisor user
357383931.reviewBody: A tranquil, peaceful, beautiful beach that is off-the-beaten-path, and always uncrowded. The sand is hard-packed and easy to walk on. The waves break a distance out, so it\'s also very safe. An absolutely gorgeous place to spend an afternoon!

347608912.name: STUNNING!
347608912.author: a TripAdvisor user
347608912.reviewBody: this beach is down a bumpy dirt road and SO worth the drive. you walk through a forest of palms and come out on a pristine beach (which was empty when we were there) it felt like our own private paradise!

345634681.name: Wonderful place to spend the afternoon.
345634681.author: a TripAdvisor user
345634681.reviewBody:
We loved finding this beach.  We went on a Sunday which is usually locals day.  It was still almost completely secluded except for two families who came to picnic and play in the surf.

The walk through the palm grove is really pretty, but not too long.  There is shade near the rocks at the closer end of the beach.

We did see one little boy get caught up in a rip tide and people had to go out to help, so would suggest you stay to the middle of the beach or be a strong swimmer to play too far out in the water.

Overall..great place to spend the day.

May need an SUV to get there.  Some very big ruts in the dirt road.

344138321.name: Lovely beach, and different
344138321.author: a TripAdvisor user
344138321.reviewBody: Palm Beach is a lovely, secluded beach surrounded by palm trees, which is a little bit different for this area.  The beach is "just right".  It is a long, bumpy road to get there, but it is doable in a rental car, I think.  You can see the palms off in the distance from Hwy 19, but you have to drive through the desert to get there.  It is easy to miss the turnoff.  The first one is at milepost 57, soon after the road from Todos Santos rejoins the bi-pass.  If you miss that one, there is one a short way past it, and it is a bit easier to enter from the highway.

326121296.name: Hope it never changes!
326121296.author: a TripAdvisor user
326121296.reviewBody: You\'ll need a car and have to make it down a bit of a washed out road, but the payoff is a nice beach that you will likely have all to yourself. It\'s a bit of a walk through a palm grove to reach the beach, be sure to bring an umbrella or shade tent if you need it and know there are no services or bathrooms.

324873805.name: Pura Vida
324873805.author: a TripAdvisor user
324873805.reviewBody: There are not enough words nor adjectives to describe how much I LOVE this beach! It is perfect in every way.  Isolated, good walking, fabulous for swimming, breezy even when it is 90+ in town. The entire setting is magical and you get a feel for what heaven may hold for us.  You simply have to experience it yourself, XXX

308779810.name: Perfect Isolate Beach
308779810.author: a TripAdvisor user
308779810.reviewBody: Great beach! You may see one or two other people there max.  There is a small hike to the beach.  When there is a solid south swell, big surf! Perfect peel.

300930592.name: Paradise at Palm Beach
300930592.author: a TripAdvisor user
300930592.reviewBody: This is the beach of your dreams....to usually have it all to yourself. We used to be able to park much closer to the sand, but hurricanes and fires changed all that.  So be prepared to park and walk a bit through a palm grove, sometimes having to tread through a little creek if it\'s been raining, and then the beach is there for endless views.  So private and secluded....besides the ocean, the lagoon is fantastic to swim in, too... just float in fresh water amongst the reeds....  Bring your drinks...and there are no facilities at all. It\'s paradise found.

298831771.name: Hidden Gem of a Beach
298831771.author: a TripAdvisor user
298831771.reviewBody: My fav hidden gem of a beach in the area, perfect for swimming and body boarding. Wild horses on the beach, a lagoon. Long drive in, but beautiful scenery.

291605115.name: Nice
291605115.author: a TripAdvisor user
291605115.reviewBody: There are several possible palm beaches.  One is spectactular, the other is blah.  I will assume it is the better beach.  And it is really a SPECTACULAR beach.  Nicer even than Cerritos.

287273409.name: Private beach!
287273409.author: a TripAdvisor user
287273409.reviewBody: A little hard to find and difficult to drive a rental car to but DEFINITELY WORTH IT!  We were here for 4 days and after we found this beach, we kept going back.  Watch out for the wild horses. They are very sweet but I\'m just scared of horses coming up to me on the beach!

278119895.name: Hidden Gem
278119895.author: a TripAdvisor user
278119895.reviewBody: This was the highlight of our recent trip to Todos Santos - Las Palmas.  It\'s difficult to find and get there (definitely need a SUV) and once you park, you have to carry all your stuff and walk to the beach, but it\'s definitely worth it.  It\'s a secluded cove - when we arrived there was only one other couple, and as we left, two other couples joined. If you come, you need to bring everything you need: we brought an umbrella, chairs, towels, snacks and drinks - as well as books. It\'s swimmable - and just so peaceful. My husband and I walked the beach and found two sand dollars. The palms surrounding the beach really make it feel so exclusive. We would recommend - we just hope it stays pristine for years to come.

260644937.name: Best beach near todos Santos
260644937.author: a TripAdvisor user
260644937.reviewBody: I hate to review this beach as it has been my favorite for years and i would not to see it spoiled we usually have it to ourselves just sharing with the local horses the road can be interesting and it is harder to find since the highway was widened

260639238.name: Getting there is \u00bd the fun
260639238.author: a TripAdvisor user
260639238.reviewBody: Hard to fine the turn-off, but well worth the effort.\nNice firm packed sand and swimmable surf. Swim in the middle of the beach only. Primitive and private.

244983495.name: add some adventure to your day at the beach
244983495.author: a TripAdvisor user
244983495.reviewBody: We love this place.  If you like to hike head to the far north end of the beach and then follow along the based of the hill to the left.  After a very short distance you will come to an old road that was cut into the hill.  Not at all drivable but plenty gud for a hike up to the top of the hill with great vistas of the ocean and cliffs.  There are two entrances off the highway both just after km marker 57 heading south.  We prefer the second one, both qualify as off roading for sure.  Our first visit had a small car and pulled over and walked part way because the road was getting worse.  From now on we will always rent SuVs for Baja because better clearance.

244358501.name: A hidden gem
244358501.author: a TripAdvisor user
244358501.reviewBody: I was told by my friend in El Pescadero that this was a great place to swim and relax for the day, and she was right. To get to this beach oasis you will need to make a sharp turn off the highway onto an easy to miss bumpy dirt road. After advice from others we left no valuables in the car and then trekked through a beautiful palm forest. The beach was picture perfect. With warm shallow water and waves just the right size for swimming. There are no amenities here and that was okay with us as we brought everything we needed to enjoy a wonderful afternoon at a nearly deserted beach. Sadly the famed wild horses of this beach were elsewhere that day.\nBut with Jill and Tom, 4 dogs, a picnic and cold drinks, who could ask for anything more. Thank-you amigos.

243546550.name: Most Excellent hidden beach
243546550.author: a TripAdvisor user
243546550.reviewBody: The first time my husband and I went to Las Palmas we shared the beach with another couple and a small herd of local horses. Was magical to say the least. The water is clear, sparkling, swim-able and the privacy makes this beach a complete treat.

242587408.name: Clean and quiet
242587408.author: a TripAdvisor user
242587408.reviewBody: I\'ve been coming here since I was 13...I\'m 34 now and back in the day we (my family and our friends) would be able to camp and live on this beach. About 5 years after that they closed it down to campers and allowed daytrippers only so we bought a lot in town and continued to visit here every year. I have seen it when the fire went through and cleaned up alot of the dead palms, I\'ve seen it weather storms, hurricanes, droughts etc..Four years ago there was a series of break ins. You used to be able to drive right up to the beach and park but the moved the parking further back into the desert and closed it off to vehicle traffic. We went through the hassle of going to Cabo for 3 days to renew passprts and fie police reports due to our stolen things but since then and especially after Hurricane Odile, I have found the beach to be quiet, clean, and pristine..just like the old days! :-)Enjoy!

242354814.name: After KM 58
242354814.author: a TripAdvisor user
242354814.reviewBody: If you do not have a 4wd, then take the dirt road after KM 58.  We had a mid-size car and turned around.  A couple in a compact passed us and said they were there yesterday; we didn\'t want to chance it.

238379366.name: Near impossible to find the turn off, but worth the effort
238379366.author: a TripAdvisor user
238379366.reviewBody: Drove by 4 times before we found the turn off to the dirt/sand path that takes you to Palm Beach.  Followed the instructions in the tourist guide, but even that didn\'t help much.  Not even sure what to tell someone as to how to find it, but do try.  It\'s a small beach and one of the more swimable in the area although it\'s not calm by any means.  \n\nSomewhat difficult to go down the path w/o a truck or 4 wheel drive.  We did it, but go slow and not on a rainy or muddy day!

237586376.name: Remote and beautiful
237586376.author: a TripAdvisor user
237586376.reviewBody: winding dirt road leads to a short tropical forest like walk and empties on to true paradise.  Breathtaking cove ,  wild horses.  nature at its best.

236803515.name: Quiet place to relax
236803515.author: a TripAdvisor user
236803515.reviewBody: I love the nice walk throughout the palms to get to this beach. Be ready to carry it in and out. Enjoy! (Do NOT leave valuables in car!)

230638473.name: One of the nicest secluded beaches I\'ve seen
230638473.author: a TripAdvisor user
230638473.reviewBody: Bring in everything. Short scenic hike. Make sure no valuable left in your car to tempt thieves.This beach is heaven. We sat and watched the whales and waves for hours in mid February. There are no facilities, bring water, beer, lunch, and a camera.We still talk about our two hours hanging out. Just awesome. It is an amazing place and a final resting spot for pelican that dive bomb the beach. Its a cooker so bring a hat! Later off to Hotel California for a great supper and rock and roll!

209580941.name: Private, quiet and beautiful
209580941.author: a TripAdvisor user
209580941.reviewBody: You need to walk a little to get to it, very easy walk, and you arrive at this open, huge beach that had no one there when we went, seems more of a local spot, so no tourists or people selling you a massage, jewelry etc.  No bathrooms, surf rentals or food either. Must bring your own umbrella, no shade at all. Absolutely lovely. And as far as roads go, this one is one of the better ones.

209418176.name: Bit of a hike, but well worth the effort.
209418176.author: a TripAdvisor user
209418176.reviewBody: A beautiful, secluded beach.  No facilities, so bring a beach chair, umbrella & a nice chest.  Take it easy on the road \ud83d\ude0e

208424363.name: Love this beach!
208424363.author: a TripAdvisor user
208424363.reviewBody: Stopped by the beach after a trip to Todos Santos (our second time here) and remembered we loved this beach, so much so we came back all the way from San Jose del Cabo for the whole day.  Packed a cooler full of water and beer and we were on our way for a fun filled day at the most amazing beach.  We saw the horses the first time we stopped by, but not the second.  FYI......this beach has a huge population of crabs, they were everywhere.

207591450.name: Stunning crescent beach
207591450.author: a TripAdvisor user
207591450.reviewBody: A big crescent beach lined by a palm forest on one side and the swimmable Pacific on the other. A large year round fresh water stream is a great place for the kids to play.

202436790.name: Hidden beach worth the rough road...
202436790.author: a TripAdvisor user
202436790.reviewBody: While staying the month of March in Todos Santos we ventured to this amazing beach. The road was rough but doable. After parking there is a several block walk thru the Palm trees making for an exotic entrance. We did not swim but enjoyed the serenity and a few cerveza\'s sitting there. After a while some horses showed up to beg including a foal. A magical place for sure. No services and be sure not to leave valuables in your car just in case. Enjoy...

200468893.name: Secluded Beach
200468893.author: a TripAdvisor user
200468893.reviewBody: We recently visited Palm Beach.  It is tricky to find.  Easiest way to access it is by driving from Todos Santos on Highway 19 South back towards Cabo.  If you are going the other direction, you will need to turn around on the outskirts of Todos Santos.  Just past mile marker 57, you will see a nondescript dirt road that is unmarked.  On the East side of the road is an abandoned compound establishment (I didn\'t see any dead pine tree).  It is the only building within 2 km so you will know that you have the right spot.  If you miss the spot, there is another turn off right at mile marker 58 (not 68 like one of the other reviewer\'s said).  If you look in the distance to the West, you will see the grove of palm trees in the distance to know that you have the right area.  Both turns off\'s take you down a sometimes rutted, sometimes smooth dirt road that is 2+ km long.  At the end of the road, a downed palm tree blocks your path from driving further and this is where you park.  There were a half dozen parked cars here.  No broken glass noted, although the lady at the book store in town said to watch out if there was broken glass due to past break ins.  We easily transversed the drive in our rented Jetta, you just need to go slow in the rutted sections.  From there, it is a short walk through the well marked path to the beach.  We found an area that had a ton of shells and my daughter and I picked shells for an hour.  The one caution I have is that you probably need to use bug spray on the lower extremities.  The beach was infested with sand flys (no see ems) and I got eaten alive.  This was pointed out by another reviewer.  The beach is fairly isolated, there were only about 12 people there at mid-day.  No horses seen, just the evidence they left behind.  As for wading, not a problem as the beach had a very shallow incline.  Swimming, I would be very careful.  There was a well worn sign instructing how to swim out of a rip-current, perhaps an ominous warning?  Enjoy

192855523.name: Hidden Gem Just Outside Todos Santos
192855523.author: a TripAdvisor user
192855523.reviewBody: We loved this place. The drive is a bit "exciting" but once you arrive it is well worth it. You follow a winding, rutted road through the desert until you arrive at a small parking lot. We drove a van with seven passengers and actually had some of the people get out to help guide me through the ruts. There were several normal cars in the lot so it is possible to get to it without four wheel drive. Once you leave the parking lot you enter a beautiful palm grove and then see a field of tall grass with remnants of cane and then walk out onto a broad beach. A spring cuts through the trees and enters the ocean. This is a great place for kids to play without worrying about them entering the surf. There are ruins of a home on the edge of the cliffs. We ran into some folks who live in the area and they said the ruins were the remains of a summer home built for the one-time president of Mexico. They also said the land nearby is still owned locally and a care taker opens and shuts the gates each night to keep out partiers who may soil the beach. We had heard that cars a frequently broken into while people visit the beach, but we saw no indication of that during our visit. We had heard that "wild" horses roamed the palm grove and we did have a chance to see them. However, they are pretty well fed and very friendly so I suspect the term "wild" was an exaggeration. When you visit you might want to bring along an apple to offer to them.

189267248.name: Secluded, wide, very pretty
189267248.author: a TripAdvisor user
189267248.reviewBody: It might be a little tricky to find, but it\'s not too bad. It\'s tucked in between two headlands, with a huge stand of palm trees that is visible from the highway. There are three or so dirtroads leading off the highway that will take you there, though some are 4WD only, but those are pretty obvious from the beginning. We made it in a small two door toyota yaris, slowly, but without any issues. You need to rely a bit on your instincts though to find this one. I think we took the second turnoff from the highway. It\'s the one with a really steep down slope, initially, but nothing too bad. The beach itself is really nice with hardly anyone there. We spent an afternoon there without seeing anyone. Calm water, also. Fun to splash around in.

184540585.name: Exotic, untouched beach within a palm tree forest with wild horses!
184540585.author: a TripAdvisor user
184540585.reviewBody:
We really loved this beach!

Very natural, untouched and exotic!

To get there you have to walk thought a palm tree forest for 5 min. In the forest we found a group of wild horses :) So cute!

Finally to get on the beach you  climb over an old palm tree over a small river to get on the beach which is enclosed on both sides by mountains.

170333324.name: Isolated quiet beach
170333324.author: a TripAdvisor user
170333324.reviewBody: We talked to some folks at Cerritos  beach about how to get there.  Turn off the highway 19 at the botanical research center ( just watch for the 60 foot tall dying pine tree.). Just after El Pescadero.  The road in is a wild ride (but my rented Jetta made it, and we only thought we ripped the oil pan off once).   There was to Michigan families playing in the creek.  And we were the only two people on the beach.  The surf was big but we felt no rip...but there was a sign in the way in on how to swim out of one.\nI would be antsy letting my kids swim there, at least on the day I was there.

155063486.name: Secluded beach
155063486.author: a TripAdvisor user
155063486.reviewBody: Love this beach....the road is a little scary for me though. Drove a van to the beach and the road is pretty bad in parts, but worth the trip. A little walk to the beach, so don\'t carry too much. Horses live near by, so you might be in for a visit.

152876533.name: great private beach
152876533.author: a TripAdvisor user
152876533.reviewBody:
this beach is great, once you get there.  the road, like all roads to baja beaches, is uneven and requires slow, careful driving.  we found that turning onto km marker 68 and working our way back made for a bit smoother ride for our rented jetta.

palm trees, water calm enough for swimming / boogie boarding, very few other people.  we went here three days in a row.  if you get there before noon, you'll be the only one on the beach.  it's an easy, even walk down to the beach from parking.

we loved it here.

152472983.name: Beautiful
152472983.author: a TripAdvisor user
152472983.reviewBody: This beach is a bit of a bouncey ride in from the main road but it is worth it. There are no facilities here so come with a cooler or plan to just visit for a short time. The walk in through the palm forest to the beach is very nice and felt safe. The beach is very large and clean. The waves were huge but were breaking a little bit further off shore here than some of the other beaches. This is not a guarded beach. I am not sure I would swim here because of this. It was a nice walk around and good for some picture taking.

149127899.name: Not good, cars broken into
149127899.author: a TripAdvisor user
149127899.reviewBody: We went there and there is no parking close to the beach.  There were some drunken tourists and they were trying to break into a lady\'s car.  A good samaritan called the lady and her husband who scared the thieves way.

148853106.name: Best Beach in Todos Santos area.
148853106.author: a TripAdvisor user
148853106.reviewBody: We spent most days at this beach. The only crap part is all the dog poo. People don\'t clean up after their pets. There is tons. Watch your step. Also beach gnats get really bad if wind dies down and toward late afternoon when the sun starts to go down. Besides that this beach is choice. Its pretty good swimming and not crowded. Also sooooo beautiful!

135003590.name: Lovely and somewhat secluded
135003590.author: a TripAdvisor user
135003590.reviewBody: A bit of a walk, so you don\'t want to carry much...no crowds and sometimes swimmable. Visited many times and will next time we are in Todos Santos. No facilities, but a lovely beach away from the crowds.

128029937.name: Loved it!
128029937.author: a TripAdvisor user
128029937.reviewBody: At KM 57, this is a beautiful secluded beach with nice waves...more locals than tourists.  We discovered it later in our trip.  Wish we would have gone there more.

127699171.name: best hidden beach!
127699171.author: a TripAdvisor user
127699171.reviewBody: Clean, quiet, decent for swimming. Sweet little location through a palm grove. Horses on the beach

125202446.name: nice swimming beach
125202446.author: a TripAdvisor user
125202446.reviewBody: bumpy dirt road and a moderate walk through palm forest. Hard to find turnoff without local knowledge.

120843639.name: Very scenic place, cool jungle lagoon, but very littered
120843639.author: a TripAdvisor user
120843639.reviewBody: I wish people would take better care of this special place - I saw local families just get up and leave with piles of beer bottles left behind!  Oh well...welcome to the Baja!

116643210.name: Palm forest reveals beautiful beach
116643210.author: a TripAdvisor user
116643210.reviewBody: We received a tip from our hosts at Posada La Posa (amazing) to check out this beach at sunset.  We drove down a dirt road, walked a short distance through an amazing (although recently burning) palm forest, with mountains to our right.  We emerged at a white sand beach that was BEAUTIFUL.

102075081.name: lovely quiet swimable beach
102075081.author: a TripAdvisor user
102075081.reviewBody: we hiked to the beach but you could drive and park about 5 minutes walk.  the beach has a bit of shade in the form of a partially collapsed palapa.  bring lunch and a towel and hang out for several hours -- possibly all by yourself.  there are no services on the beach

676026431.name: Old  Style Fishing
676026431.author: a TripAdvisor user
676026431.reviewBody: If you want to go OLD STYLE, this is your place. We came to this beach in hopes of booking a fishing trip.  However,  as exciting it was to see the boats come roaring through the waves and beach on the sand with NO DOCK, the fishing was poor.   There is no "office", no cafe or Bar.  No one I spoke to knew English so our conversations were hobbled by my very poor Spanish.  Our dreams of going fishing old style crumbled.     However, it is a very nice beach.

671898822.name: Nice beach
671898822.author: a TripAdvisor user
671898822.reviewBody:
Very quiet and relaxing beach. I do not recommend swimming in there, very brave waves.

How to get there? From Highway 19, you turn in the gravel/sand road to Hotel San Cristobal. Drive 2.5 km (5 minutes) and you will be arrived.

Experience: it is a very good place to relax, watching the fishermen doing their job, using the waves to reach the shore. There is also the San Cristobal hotel, it really looked very interesting and nice. Maybe in other time we will book in there.

The beach is full of pelicans and gulls, mostly because they want the fish on the boats. Someone told us that there is a spot where you can watch sealions, but we could not find it.

Opening Hours: all day, every day.

Cost: parking and admission are free.

Duration: 1 hour if you are just stopping by, or all day enjoying the sun.

666122313.name: Fishing area
666122313.author: a TripAdvisor user
666122313.reviewBody: You can drive right to the beach, no amenities but there is a resort hotel. Watch the fishermen bringing in their catch and locals coming to buy. There are a lot of young gulls and pelicans on the beach. You can walk for miles to the north.

650621023.name: Watched local fishermen head out for the day
650621023.author: a TripAdvisor user
650621023.reviewBody: It was absolutely fascinating watching the local fishermen loading their boats and heading out for the day.  The next time we go, we are going to pay to go out on a boat for the day.

642899532.name: Beware of aggressive dogs!
642899532.author: a TripAdvisor user
642899532.reviewBody: You could be easily skip this beach unless you have an interest in local fishermen.\nThey let their black dogs run in a pack and more that one dog has been attacked.\nMany of us won\u2019t return because of the bad vibe.

640914109.name: Drive right up to the beach by the boat launch
640914109.author: a TripAdvisor user
640914109.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful but the undertow was strong.  It is off the beaten path but worth the drive down the dirt road to get there.

629905634.name: Nice for a walk and swimming
629905634.author: a TripAdvisor user
629905634.reviewBody:
We arrived to this beach on the hotel road because the other road was full of water. We saw a local on the way and he told us to be careful because the current is very strong. 

We got to the beach and there were a few people in the hotel but nobody swimming on the beach. There were a lot of local repairing boats. 

We saw the water and we went for a swim. After you pass the waves is not so rough; there is a strong current but nothing so serious. The locals swim there too. 

If you get next to the rocks, you get showered by the waves  and you can also climb the rocks and explore.

604306073.name: Very entertaining beach
604306073.author: a TripAdvisor user
604306073.reviewBody: Rough Pacific Ocean but beautiful beach.  A section is reserved for a fishing cooperative. The boats go out early in the morning. When they return in the afternoon it\u2019s exciting to watch the boats circle then speed up and land directly on the beach. The frigates and pelicans come circling as all the fish are unloaded and sold.  One of the most magnificent locations to watch the sunset

582275356.name: nice beach
582275356.author: a TripAdvisor user
582275356.reviewBody: we went here to go on a fishing trip but the waves were too high so we just watched commercial fishing boats come in and out was a relaxing day

576657228.name: Serenity
576657228.author: a TripAdvisor user
576657228.reviewBody:
Vacant beach, nothing but waves making noise. 
We strolled past the fisherman on the south end of the beach and walked forever without seeing a soul.
The water was a bit nuts but it’s the ocean.
We shelled very little to find. Found some cool driftwood and relaxed. Exactly what we were looking for from the beach. Sigh.

571587784.name: da Bomb!
571587784.author: a TripAdvisor user
571587784.reviewBody: Punta Lobos is an authentic Baja beach experience, and the waves, and the active base for the local Todos Santos fishermen. Go their for Easter weekend for the treat of your lifetime!

569882372.name: Great, strenuous hike
569882372.author: a TripAdvisor user
569882372.reviewBody: Great hike, took about 3 hours round trip. You gotta take photos of all the views around you. No sea lion sightings but a dip in the ocean at the end (really middle) felt great. Take a swimsuit or wear something that can get wet and dry quickly for the hike back.

566856106.name: Fisherman\u2019s Beach
566856106.author: a TripAdvisor user
566856106.reviewBody: We pulled off around Km 54 on Highway 19 on our drive back to Cabo from Todos Santos at the El Faro sign. Down a dirt road, bear left and follow the signs for Hotel San Cristobal. There is an unpaved parking lot next door. Except for El Faro to the north and San Cristobal to the south, the beach is undeveloped and natural. Sadly, I read that an effort is underway to build a massive development here. For now, it\u2019s a great spot to see the local fisherman come speeding in on their small panga boats and pull straight up onto the beach! We watched a catch of yellow fin tuna being cleaned. Being on the Pacific side, I\u2019m not sure if this is a swimming beach. Be safe and ask a local before you go into the water.

566390256.name: You gotta go fishing!!!
566390256.author: a TripAdvisor user
566390256.reviewBody: used to be a sea lion colony, has been a fishing \'port\' for many years...go at 7am to see how these guys start their day...we paid $125 usd and had an AWESOME day on the pacific ocean...2 of us caught 6 sierras and 5 yellowtails (not the yellowfin tuna)...after they cleaned all the fish for us we had at least 12 lbs of fish...if you can speak their language you will do well but if not they will still make your day GREAT

562696891.name: Beautiful wild beach just south of Todos Santos
562696891.author: a TripAdvisor user
562696891.reviewBody: Wild beach (not suitable for swimming), with beautiful land and seascape and a cooperative of fisherman that will sell fish to you.

557246517.name: Local beach
557246517.author: a TripAdvisor user
557246517.reviewBody: I love this place the kids can swim and have fun and smell like fish but that only because it the local fishermens beach. I was able to buy fresh fish !

556992323.name: go early 1-2pm to see boats coming in
556992323.author: a TripAdvisor user
556992323.reviewBody: This beach is next to the new San Cristobal Hotel and may be found by turning off the highway between Todos Santos and CSL at the el Faro sign and Km marker 54 sign. Once you make the turn, just stay left and you cannot miss it.\nWe went late and missed the boats coming in but did see all the boats and watched the fishermen filleting the fish. You can buy it from them for a nice low price.\nThe beach is beautiful but we did not swim.

554961126.name: Not Just A Pedestrian Beach.
554961126.author: a TripAdvisor user
554961126.reviewBody:
I arrived around sunrise to meet my fisherman/whale watching boat. As a I made my way from Todos Santos along the dirt road, I anticipated a sleepy departure on a peaceful morning something like the 3-hour tour from Gilligan's Island. Boy did I get something different!

Yes the beach is beautiful. But I didn't have the pedestrian experience.

I was treated to an amazing display of organized chaos. Punta Lobos is the departure point for the local fishing co-op.  It took me a few minutes to appreciate the event unfolding in front of me. At first I felt a little startled. 20 or more pangas (boats) lined the beach. Men frenetically maneuvered around and between the row of boats. Amidst all the trash talking, shouting, motors revving, the men involved communicated vital information to one another in order to make this launch work.

In short, once the first boat is launched, it tows the next boat off the beach with rope efficiently contained in a milk crate, then that boat pulls the next one and so on. The fisherman unhook their pull ropes and head out into the ocean, disappearing on the shimmering horizon. 

Our boat launched at the end because it had a "guest" on board, so I got to watch each vessel depart. Wow. 

After that, I enjoyed several humpback sitings, and I reeled in 3 yellow fin tuna! An unexpected treat on my "3 Hour Tour". 

Take some coffee and park your car and watch this if you can. Then you have the solitude of a beautiful beach to enjoy.

552796634.name: This beach is a must see!
552796634.author: a TripAdvisor user
552796634.reviewBody: Don\'t be dissuaded by the long bumpy dirt road.  This beach is a must see!  We went in the afternoon around 3:30 and watched the fisherman in the "puntas" run their boats onto the beach at top speed.  The surf is high so that\'s the only safe way for them to deliver their catch to shore.  Trucks are waiting on the beach to tow them to the storage area.  The fishermen are friendly and we bought a huge red snapper.  The fisherman, who spoke excellent English, filleted it on the spot and we took it back to our house to bbq.  I later ran into the same fisherman running  the Todos Santos surf shop.

551366885.name: Sunset pursuit away from CSL
551366885.author: a TripAdvisor user
551366885.reviewBody:
We love to adventure on our own and decided to rent a car to escape CSL for a few day trips.  This venue is adjacent to the San Cristobal Hotel and may be found by turning off the highway between Todos Santos and CSL at the el Faro sign.  Once you make the turn, just stay left and you cannot miss it.

We were there around 230PM and left to find a bite and short tour of Todos Santos before returning at 5PM to watch the spectacular sunset shown below.  The beach is expansive and easy to swim.  Many whales were spotted during our brief visit.  

We plan to spend a day here to enjoy the peacefulness while catching some rays before turning home.  Only reason we can’t make this review a 5 is the limited time there.  

If you feel you need a break from the hustle bustle and peddling that has become a new custom in CSL, take a trip North!  You will find it worth the journey.

547870053.name: Uninterrupted Beauty and Solitude
547870053.author: a TripAdvisor user
547870053.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches around Todos Santos. Not great for surfing, but perfect for swimming, lounging, and walking through the soft sand. Can be a bit difficult to find, but just ask a local and you\'ll have no problem. The gates to get your car out close at sunset, as camping is not allowed here, so be sure to pack up before then. Other than that, bring some snacks, a few beers, and you are all set for a quiet and perfect day at the beach.

524687785.name: great to buy fresh fish
524687785.author: a TripAdvisor user
524687785.reviewBody: a great place to buy the freshest fish . be there at 3pm when the fisherman arrive. Buy the catch of the day

497774321.name: Great beach to watch the sunset
497774321.author: a TripAdvisor user
497774321.reviewBody: As others have written, this is the beach that the local fisherman work from, we came in the evening and drinks and some food and watch the sunset from the local bar,\n\nThe beach was clean and well organized, if you never seen the fisherman launch their boats in the morning and then see them come in, it\'s an experience, do check it out

483865365.name: Fishermen\'s Beach
483865365.author: a TripAdvisor user
483865365.reviewBody: This is where the fishermen launch from and return to. After about 1:30 you\'ll see them coming back on their pangas with their catch. Cool sight to see. It\'s also one of the few places you can swim in Todos Santos although follow the locals lead. If they aren\'t in the water then, you shouldn\'t be either. Great local scene.

483459755.name: Nice views; great fishing
483459755.author: a TripAdvisor user
483459755.reviewBody: We pulled off the main highway between Cabo San Lucas and Todos Santos to see if we could get to the water. We got to Punta Lobos just in time to see the last fishing boats coming to shore, literally. It\'s a nice view out to the water, but it looks as if the swimming would be quite a challenge. We looked, we saw, we left

473120818.name: Magnificent, Pristine Beach
473120818.author: a TripAdvisor user
473120818.reviewBody: Decent waves, endless blue sky and expansive vistas, shared with only a few surfers, fishers and pelicans

463886176.name: Reach a higher state of mind by just standing here.
463886176.author: a TripAdvisor user
463886176.reviewBody: Punta Lobos is beautiful, I wouldn\'t suggest you take swim in this beach but it will work great if you\'re looking for a analyze-your-own-conscious-thoughts-and-feelings type of walk. You\'ll find inner peace just by watching the horizon in this beach.

456055903.name: Exciting
456055903.author: a TripAdvisor user
456055903.reviewBody: Great place to catch some action when the fishermen and their boats come in with their catches for the day.

452809177.name: A Beautiful Fascinating Beach
452809177.author: a TripAdvisor user
452809177.reviewBody: Down a long dusty road is a well known town beach , as this is where the Fishermen come into shore in their Pangas(boats) about one p.m. They sell fresh fish from their boats . It\'s also a lovely beach , with nice views all along the shoreline . A must see.

444468199.name: Long stretch of almost deserted beach
444468199.author: a TripAdvisor user
444468199.reviewBody: If you want a peaceful place to relax you can walk from the turtle release program down to Punta Lopos and maybe run into a handful of people it\'s quieter up on the north end but you\'ll miss the fisherman

441245398.name: old Mexico
441245398.author: a TripAdvisor user
441245398.reviewBody: So good to make the drive into Punta Lobos to watch the fishermen rev their boats to make a landing into the beach and get pulled up by the pickup trucks, onload their fish, cut it up into filets (red snapper, sea bass, etc), and sell it to you muy barrato.  Love seeing old Mexico still alive.  Besides the whales broaching, the old church, the pelicans, the horde of black dogs sleeping in the shadows of the beached boats.  What a day.  Pretty easy drive in with the usual rental car.  Sad to see the big fat new development encroaching this special space.

419237418.name: Ya gotta see this
419237418.author: a TripAdvisor user
419237418.reviewBody: This is a place you MUST go and watch the fishing boats launch through the surf in the early morning, and being retreived in the mid afternoon.  Sometimes the fishing is good, I have seen rooster fish to 40 or so pounds caught within easy casting distance from shore.  Unfortunately, I didn\'t catchit.  You will need directions from locals.  It is at the end fo a rough dirt road

389404581.name: Peaceful hidden treasure
389404581.author: a TripAdvisor user
389404581.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I were happy to find this quiet beach and spend few ours just relaxing. It is fun to watch the fisherman driving their boats back to the sand, and you can buy the most fresh fish to take back home!

389208687.name: Want really, REALLY fresh fish?
389208687.author: a TripAdvisor user
389208687.reviewBody:
Fresh like they are just out of the water fresh. Pick what kind you want. Do you want a series of filets? Do you want a big piece of Dorado? How about a chunk of Tuna?

The local Pangas (small boats) pull up to this little cove with their fresh catch of the day. You pick what you want and a 5 gallon bucket of fish cost you between 50 and 100 pesos. Take your haul to the restaurant just down the beach and they will cook it up for you. 

Getting there is half the fun. Just outside of Todos Santos on highway 19 you will see a tiny little dirt road at KM marker 54. Take the dirt road but be very careful. It has deep sand along the way, but mostly just as you get to the beach. 

There is a Y in the road, stay to the left. Sometimes there are guards there. If you are confused ask for directions. Good Spanish is not required. 

When you get to the beach take your cooler, bucket or zip locks down and select your fresh catch. Have what you want cooked and take the rest back with you for later. 

I recommend taking a cooler of ice with you to keep your fish cold. It's an hour back to Cabo San Lucas or La Paz.  

Just remember to keep your rental car far from the sandy areas. There isn't any cell service to call for a tow truck and taking it there likely violates your rental agreement. It does for National.

384607323.name: Check Out the Local Fishermen and Their Altar
384607323.author: a TripAdvisor user
384607323.reviewBody: Come see these longtime local fishermen and check out their altar on the rocks overlooking this pretty beach. You can also see the Tres Santos beach development in progress. At this time there are no real services except guys pushing a cart or two of drinks and popsicles, but, by fall or early 2017 there should be a boutique hotel, restaurant and a beach club all on a fairly small footprint along this long stretch of beach- not your blow out Cabo resort style madness, but well thought out and mindful. You may notice some signs of opposition. The fishermen and the developers are figuring out how to accommodate each other. Tres Santos plans to construct some infrastructure for the fishermen so they will have fish cleaning and disposal facilities. Right now their operations get a little smelly.\n.

363571933.name: Secluded
363571933.author: a TripAdvisor user
363571933.reviewBody: A quiet, secluded beach from which we took boats to go whale watching, although for how much longer I don\'t know as a huge hotel is being built. Enjoy it while you can.

351612346.name: Beautiful, mostly empty, for now
351612346.author: a TripAdvisor user
351612346.reviewBody: We found this beach on accident, but consider it to be one of the real gems of our trip to Cabo.  As others have mentioned, this beach has some construction happening on the far south end, but it\'s at least 1-1.5 miles in length with virtually nothing happening to the north.  The day we went, once we had walked about .3 miles north, we were the only ones around.  This is not a swimming beach, but it is long and wide -- paradise!

351329717.name: Something fishy about this great place.
351329717.author: a TripAdvisor user
351329717.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful. There is some major construction going on nearby which in my opinion could ruin it, so go there soon. \nThe real attraction for me was the area to the left as you face the ocean. I went about 1:00 pm to watch the small fishing boats power with the waves onto the beach. They unload and dress the huge catch for all to see.  There are few tourists there so it is a great local experience. Head toward El Faro and follow the dirt road to the left ending up at the beach.

348058090.name: Authentic "working" beach
348058090.author: a TripAdvisor user
348058090.reviewBody: There was a time not that long ago when beaches had more than recreational purposes; they were also the source of many livelihoods. We witnessed this first hand when we visited Punta Lobos at around midday. A small group of local fishermen greeted us as they waited for their fellowmen to come in from the high waves (they were a few meters high when we were there). Soon enough, we spotted a little red panga in the distance. The way it was cleverly manipulated to speed all the way to -- and over and onto! -- the beach was just spectacular. We watched as the guys on the beach ran over to help the others in the boat. There were about 6 small sharks caught. They told us that shark meat can be eaten, and proceeded to clean their catch. Soon after, we noticed that there was a little black shining head bobbing in the waves. A seal! We watched as it rode the waves, almost like a real surfer. The rest of the time, we were simply mesmerized by the waves. Such big, strong currents. We didn\'t swim at all, and you probably shouldn\'t. Way too powerful. But man, this is such a special beach.\n

346413053.name: great fishing!
346413053.author: a TripAdvisor user
346413053.reviewBody: Fantastic line fishing w local fishermen in Panga boats that dock directly on the beach.  Fantastic day with Augustino.  Visit soon as there is a controversial development challenging the authenticity of this beach.

345640981.name: Beautiful beach
345640981.author: a TripAdvisor user
345640981.reviewBody: A relly nice beach, you can spend a day (just mind the sunburns) and you can easily walk to El Faro a beach club.

344129565.name: Interesting. . .
344129565.author: a TripAdvisor user
344129565.reviewBody: This is the place where the fishermen return to in the mid afternoon.  It is interesting to see the catch of the day, and to purchase a fish for dinner if you desire.  It is a nice, sandy beach.  The road is long and rough to get there, but it is doable in a rental car.

341767038.name: Great location
341767038.author: a TripAdvisor user
341767038.reviewBody: Fun place and area, close to Cabo San Lucas via blacktop drive...lots to do along the way and in the immediate arae.

341089299.name: exciting watching the boats come in!
341089299.author: a TripAdvisor user
341089299.reviewBody: After speaking to a local, she encouraged us to greet the fisherman as they come in from their day out on the ocean for some fresh fish.  Very exciting and definitely fresh fish.  Great way to meet some of the locals and get cheap, fresh eats! a bit tricky to find.....

341065723.name: Interesting
341065723.author: a TripAdvisor user
341065723.reviewBody: It was worth the short drive out of town to see the local fishermen and their boats. I didn\'t get there early enough to see the catch being brought in, but it\'s pretty and if you go early in the afternoon, you may see the fishermen bringing in their catch.

340555571.name: Fishermens Beach
340555571.author: a TripAdvisor user
340555571.reviewBody: Dont miss the chance to visit Fishermens Beach aka Punta Lobos.  This is a great place for snorkeling and kayaking, wave conditions permitting of course, and you can buy fish and lobster right off the pangas as they come in!

327282855.name: Spoiled by development
327282855.author: a TripAdvisor user
327282855.reviewBody: Last year I brought two friends to this beach to hop on a boat to try a little whale watching. It was such a memorable experience, only saw a couple of whales, two adults and a baby...but the owner of the boat caught a dorado and a yellowtail without even trying. Now, the beach has been ruined by a development called Tres Santos. They took out the mangroves and destroyed the ecosystem that flourished there.  It\'s sad to see what greed can do as they ride the catch phase "mindful, sustainable living" for their development.

327226155.name: What a Shame!
327226155.author: a TripAdvisor user
327226155.reviewBody: So sad what is happening to this once-treasured beach. The fishermen have been pushed to a dangerous, rocky corner and an ill-advised development has claimed this beach. Shame on the developers for destroying this environmentally sensitive beach along the way.

327201158.name: The ruin of a way of life
327201158.author: a TripAdvisor user
327201158.reviewBody: I\'ve been coming to Punta Lobos for 9 years to watch the fishermen bring in their pangas with their catch, to enjoy the small lagoon with the quaint chapel and abundant bird life and marvel at and walk the unspoiled expanse of pure sand beach heading north from the massive outcrop of rock that protects the fishing beach. Unspoiled. That was the key word and in years past I would have given Punta Lobos 5 stars for those reasons. It\'s true there was sometimes trash and there are no facilities, but it was perfect none the less. It was a place where Mexican families came to camp during Semana Santa and there were always a few families there enjoying the beach no matter what time of year. It historically has been an important recreation and fishing beach for the people of Todos Santos and beyond for as long as anyone can remember.\nNow I considered giving it 1 star. The new development, Tres Santos, that uses the words "sustainable" and "mindful" to promote its giant development that will effectively swallow Todos Santos has ruined the beach for the fishermen by building a giant seawall that is deteriorating even before it is finished and has a huge pile of rocks in front of it that have damaged pangas, their motors and transmissions. In frustration and anger the fishermen closed access to the building site in late October demanding answers to irregularities. So if you did not come before now, you missed it. \nI still recommend seeing for yourself what greed and arrogance can do to a pristine place.

291605492.name: Ya gotta go here
291605492.author: a TripAdvisor user
291605492.reviewBody: Ya gotta go here in the early morning to see the fishing boats launched through the surf, and in the early afternoon to watch them come in with their catch.

284283355.name: Interesting to see the fihermen returning with teir catch
284283355.author: a TripAdvisor user
284283355.reviewBody: The road is a bad washboard and the beach is not what it used to be any more with the new development started. Still, if you want to see the fishermen racing back onto the beach, they useually arrive late morning or early afternoon, it\'s quite something to watch. Also there is a good climbing rock formation, a trail that leads to the old marina (about 1 and 1/2 hours one way) and a little chapel to see.

272408899.name: Wonderful!  Pelicans, fishermen, surf!  BUT HURRY
272408899.author: a TripAdvisor user
272408899.reviewBody: I cannot believe that they\'re building a huge condo development right on this magical beach.  It will never be the same once this is completed.  It was so great...go now!

266903545.name: Semi hard to get to
266903545.author: a TripAdvisor user
266903545.reviewBody: Ya gotta see the fishing boats launched at dawn and come in in the early afternoon.  \'Neat"!  Watch that day\'s catch be unloaded and cleaned.

266506686.name: Beach with fishermen
266506686.author: a TripAdvisor user
266506686.reviewBody: This is a lovely beach, fine for swimming, and not far from Todos Santos.  The local fishermen come in here and you can buy their fresh catch, and watch their effortless skill in cleaning the days haul.    No services or facilities.

246106211.name: Very nice fishermans landing
246106211.author: a TripAdvisor user
246106211.reviewBody: We purchased fish directly from the fisherman as they came to shore here. For $20.00 us we were able to buy enough fresh fish to last several days. A fun spot to visit.

242991251.name: Interesting place to be in lots of birds and local fisherman.
242991251.author: a TripAdvisor user
242991251.reviewBody: The fisherman culture it\'s found in this place, beautiful view of the sierra de la Laguna natural biosphere.

240828977.name: Enjoy it before its gone.
240828977.author: a TripAdvisor user
240828977.reviewBody: Punta Lobos is a place where the local fisherman have been launching their "pangas" for 100 years or more. To watch this is an awesome experience! The "pangas" are basically a small boat with an outboad engine that might fit about 6-8 people. The first boat paddles out dragging a rope. This rope is then used to tow out the second boat which in turn pulls out the third and so on. The area is very rural and beautiful. Unfortunately a large U.S. developer with lots of money is using the land to built a huge "planned community" that will encompass the entire area so if you can get there enjoy it before its gone.

238379675.name: Fishermans Beach
238379675.author: a TripAdvisor user
238379675.reviewBody:
Difficult to find, but neat to watch the fisherman leave in the morning.  We stayed at Los Colibris and was easiest for me to run down the beach in the a.m.  Finding by car is more difficult and challenging.  

The fisherman all tie together and fight the waves one boat at a time as they head out for a day of fishing.  Entertaining to watch.  Need to arrive around 6:30 a.m.? to see the first boat go out which is the biggest "event'.  The boats after that have help from the boat that went before them.  Not sure how else to describe this.  At 7:30 they were still heading out 1 by 1.  They return between 1-3 p.m.'ish.  Interesting to see them return with their daily catch including shark.  They will sell their catch to you if you like.  We did not so cannot tell you the price.  

Worth the effort and an early morning trip!

237582817.name: Not a place to stay or eat
237582817.author: a TripAdvisor user
237582817.reviewBody: The draw about Punta Lobos is that this is where local fishermen launch and retrieve their pangas.  Ya just gotta see this.  Come very early to see the launch (sun-up) and early afternoon to the the retrieval.  You will not be disappointed.

230005891.name: No AAA Here!
230005891.author: a TripAdvisor user
230005891.reviewBody:
Just outside Todos Santos is a rather difficult to find beach of endless sand and crashing waves.  You will wish you had a 4 wheel drive vehicle at times as your wheels sickeningly spin in the sometimes hub cap deep back beach area before you get to the more hard packed sand and the beach itself.

We were lucky to have had a bit of guidance from a local that was waving us away from a branch in the road I was about to take.  If I had done so, we probably would have been enjoying the hospitality of the sea gulls for more hours than we had planned as that side of the road (and I use the term "road" loosely) was nothing but tire sucking soft sand.

Nice expanse of beach with rather a solitary feel to it as there were no fisherman or other tourists there when we went.  Just a good spot to catch some rays if you are so inclined and relax with a couple of Modelos from the ice chest that you intelligently purchased while shopping at Aramburo's while you digest the wonderful meal you just had at Cafe Santa Fe and wonder how the folks back home are doing as they sit in rush hour traffic.

207592542.name: The fishing fleet comes ashore
207592542.author: a TripAdvisor user
207592542.reviewBody: The boats launch from the beach at dawn and return in the afternoon by running up the beach on a wave. You can buy whole or filleted fish fresh from a boat.

199333398.name: Pangas
199333398.author: a TripAdvisor user
199333398.reviewBody: Fun to watch the pangas race in.  The road is the only reason it\'s not a 5.  Sweet little chapel, beautiful beach and hungry (not angry) birds.

193009007.name: Hard to find
193009007.author: a TripAdvisor user
193009007.reviewBody: Unlike the well marked roads to big towns or cities, this was a challenge to find. Along with road construction and lack of any signage, it took us a couple of rides out to the location. But it was worth the travel. Watching the boats pull onto the beach was a skill that has to be done with experience. Plus . . .\nall those birds \'looking for a hand-out\' would be unnerving, if it was done for the first time.\nIf we were staying for more days, we could have bartered our way to a fresh fish dinner.

192856669.name: A chance to interact with local fishermen
192856669.author: a TripAdvisor user
192856669.reviewBody: We had scheduled a whale watching trip that used local fishermen as guides and were scheduled to leave from Punta Lobo. The trip was postponed twice and eventually canceled due to high surf. Both days the surf was so high that the local fishermen refused to go out. We did have a chance to watch how the boats were set up and did see three boats try to make it out into the waves. There is a small chapel nearby for the fishermen. We also got a chance to visit with the local folks which was interesting.

187813450.name: You can rate this beach?
187813450.author: a TripAdvisor user
187813450.reviewBody: This is where we came to launch a snorkel tour. It serves that purpose well enough. It was busy with local fishermen and as the only gringo couple,  I felt a little out of place - although they were all fascinated and amused at the sight of me wriggling into my wet suit. When we got back I was bummed to see that somebody stole my boyfriend\'s flip flops out of the back of the dive shop\'s pick up. Really?!

182017293.name: Big Beautiful Beach
182017293.author: a TripAdvisor user
182017293.reviewBody: There is a nice swimming area here where the Pacific won\'t rough you up too badly.  Lots of locals here and it is actually the area where local fisherman launch and bring back their catch. There is a very long almost deserted beach

165239003.name: The place to go for fresh fish
165239003.author: a TripAdvisor user
165239003.reviewBody: Get to Punta Lobos a little after midday for one; obviously the fresh fish at real cheap prices (3 big mackerel for 50 pesos), and two; it\'s great to watch the activity as the fisherman bring their boats up on to the beach. I reckon they could charge tourists just for that experience!! I have also been here in February and saw a massive whale playing in the water less than 50 metres off the beach. From the road leading to Lobos is a walking track that takes you over to Puerto Viejo. It is about an hours walk but well worth it once you get up on top of the cliffs and walk down to the little bay. There is very little left of the construction of Puerto Viejo and it is where the Spanish loaded up their galleons with all the goodies they could find in Baja.

155063221.name: Fishermans beach
155063221.author: a TripAdvisor user
155063221.reviewBody: Also know as Fisherman\'s beach because that is where the fishermen in Todos launch their boats for the days fishing. That is also where they clean their fish, that is why the lower rating. It might be not clean enough for most folks, but it is a nice beach if you walk down away from the fisherman area. You can sometime arrive just in time for them to bring in their catch and buy right from them. Can\'t get any fresher fish than that. Watching the boat launch or come in is quite exciting. I actually went whale watching from there. We got on the boat at the beach and another fishing boat pulled us out. When it was time to come back, we did what the other boats did. The boat waits for the "right" wave and speeds right onto the beach. The whales don\'t get as close to the boats as in Magdelana Bay up north, but seeing parts of the coast that me could not see otherwise was well worth the trip.

133462225.name: Boat Landing
133462225.author: a TripAdvisor user
133462225.reviewBody: Launched kayaks at the beach here with La Sirena Eco-Adventures and bought fresh fish from the fishermen landing in the afternoon.

132764728.name: Catch of the Day
132764728.author: a TripAdvisor user
132764728.reviewBody: Go to Punta Lobos in the afternoos to buy fresh fish off the pangas as they come in.

128494594.name: Fresh fish and crabs
128494594.author: a TripAdvisor user
128494594.reviewBody: Cool piece of local culture. Bought crabs straight off the boat. Saw lots of pelicans but no sea lions...but watching the boats come in was really cool.

125202399.name: photogenic location
125202399.author: a TripAdvisor user
125202399.reviewBody: A long and beautiful walk on the beach. Photogenic location

124394299.name: Truly an authentic fishing village experience
124394299.author: a TripAdvisor user
124394299.reviewBody: if you are lucky enough to have some serious time while visiting Todos Santos, you MUST experience watching the local panga fishermen return to shore with their catch of the day. It is one of those memorable travel stories to tell back home, and for those of us who live here, the best way to buy the fish you\'ll be cooking that night. Many of the beaches around Todos Santos are accessed off the main highway on rough, dirt roads. Punto Lobos is an interesting ride...past the ruins of the old canning facilities (which you can pull over and explore, or hike up the trail to the top of the hill and view the old harbor and sea lion rookery), and the charming little church where the fishermen have prayed for their safety for many years.  if you go around 2pm....you will start to see the pangas arrive...and the whole beach eventually turns into a marketplace, much like I have seen in other parts of the world like India, Thailand, and in Caribbean countries. They wait for just the right wave to ride into shore as they rev their motors to propel them onto the sand.  it is quite a sight and also quite a thrill ride if you happen to be in the boat....you can choose to go out early in the day to fish with them!\nEach boat seems to have a full load of whatever is running that day...Sierra, Pierna, Red Snapper, etc...all delicious.  They can clean the fish for you, too. If you come a bit later and miss the fun of the boats surfing to shore, you can still catch your catch under the structure built for cleaning the fish and for selling to the local chefs.\nI highly recommend this little side trip..and kids love it, too.

123331017.name: Fun for watching the fishing boats enter and leave the surf, but not much else.
123331017.author: a TripAdvisor user
123331017.reviewBody: It\'s a long, dusty, dirt road to the beach.  There was a lot of trash and there are places you could get caught in the sand.  But, it\'s very entertaining to watch the fishing boats.  Come to the beach around 1:00pm and for a couple of hours you can watch the fishermen return with their catch.

668996159.name: A good place to watch the sunset
668996159.author: a TripAdvisor user
668996159.reviewBody: We have visited this place two times in the last few years. We like to see the baby turtles run to the sea.  It is also a great place to see the sunset near todos Santos

address.streetAddress: Camino a Las Playitas Between Calle Los Mangos & Camino Internacional

658547247.name: Worth it!
658547247.author: a TripAdvisor user
658547247.reviewBody:
If you're travelling alone or a busy family then you'll definitely want to take time for this as its important and a great way to have a relaxing few hours enjoying the sights!! 
it is a bit of a trek to get to as you have to go down a bunch of little street and As we were driving to the place we thought we were lost, but we trusted the map and it was right! It seems as if the road ends and you're sitting in a random neighbourhood but the small road actually leads down to a parking lot right next to the shelter.The small greenhouse sat right at the top of the beach waiting for the sun to set! 
You will want to arrive BEFORE sunset as they do a great little presentation about the turtles and the dangers they face! They bring babies turtles out for you to observe and take pictures of as they explain what they do! We got there a bit early as we didn't know that it was a sunset release so we sat in the sand and enjoyed all the whale activity!! (there were tons!!!) plus the beach is quite long so you can go for a walk! Then sunset came and it was beautiful! 
The release was exciting and heartwarming knowing these volunteers are putting so much time and effort and love into this project - they also have shirts and books you can buy to help them keep up and running (worth it!) - and you leave with a full heart after watching these adorable babies start their lives in the world.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Las Playitas Between Calle Los Mangos & Camino Internacional

655710516.name: The best thing we did in Todos Santos
655710516.author: a TripAdvisor user
655710516.reviewBody: This is a small, volunteer-run organization that protects, hatches and releases sea turtles at sunset during the winter months. Visitors are welcome -- there were at least 40 people there last week. Donations are welcome, and necessary.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Las Playitas Between Calle Los Mangos & Camino Internacional

655203028.name: Biologist for a Day program - I\'m so glad I did this!
655203028.author: a TripAdvisor user
655203028.reviewBody:
This was such a great experience!  If all you can do is come for the hatchling release  at dusk, then do it - it's an emotional experience watching the tiny turtles slowly make their way into the big pounding waves of the Pacific Ocean (just don't use flash when you take pictures)!  

But if you want more, I highly recommend their "Biologist for a Day" program which they offer for a small fee.  I was fortunate enough to be there on a day when two Olive Ridley turtle nests were finishing hatching and they were "excavating" those nests so I got to help, after they showed me a special way to clean my hands.  So this is an opportunity to be hands-on, unlike if you only come for the release.  And if you can be flexible with which hours you help out, and/or which days of that week you can help, that would increase your chances of having a full experience.  The reason is because just like human babies, turtles are born when they're born, not on schedule.  I spent four hours during the day at their "greenhouse" on the beach, checking for newborn turtles digging their way up from the nests and listening to senior volunteers talk with people passing by and giving out information.  They were so enthusiastic and passionate, it was great!  Then I came back later that same day to help dig out any last stragglers that were still making their way up out of the nest along with the eggshells from the nests so we could count and record them all, which was an amazing experience.
