473919293.reviewBody: Clean and orderly, a beautiful church.  But no stations of the cross! First time in a Catholic church/mission where they weren\'t present. Well worth a visit which offered a quiet moment to pray for peace in this crazy world

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

470999871.name: If you are into rural Mexican History this just might interest you
470999871.author: a TripAdvisor user
470999871.reviewBody: You can\'t miss the misione.  The town is small and this, I think, is the highest structure in town.  It has an interesting history, and if you know anything about the mission system that was built to go up the Pacific Coast into the US you might like to see this most southern part of the system.  The building is very simple, like most of the missions.  Very tranquil.  A place to think!

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

468136456.name: Nice Sight
468136456.author: a TripAdvisor user
468136456.reviewBody: Located in Todos Santos, it was a stop on our visit. It is nice from the outside as well as the inside. It has a lot of history, part of the Missions in Mexico and California, that came to impose Catholicism on the local pagans.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

464093114.name: Old world charm.
464093114.author: a TripAdvisor user
464093114.reviewBody: A beautiful Mission in a beautiful town. There were many local people there for a event. They eve invited us to join them. Warm and friendly people.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

463880554.name: Well kept church in downtown Todos Santos
463880554.author: a TripAdvisor user
463880554.reviewBody: Not a big fan of church buildings myself but I\'ve gotta admit this one is always looking great. Inside and outside. Worth getting to know it, it has a huge terrace outside with a nice view to the south side of the town and lots of palm trees.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

460795367.name: Mission church
460795367.author: a TripAdvisor user
460795367.reviewBody: Mission church established in 1700s. Important part of Mexican, Baja history. Easy to get to. Across from plaza. Excellent example of an early mission.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

457969726.name: Nice History and Pleasant inside
457969726.author: a TripAdvisor user
457969726.reviewBody: Four of us went to Todos Santos (one had not been there before), so one of our first stops was the Mission Church -- next to the open lot that was filled with local artesanos. The first-timer was really impressed and she wanted some photos to take back home to show her congregation. It was quiet inside (until a ship tour arrived).

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

451340782.name: Active Spirit of Prayer
451340782.author: a TripAdvisor user
451340782.reviewBody:
The front part of the Church, now a vestibule/chapel, IS the original Mission.  The expanded Church is perpendicular to it and obviously newer.  

Confessions are heard at 6 p.m. on Thursdays, in the original Mission.  You line up for Confession by sitting on the left (Marian) side of pews, and people kind of move forward in the pews to have Confession heard by priest.  [I'm unsure about his English, but you can always use a translator in a Sacramental Confession (who is also bound by the seal) if you need...]  

Sunday Mass is at noon.  The one priest says 5 Masses on Sunday around Todos Santos, so this is the only one offered at the Mission on Sunday.  I think daily Mass is otherwise at 6 p.m. in the winter (7 p.m. in the summer -- Standard Time)  But one must verify by asking around -- this isn't posted anywhere.  

Visitors, please be respectful of the Sanctuary -- all are welcome, but this is a Church, not a museum!  :-)

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

449621088.name: The Most Historical Attraction in Town
449621088.author: a TripAdvisor user
449621088.reviewBody: We went in on Christmas Eve . The Nativity scene was lovely . The building has been restored , but it still has the character of the early Mission . It is lovely and serene , we said a Christmas prayer .

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

440660156.name: completely refurbished, nice but not historical
440660156.author: a TripAdvisor user
440660156.reviewBody: if you are in town, drop in. It is a nice church, but don\'t expect a historical mission as it is completely refurbished.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

423564982.name: A nice place to visit
423564982.author: a TripAdvisor user
423564982.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours wandering around the town. The mission is really a lovely little spot with a nice view right near by.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

411841529.name: Beautiful little church
411841529.author: a TripAdvisor user
411841529.reviewBody: What a classic piece of history that was key to the settlement and development of Todos Santos.. In the song, Hotel California, it is her mission bells you hear from each of the 13 boutique rooms...:)

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

398791812.name: A beautiful, charming church from the 1700\'s
398791812.author: a TripAdvisor user
398791812.reviewBody: We loved exploring this church with its history and beauty. In walking distance from Hotel California.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

382319092.name: Visit to Mission
382319092.author: a TripAdvisor user
382319092.reviewBody: We make a point of visiting early Missions wherever we are as they have so much history.  We were a little disappointed as this was rebuilt so very little remained of the original mission.  It still is worth a trip, and the surrounding town is just charming.  Thoroughly enjoyed our day to Tados Santos.  This is an active Church.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

374319574.name: Historical Church in Todos Santos
374319574.author: a TripAdvisor user
374319574.reviewBody: We visited Todos Santos during our trip to Cabo in April. We stopped to see the Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar. It\'s a nice church with a real congregation. Very serene atmosphere. Worth checking out if you\'re in Todos Santos.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

368214313.name: Memorably beautiful!
368214313.author: a TripAdvisor user
368214313.reviewBody: The Mission de Santa Rosa in Todos Santos is such a beautiful, moving place that is a must-see if you are ever in the area.  The architectural details and old history both inside and outside of the Mission take your breath away!  I found it so peaceful inside and loved to just sit and take in all of the details.  Such a beautiful piece of history in such a beautiful town!  The Mission is open for open prayer and you will be able to sit at the altar as well as walk through the courtyard.  I plan to go every time we travel to Cabo/Todos Santos!  It\'s an experience you won\'t forget!

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

367644159.name: Average small mission
367644159.author: a TripAdvisor user
367644159.reviewBody: Another classic small church that dots the Baja by the missionaries. Not as colourful as it used to be or in the best of shape.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

362904639.name: Pleasant Peaceful Simple Mission
362904639.author: a TripAdvisor user
362904639.reviewBody: Everyone knows you can hear the Mission bells from the Hotel California...   This Mission was pleasant and quiet but not overly adorned with artwork, decorations, etc.   Nice enough, nothing outstanding.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

359163449.name: Small typical colonial church
359163449.author: a TripAdvisor user
359163449.reviewBody: Small typical colonial mission! It is always nicer to see this church when there is some kind of celebration to see the social life but appart from that it is very simple!

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

358009315.name: Simple Mission Church
358009315.author: a TripAdvisor user
358009315.reviewBody: The Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar in located next to the Hotel California.  It is up the hill and a short walk on the main street in town.  You can visit this church in  few minutes and if you are in Todos Santos for the day, a quick pop in is recommended.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

354604083.name: Short Stop at the Mission
354604083.author: a TripAdvisor user
354604083.reviewBody: Make sure to stop by and see the mission, but only briefly. It is very plain in both interior and exterior design making it not the most aesthetically pleasing religious site I have been to. Rather its simplicity is where the beauty really exists. Look carefully and you can find a few remnants of the mission\'s colonial past.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

339601613.name: pray
339601613.author: a TripAdvisor user
339601613.reviewBody: I have always loved this church. Everyone is friendly. I was there for the blessing of The Bikers!!  60 motorcycles! It was beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

336508595.name: Heard the Mission Bell Ring
336508595.author: a TripAdvisor user
336508595.reviewBody: A trip to Todos Santos should include a visit to the mission on the square.  Classic, simple spot with local sculptures inside. It is easy to imagine years ago people gathering around the mission and praying together as a community.We visited right after Christmas so the ornate, sweet manger scene was still on the altar. \n

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

333780466.name: The Mission 2015
333780466.author: a TripAdvisor user
333780466.reviewBody: A great OLD building with lots to see. The town is full of old buildings and lots of history. Well worth stopping by if you are in the area.....

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

330435720.name: Historic Church - als mentioned in Eagle Lyrics of Hotel California - Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar
330435720.author: a TripAdvisor user
330435720.reviewBody:
We visited the Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar. It is very close to the Hotel California.  In the famous Eagle's song about Hotel California they mention it as part of the lyrics to the song - 

There she stood in the doorway;
I heard the mission bell
And I was thinking to myself,
"This could be Heaven or this could be Hell"

As such, it was interesting to see the church.  I also liked the religious parts of seeing the church with the altar area and the statues of Jesus.  There is a nice plaque that describes the mission just outside the entrance doors.

The mission was founded by Jaime Bravo in 1723. It is an active church today.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

319414691.name: Don\'t make the drive just for the church.
319414691.author: a TripAdvisor user
319414691.reviewBody: This is a pretty church obviously in use by the locals. It really is NOT the original structure nor is there anything in evidence or available to explore of the original mission.  For information and as the history, there is 1 fairly undetailed plaque outside the doors.  If you are coming to Todos Santos it\'s worth taking a look at but don\'t make the drive thinking you\'re taking a  tour of an old Spanish mission.\nI\'m not criticising the church, it\'s nice.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

298427906.name: Take a moment
298427906.author: a TripAdvisor user
298427906.reviewBody: What a nice and clean Mission with a quaint view of the town and its people.  It does not take long to visit so, I would suggest you may a quick stop in to see this historic mission.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

293528408.name: Don\'t miss the Classic Mission in the center of town.
293528408.author: a TripAdvisor user
293528408.reviewBody: To my understanding this mission dedicated in 1792 is the furthest south of the all father Serra missions. Go ahead stand at the door and enter respectfully. It is the real center of Catholicism in the area. Our Christmas guests often attend  high mass and are not disappointed even if it is too full to gain entry\n    Note that if you goggle for the Tropic of Cancer in Todos Santos you find it flows right thru the Cathedral.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

293065116.name: Very nice
293065116.author: a TripAdvisor user
293065116.reviewBody: We were lucky to show up there when there was a wedding service. It seemed local and everyone was dressed up for it there were so many people they were spilling out the front door , yet were able to get up there for a closer look. It`s a very unique looking church and i especially enjoyed the warm smell of colitas rising up through the air.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

289339721.name: Nice Clean Architecture
289339721.author: a TripAdvisor user
289339721.reviewBody: Unlike many cathedrals and churches in Latin America, this one is really simple with nice clean lines from an architectural standpoint.  Although it\'s not ornate it\'s still impressive with a beautiful stained glass window behind the altar.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

264512996.name: Iglesia Nuestra Se\u00f1ora del Pilar Todos Santos
264512996.author: a TripAdvisor user
264512996.reviewBody: Our Lady of Pilar Church (English translation)  is the most recognized place of worship in the small populated city of Todos Santos. This church was originally one of the first four missions of the 28 that were constructed by the Spaniards as they ventured farther and farther north along the Baja Peninsula, founding missions and settlements along the way.  The soft-yellow-painted Catholic church structure with white trim, is a post card style Colonial building that was reconstructed in 1747. The Todos Santos Catholic Church is open 9 a.m.\u20135 p.m.,\u00a0Monday\u00a0through\u00a0Sunday.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

242134585.name: It\'s all relative
242134585.author: a TripAdvisor user
242134585.reviewBody: Most of the little towns of the Baja California peninsula that I have seen have little churches to match. This one was relatively large and very peaceful and pretty.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

198978794.name: A replica, not original.
198978794.author: a TripAdvisor user
198978794.reviewBody: Thought it was the original church but it is a recently constructed replica of the church. Doesn\'t feel old world or particularly Catholic. Not really historic.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

194201176.name: Quiet and beautiful church
194201176.author: a TripAdvisor user
194201176.reviewBody: When in Cabo San Lucas on our Panama Canal Cruise, we took the "Todos Santos & Hotel California" tour. We went up the cost to the town of Todos Santos. One of our stops was at the Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar. We found it to be a peaceful and quiet place, around the corner from Hotel California and all the bustling touristy places. We enjoy looking at old churches, and found this one to be decorated less elegantly than some we\'ve seen, but with a simple beauty of its own. It is light inside and clean and well-maintained. The stained glass is beautiful. Definitely worth our time. Lots of pretty flowers and architectural things in the plaza for picture taking.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

188629189.name: Beautiful and Serene
188629189.author: a TripAdvisor user
188629189.reviewBody: The Mission is right beside the Hotel California. It was very quiet when I was there with no mass occurring. The inside is beautifully decorated and is well worth checking out if you are in the area.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

182999547.name: Beautiful church
182999547.author: a TripAdvisor user
182999547.reviewBody: This 300 year old church is just a block from Hotel California.  The church is very quaint and rich in heritage.  The church boats a bronze sculpture of Mary, Joseph and Jesus,  by artist Benito Ortega Vargas.  I had the great pleasure of meeting him, at his studio which is less than 100 yards from the church.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

170729244.name: Lovely serene church
170729244.author: a TripAdvisor user
170729244.reviewBody: I found myself in front of the church and went in, sat down and stayed for the Spanish mass. I felt welcomed, even though I didn\'t participate. What a lovely experience. I watched families sing and pray, while I did my own praying. I always like going into different churches, temples etc. in different countries. This small church was a beautiful experience

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

154779982.name: Plain...kinda boring
154779982.author: a TripAdvisor user
154779982.reviewBody: I know, I know --- it\'s a church not Disneyland but I thought it was just plain and quaint.  Nothing to write home about.  I have been to some spectacular churches and missions in my travels and just felt blah about this one.  Don\'t strike me down but if you miss it - no biggie.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

151857225.name: Worth a look inside
151857225.author: a TripAdvisor user
151857225.reviewBody: The Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar is a beautiful, well preserved mission church. It won\'t take much of your time to see the church, so stop by and have a look inside. The stained glass windows and the simple decorations are very beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

131215981.name: Lovely church
131215981.author: a TripAdvisor user
131215981.reviewBody: Well-kept, cool, clean church. Definitely worth a stop in

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

124031355.name: Famous Mission of rock legend
124031355.author: a TripAdvisor user
124031355.reviewBody: Yes, this is the mission that is mentioned in the famous Eagle\'s song, Hotel California.  As a matter of fact, the hotel and restaurant are just down the block from the mission, and I\'m sure you could "hear the mission bells" from either.  This is a very old but extremely well kept mission, which is still in use today.  It has the most beautiful etched glass windows depicting the stations of the cross.  Truly a sight to see, plus there is a nice little hidden courtyard to the one side of the mission, which was a nice addition.\n\nShould you ever find youself in Los Santos, make a stop here.  It will be well worth your time.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

89799771.name: A must see on the plaza and for Todos Santos
89799771.author: a TripAdvisor user
89799771.reviewBody: While the interior may seem bland to some - consider this mission\'s age and standing within the community and symbolically it\'s above all other structures. Well taken care of and I\'ve been there for Mass before - all are welcome whether native or tourist.

address.streetAddress: Plaza De Todos Santos

662044796.name: Amazing Artist, gorgeous studio
662044796.author: a TripAdvisor user
662044796.reviewBody: Do yourself a favor and stop into Jill Logan\'s Gallery....you will find amazing art and if you\'re lucky Jill will be there making something wonderful !

659374658.name: Friendly and great service in this gallery
659374658.author: a TripAdvisor user
659374658.reviewBody: Stopped by Jill Logan Gallery and was most impresssed with the large collections by herself and other artists she admires.  Spent time talking with Hannah about a particular piece.  After lunch stopped by again and made a deal to purchase a wonderful framed piece of art.  Jill graciously checked the price to ship to the US and then I decided to take it home on the plane.  She professionally packaged it as if it was to be shipped at no cost.\nIt is hanging in my dining room now and is a great asset to the room.

656673774.name: Impressive gallery of diverse art
656673774.author: a TripAdvisor user
656673774.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the Galeria Logan, which not only features local artist Jill Logan\'s superb landscapes and her other subjects and styles, but other artists whose work she displays. As a Wisconsin native, I was surprised to see Kaukauna artist Lee Mothes\' incredible detailed graphite work of wave action. The gallery is a must see if you are in Todos Santos. Skip the Hotel California and see art that will resonate with you.

642467667.name: \'Norte De La Paz\' Amazing Art! Totally Underrated! Worth A Visit!
642467667.author: a TripAdvisor user
642467667.reviewBody:
Totally worth a visit, Her landscapes are out of this world! Some of the 'shimmering' works were not to our taste--but definitely worth a visit!

Our favorite piece was 'Norte De La Paz'--wish they have 3 X 2 lithos of this one--will work in almost any house from modern to traditional...

We were happy to actually meet a talented artist, wish you all future success because your paintings are inspired!

640005677.name: Wonderful works
640005677.author: a TripAdvisor user
640005677.reviewBody: My friends and I were fortunate to visit and meet the artist, Jill Logan.  Not only is her art eclectic and beautiful, Jill is an outstanding artist who is humble and gracious.  My friend, who is an art collector, spent significant time exploring the gallery and discussing individual pieces with Jill.  My friend was so impressed, she decided to make a purchase and ship it to the U.S.  Todos Santos is one of the best kept secrets in the area and so is Galeria Logan.  If you have a chance, I encourage you to visit and enjoy..

627719609.name: Beautiful gallery
627719609.author: a TripAdvisor user
627719609.reviewBody: Read reviews on trip advisor and walked into this beautiful gallery. We bought a reproduction which will remind us always of this trip.

577941647.name: Jill was painting!
577941647.author: a TripAdvisor user
577941647.reviewBody: Nice gallery.  There is a fine collection of her prints.  She was painting a version of one of her earlier works while we were there trying to get just the right shade of green.

572335513.name: Expressive----Energetic!
572335513.author: a TripAdvisor user
572335513.reviewBody:
Unique presentation of murals----broken tiles---as the art form. Oil paints are very alive and energetic----
Strolling through her Gallery---phases of interest are definitive--Banners are expressive---
Ambiance suggests maturity throughout Her background.
Quite fascinating!
Recommended.

565185558.name: Lovely art and mosaics
565185558.author: a TripAdvisor user
565185558.reviewBody: We really enjoyed walking through this gallery and meeting the artist who was working in a back room.

559881733.name: Beautiful gallery and Jill Logan does some outstanding work
559881733.author: a TripAdvisor user
559881733.reviewBody: We dropped in during the recent gallery tour and met Jill and are considering one of her more expensive pieces of work. The works ranged from lithographs to originals and there were lots of pieces to look at. The gallery is conveniently located and th artist herself, was extremely pleasant (very busy ) and explained her work and process she uses. We will go back again when it is a little quieter and look some more. If you are in Todos Santos, you should drop in and visit!

550292532.name: Gallery with lots of nice work
550292532.author: a TripAdvisor user
550292532.reviewBody: Took a browse through the gallery. The artwork is really nice and the artist was very accommodating and knowledgeable. Definitely worth a visit!

543605143.name: Beautiful work by three artisits
543605143.author: a TripAdvisor user
543605143.reviewBody: We rented van with my adult children for a day off the beaten path. We made our way up to Todos Santos for a small town experience. There were many galleries to visit all with their unique talent. This one was the only gallery that had prints to purchase in various sizes and greeting cards of the work that was displayed. This was not only a gallery but also served as their studies. We saw some very nice artwork.

499653994.name: Some Beautiful Art
499653994.author: a TripAdvisor user
499653994.reviewBody: Certainly worth a visit if you like to view art. Jill Logan was actually there when we visited and helped us select a couple of lithographs of hers that we are bringing home to frame.

463521376.name: Lots of Talent
463521376.author: a TripAdvisor user
463521376.reviewBody: Jill has a great talent and we were lucky enough to find her working in her studio, explaining some of her techniques. Her artwork is can be found throughout Todos Santos as well as her studio.

460517703.name: very nicely laid out gallery with an interesting mix of styles
460517703.author: a TripAdvisor user
460517703.reviewBody: We enjoyed the water colours from Jill and the beautiful waves from Lee.  An interesting change was the decorative cow and horse skulls on display.

457472075.name: Artist at Work
457472075.author: a TripAdvisor user
457472075.reviewBody: When we were there the artist was also there working on a project involving goldleafing and copper leaf. She showed and explained it to us, which we appreciated. There was also work y other artists. Logan is an accomplished painter of scenes of the area and now abstract mediums.

453518699.name: Gem and soulful
453518699.author: a TripAdvisor user
453518699.reviewBody: We went into the gallery on a whim...not looking to buy. Ended up buying some jewelry and a mosaic skull. The owner/artist Jill and Linda/artist were kind.  I wanted to purchase a painting as well and didn\'t -- should have! \nI would go back there...the town and the shop felt like home to me.

397252182.name: Lovely gallery
397252182.author: a TripAdvisor user
397252182.reviewBody: This gallery has rooms displaying originals and prints as well as a lovely outdoor area. The owner/artist, Jill, is very nice and informative.

357042949.name: A visual treat!
357042949.author: a TripAdvisor user
357042949.reviewBody: During our recent visit to Todos Santos, we cruised into the Galeria Logan, one of many in the town. The first impression upon entering the building was the richness and vibrance of the art AND the building itself. It was truly a visual treat. The collection is impressive and quite diverse from an incredibly detailed pencil drawing of waves to the bold vibrance of the Baja light that the artist, Jill Logan, captures so well in her expressive art. Definitely worth a browse. Only drawback, the Galeria is closed on Sundays.

354923478.name: A feast for the eyes...
354923478.author: a TripAdvisor user
354923478.reviewBody: We stopped in several galleries, and this one was by far my favorite.  The art by the owner and two other artists she was exhibiting was sophisticated, well executed, and approachable.

344129925.name: Great gallery, wonderful space
344129925.author: a TripAdvisor user
344129925.reviewBody: Really interesting art here, but the space is the thing I liked best, from the rock inlaid exterior to the gardens in the back and all the way through the interior of the gallery.  It just felt good to be there.

330425437.name: Always Wonderful
330425437.author: a TripAdvisor user
330425437.reviewBody: Treat Yourself....take a stroll through Jill Logan\'s studio and gallery.  The work is impressive and very special.

308780143.name: Perfect Gift
308780143.author: a TripAdvisor user
308780143.reviewBody: Bought a beautiful painting for my dad. I found the perfect thank you gift for all he did for me for my wedding at Hacienda Cerritos.  I was able to meet the artist.  I was very impressed with the gallery and kindness of all the employees.

303751456.name: Beautiful Art in Todos Santos
303751456.author: a TripAdvisor user
303751456.reviewBody: Jill Logan is a delight! Her varied works of art are refreshing and her passion for painting is evident.

300289991.name: Talented artist
300289991.author: a TripAdvisor user
300289991.reviewBody: Made a stop here while in todos santos. We met the artist, very talented. If you are in the area, you must stop by here. If you can\'t afford to splurge on her original works of art, she has a great selection of reprints

297262507.name: Love Jill Logan Galeria
297262507.author: a TripAdvisor user
297262507.reviewBody: A lovely drive from Cabo San Lucas to the town of Todos Santos.  It\'s always a pleasure stopping by Jill Logan\'s.  The art work is amazing and my partner Tom and always leave with some of the Mat prints.  I was eyeing a print for some time but alas it was sold to a lovely couple in San Jose.  I shall purchase one of the high end pieces soon....soooo elegant and classy. I love love love the art with the gold leaf. They look \'yummy\' to the eyes. Awesome work.....will see you next year

268574019.name: Always worth a visit
268574019.author: a TripAdvisor user
268574019.reviewBody: Excellent gallery to walk around.  A plethora of Logan prints are available.  If you are lucky you may catch Jane painting.

267450420.name: Very good attraction
267450420.author: a TripAdvisor user
267450420.reviewBody: Logan has a great selection of Mexican art with landscapes....Todos Santos is a mixture of so many talented artists; take a full day to visit there.

260230643.name: Great selection of art showcasing local scenery
260230643.author: a TripAdvisor user
260230643.reviewBody: Bought a few matted prints by Jill Logan of Todos Santos and Cabo San Lucas that are absolutely gorgeous.  We are excited to have finally found our mementos that will remind us of our time in Baja California Sur.

253710175.name: Art Studio Tour
253710175.author: a TripAdvisor user
253710175.reviewBody: Loved all the art!  The artists were on site and were interesting and accommodating to us. Jill Logan\'s art is eclectic, beautiful, and desireable!

207963388.name: The Art of Making Art
207963388.author: a TripAdvisor user
207963388.reviewBody:
Todos Santos is known as a Mecca for artists, artisans, writers,
thinkers and those who simply seek to express their creative
talents. There's quite a number of galleries featuring a diverse
palette of style, quality, price, and passion. It's been said that you
don't find a piece of art, it finds you. Such is the case at Galeria Logan. As soon as you walk into Jill Logan's gallery, you're
embraced by an impressive collection of artwork that seems to be
singing, "Pick me. Pick me." Unlike some galleries that
give you the impression they exist simply sell you a product,
Galeria Logan exudes an atmosphere of sterling talent, with just a taste of whimsy. The subject matter varies, but the quality does not. There is something for everybody here. Whether big ticket items, or less expensive artwork, there is a lot to choose from.
Galleries remind me of wine tasting rooms. You get a sense once you walk in whether you are going to be accosted by a pretentious "expert" who attempts to impress you. Or, if you're
lucky, you walk in and are greeted by a pleasant host who wants
nothing more than to make your day a better one; someone who would rather make a connection than make a sale. When you visit Todos Santos, treat yourself to Galeria Logan...you'll be
happy you did.

175015132.name: Meeting the artist made all the difference!
175015132.author: a TripAdvisor user
175015132.reviewBody: We were admiring the many originals, and then selecting prints, when the artist came out to greet us.  I had admired a beautiful landscape but hadn\'t found a reprint of it.  Jill Logan (the artist) explained she had just finished it and that the paint was still drying.  She could see the disappointment on my face, as I really loved this piece. She astonished me by offering to create an artists proof print that afternoon, if I could come back in a couple of hours.  Jill recommended Ristorante El Zaguan, which was excellent.  When we returned the proof was finished and they wrapped it carefully for transport home.  We ended up buying 5 prints before leaving.\n\nExcellent customer service, in addition to the wonderful art.

134750573.name: The Desert Comes Alive in Art
134750573.author: a TripAdvisor user
134750573.reviewBody: Awe inspiring art can be found here. Taking the subtle colors of the desert, this artist shapes them into such beautiful water color pieces.  I bought a print of the famed "El Arco" at Lands End, Cabo San Lucas, showcasing it at sunset.  The artist likes to meet customers and it was a pleasure to do so in this wonderful town.

640725033.name: So much great talent here!
640725033.author: a TripAdvisor user
640725033.reviewBody: So much interesting art, prints, Tshirts, and other items.  A collection of artists very much worth y our trip. \n

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

623367791.name: Very cool screensprint shop!
623367791.author: a TripAdvisor user
623367791.reviewBody: This shop was a welcome change from the very touristy gift shops on the main street of Todos Santos. The prints are done by local artists and have tons of style, largely featuring modern interpretations of classic Mexican art subjects like animals, la Katrinas, and landscapes. If you\u2019re on a budget you can pick up affordable postcard-sized prints or go big and get a full sized print for a few hundred. Well worth a quick visit while in town.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

603534468.name: Provocative prints
603534468.author: a TripAdvisor user
603534468.reviewBody: We enjoyed our stop into La Sonrisa de la Muerte.  The gallery collects prints from a variety of Mexican artists.  The work ranges from whimsical to political to provocative.  Certainly worth a visit on a trip to Todos Santos.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

551232736.name: Great art
551232736.author: a TripAdvisor user
551232736.reviewBody: Enjoyed viewing and shopping. There is a refreshing and unique mix a artists work (all lino cut prints). We chose a t-shirt and print to take home.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

551023360.name: Lovely art pieces and nice staff
551023360.author: a TripAdvisor user
551023360.reviewBody: There are some beautiful prints here, done on the premises.  The guy running the shop was friendly and helpful.  Really some of the most striking things we saw in Todos Santos.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

497560027.name: Great Gallery
497560027.author: a TripAdvisor user
497560027.reviewBody: Lovely little gallery. Really nice prints. Ended up taking one home to remember the trip. Really nice staff.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

455800951.name: A must-visit for art lovers!
455800951.author: a TripAdvisor user
455800951.reviewBody: Can\'t say enough wonderful things about this gem in the middle of Todos Santos. WE purchased a very special piece that now hangs in our home in Canada to commemorate our amazing trip.  Modern, airy gallery showcasing stunning local artwork including lithographs and other graphic prints. A must-visit for any art or design lovers.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

379494127.name: Great Modern Mexican (and Argentinian) Art
379494127.author: a TripAdvisor user
379494127.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for art that\'s affordable, unique, and different from everything else in Todos Santos - this is your place! Lots of block prints, and modern themes . Fun and funky - not at all touristy.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

373573296.name: Hip Little Art Shop
373573296.author: a TripAdvisor user
373573296.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for something unique to commemorate your trip or for gifts, this is a cool little find. Great lithographs...we bought 4!!!  Of note: they only take cash, but accept both Mexican and US dollars.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

345201760.name: Great art!
345201760.author: a TripAdvisor user
345201760.reviewBody: A very interesting gallery. I love the name. They have some remarkable prints and even t shirts, the beautiful young Argentinian lady who is also an artist will guide you through.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

337049256.name: VERY nice artwork!
337049256.author: a TripAdvisor user
337049256.reviewBody: Saskia was very friendly and informative.  I will return to purchase some artwork when I move to Todos Santos this coming summer.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

255804410.name: Nice owner, cool stuff!
255804410.author: a TripAdvisor user
255804410.reviewBody: Todos Santos is a charming town with lots of great options for eating and exploring the beaches, but with very few things that are actually worth buying and taking home with you.  (The shops are a mix of tourist traps selling exactly the same mass-produced Mexican kitsch and upscale art galleries of the new-agey/hippie variety.)\n\nThankfully there\'s also La Sonrisa de la Muerte, where we found a very short run woodblock print by a local graphic artist (from La Paz) that we\'ll be happy to hang around our house to remind us of our vacation.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

252225580.name: Something different...
252225580.author: a TripAdvisor user
252225580.reviewBody: I love this gallery because it focuses on cool modern Mexican graphic arts that are unique and reasonably priced. The owner (a graphic artist himself) scoured Mexico seeking out young talent and brought the hand picked posters, photographs and other art back to Todos Santos. They also sell hip t shirts, bags, stickers and playing cards and even have shipping tubes to help you bring your purchases back home. It\'s very small, but the art packs a wallop! The owner speaks French, Spanish and English.

address.streetAddress: Corner C/Militar & C/Hidalgo, Centro

650908523.name: The best beach in Todos Santos.
650908523.author: a TripAdvisor user
650908523.reviewBody: perfect to take a break. enjoy a relaxing weekend rest on the sand, watching the waves and surfers, swimming or having a sun tanning..

646694169.name: Great Surf Beach
646694169.author: a TripAdvisor user
646694169.reviewBody: This is not a novice surf beach but it\'s still a great beach to people watch, especially if you like to watch surfers who know what they are doing. Always a great group of people hanging out here.

556385394.name: Awesome surf beach.
556385394.author: a TripAdvisor user
556385394.reviewBody: Watching the surfers here is a favorite when we\'re vacationing in the area.  There is nothing here but that\'s part of the appeal, just don\'t get too close at high tide.

273875274.name: Paradise?
273875274.author: a TripAdvisor user
273875274.reviewBody: Beautiful, had it for ourself many times! Surf gets really good with the right swell! No restaurant, no bathroom, this is just a beach! But a really nice one!

242812078.name: La Pastora
242812078.author: a TripAdvisor user
242812078.reviewBody: Surf here. Super fun waves when we visited. Rocky bottom; however, they are round/soft/fuzzy and easy to maneuver through with your board. We spotted whales just beyond the break which was cool and when the swell backed off we put on caps and goggles and swam. Lots of marine life to see. Locals are friendly. Lots of great senior surfers in the water who are especially nice. \n\nDogs love this beach and I did spot feces on the beach; just keep your eye out for it and if you really love the beach environment...pick it up. Overall it was pretty clean.

242597960.name: Not a great swimming beach but the surf is decent
242597960.author: a TripAdvisor user
242597960.reviewBody: Was broken into here in April. right in front of my very eyes. These guys are good! Other than that its decent for surfing, you can swim here but there are better beaches around the area for that. Great sunsets!

120937007.name: World class surf
120937007.author: a TripAdvisor user
120937007.reviewBody: When it works (NW winter swells) it\'s world class. Needs a decent size swell. Look out for chicken Mike in the lineup (the gringo owner of the local Super Pollo) who thinks  he can drop in on other people.

8615615.name: Poorly documented beach
8615615.author: a TripAdvisor user
8615615.reviewBody: Finding this beach is difficult but worthwhile if you are a surfer with some experience.  I and my daughter are not so we just waded and looked for shells.  This has none of the facilities that the cerritos beach has which lies south of Todos Santos.  Although some websites and some tourist information suggest that this is a beach for swimming, boogie boarding, or surfing, it really is for those who know what they are doing.  The surf breaks close and there are rocks a short ways in.  The surfers we saw were quite far out, way beyond my daughter\'s skill.  It is quite unspoiled and I would recommend it for the experience and isolation.\n

565319174.name: The most professional gallery in town
565319174.author: a TripAdvisor user
565319174.reviewBody: Excellent Gallery space with a wide variety of art styles to choose from. Artist, Michael Cope is the owner and one of the participating artists. The space here is huge with lots of natural light so viewing the art is a tranquil experience.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

499656895.name: The MUST VISIT Gallery in Todos Santos!
499656895.author: a TripAdvisor user
499656895.reviewBody: Loved visiting Galeria de Todos Santos. Michael is a great host and the art there is the most varied and interesting of any gallery in Todos Santos. We are in the process of watching two pieces getting finished and buying a third that was hanging in the gallery. If you are looking for art this gallery is a MUST VISIT!

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

466798607.name: Todos Santos Proper
466798607.author: a TripAdvisor user
466798607.reviewBody:
We were vacationing in Cabo San Lucas and decided to take a trip to Todos Santos. As it was later in the day, when we arrived we were only able to visit a few artist galleries as they seem to all close at 4:00 pm; and reading reviews some do not open on the weekends. Most shops that remained open were for jewelry and curios.
Although there is one rug shop who's owner is Zapotecan with beautiful rugs - cash only please!
Down the street from his little shop traveling north there is a little coffee shop that sells baguettes and wonderful coffee/lattes/cookies.
The town itself is very sweet and lay back and thoroughly enjoyable.
Of course we took photos of Hotel California which isn't really the Eagles Hotel California but what the heck - rethinking the trip it would've been nice to stay overnight and travel on to La Paz the next day.
I'm posting photos of the inside of the Hotel.
If you have time be sure to visit.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

460807228.name: very nice gallery
460807228.author: a TripAdvisor user
460807228.reviewBody: the place is so well maintain . Clean and beautiful . there is a beautiful art gallery . Its a 10 minute walk from downtown todos santos

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

451511144.name: A Magnificent Setting for Art
451511144.author: a TripAdvisor user
451511144.reviewBody: Michael is very welcoming , and he is a great artist . There are fifteen artists represented here . The building is amazing and in a great setting . There is a restaurant\n here , but it has opening limits . A must to see if you appreciate art .

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

449640372.name: High Quality Fine Art and not Tourist Art
449640372.author: a TripAdvisor user
449640372.reviewBody: We have been going to this gallery over the years and know that they show only high quality fine art.  They don\'t show tourist art like you see in other galleries in town or Cabo.  The artist are also very accomplished in their work.  If you like fine art and are looking for reasonably price, high quality work go to this gallery.  It\'s worth the very short drive north of town.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

436242055.name: Great Art
436242055.author: a TripAdvisor user
436242055.reviewBody: We popped in here and, right away, were attended to very well.  In fact, we came away with a modern sculpture of a bull, plus several highly imaginative lithographs.  Plus, it has its resident artist.  Friendly place,  Quality art.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

384587283.name: Gallery and Workshop Well Worth a Gander
384587283.author: a TripAdvisor user
384587283.reviewBody: Find your way to the Galeria down a narrow dirt road just outside of Todos Santos. High ceilings and architectural interest compliment this dedicated art space. The gallery represents both Mexican and American artists and their diverse art, and is especially suited for large scale works. It\'s a dynamic venue for artists to showcase their work, some hanging on the walls and some on easels.\n\nTip: on Friday and Saturday nights, gallery owner Michael opens Michael\'s at the Gallery, an al fresco patio that serves Asian fusion cuisine sometimes served by the artists.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

363572420.name: A quirky museum and cultural centre
363572420.author: a TripAdvisor user
363572420.reviewBody: We enjoyed the museum, with mock-ups of local houses, local politicians and presidents of Mexico, a lot about Frida Kahlo, woodworking tools, ancient skulls and the story of Dom Ramon Wong. It is in an old school with some interesting modern vfrescos and is clearly a thriving cultural centre for the town.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

360486432.name: Smaller, quaint, quiet, perhaps a bit busy
360486432.author: a TripAdvisor user
360486432.reviewBody: A nice gallery of oil and metalwork art. Perched along one of the busier streets in this artsy small town. Look for local touches, and be thoughtful of the type of craftsmanship put into these items. It\'s almost too much to hear visitors complain!

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

337061306.name: The best art gallery in the area
337061306.author: a TripAdvisor user
337061306.reviewBody: They have a wide variety of excellent artists. Erica Oche is one of our favorites, but his work just doesn\'t work with our home decor.  It\'s high quality art at reasonable art prices for quality work.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

334516936.name: Very interesting.
334516936.author: a TripAdvisor user
334516936.reviewBody: Loved the art. We walked from Hotel California and strolled through the gallery. Serene and captivating. Local artists.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

303751004.name: Wonderful Gallery in Todos Santos
303751004.author: a TripAdvisor user
303751004.reviewBody: Michael, the owner, took us around the gallery sharing, in depth, about the wonderful artist in his gallery.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

290245875.name: Beautiful Art
290245875.author: a TripAdvisor user
290245875.reviewBody: The art in this gallery is breathtaking. There is one piece in there I would have loved to take home.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

284411707.name: A Destination Gallery! One of a kind with a superb variety of art objects.
284411707.author: a TripAdvisor user
284411707.reviewBody: Just a bit north of the historic center, perhaps half a mile out of town is this gigantic exposition hall with fantastic natural light showing different artists. all with their own medium. Paintings of course by gallery owner Michael Cope. Multi media by Gloria Ruenitz and many more fascinating artists.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

263501970.name: Great Gallery
263501970.author: a TripAdvisor user
263501970.reviewBody: Very unique and beautiful.  A must see if you are in Todos Santos. There are many galleries in Todos Santos, but the Galeria is a top gallery and you will not be disappointed by your visit.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

263323474.name: Nice
263323474.author: a TripAdvisor user
263323474.reviewBody: There are many great shops, art galleries and very unique stores in Todos Santos but this one is tough to beat.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

260440054.name: Great Gallery; Better Than Before!
260440054.author: a TripAdvisor user
260440054.reviewBody: Michael Cope\'s new (post hurricane Odile) gallery space is fantastic--so much better than the old space. The range of artists he carries is great and it is fascinating to see the two resident artists at work. Michael & Pat are terrific hosts, delighted to talk about the art, the artists, and Todos Santos. Don\'t miss this beautiful gallery!

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

250695780.name: An amazing town
250695780.author: a TripAdvisor user
250695780.reviewBody: Very quiet and has a great local feel to it. Has the Hotel California (lots of pictures and history) and MANY little shops with unique jewelry and souvenirs.  Its a bit of a drive from Cabo San Lucas,but if you have the chance and want a taste of real mexico, definitely recommended.

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

184923617.name: Great place!
184923617.author: a TripAdvisor user
184923617.reviewBody: One of the many fantastic shops in the lovely pueblos of Todos Santos. This town is filled with shops, art galleries, unique stores, markets and restaurants. The beaches are terrific and uncrowded, whale watching from the beach is a treasure! Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

352420.name: Great Art
352420.author: a TripAdvisor user
352420.reviewBody: Having been in the art business for many years, my visit to the Galeria de Todos Santos in Todos Santos, Baja, California, Mexico, was a most rewarding visit.   The trip there was ecnomical, fast and easy, I flew into Cabo San Lucas, rented a car and drove a single road in less than one hour to Todos Santos where many art galleries and scores of local and mainland artists are represented.   The Galeria de Todos Santos owned by Pat and Michael Cope is the main attraction as far as galleries go next to the Todos Santos Inn where the accomodations were the best I found in all of Baja Mexico.  I arrived on a Friday afternoon, stayed at the Inn, visited the two galleries owned by the Cope\'s, had a first class dinner at the Sante Fe Restaurant.  The next morning I then visited the other many galleries in this small but clean and friendly town, had lunch at the Sante Fe restuarant again, picked up my well wrapped art work I purchased at the Cope\'s gallery and left the next day, (Sunday) for Cabo and flew back to the States.\n

address.streetAddress: Huerta Las Palmas Calle Topete entre Juárez y Centenario

639775136.name: good experience
639775136.author: a TripAdvisor user
639775136.reviewBody: enjoyed the people especially the children.  The service including the music was great.\n One boy went way out o his way to shake hands during the sign of peace.

577511500.name: Very pretty church
577511500.author: a TripAdvisor user
577511500.reviewBody: I really loved the chandelier that was represented the Crown of Thorns in the older part of the chapel.  Their is a quiet simple beauty in this reverent place.

566997689.name: Catholic Church of Todos Santos
566997689.author: a TripAdvisor user
566997689.reviewBody: This TripAdvisor listing appears to be a duplicate for the Misi\u00f3n de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora del Pilar. You\u2019ll find the Catholic Church of Todos Santos in the center of town, next door to Hotel California. The church is named after Our Lady of the Pillar, the name given to the Blessed Virgin Mary associated with Spain\u2019s patron saint Apostle James. It\u2019s a simple Colonial-style building that was reconstructed in 1747. The most notable exterior feature are the bells above the main entrance. The interior is simple and peaceful. Both contrast with the mission\u2019s tumultuous history that dates to 1733 when it was established by the Spaniards (read the historical plaque outside near the main entrance). We went inside to pray and were delighted to hear the bells chime. The side courtyard has a beautiful tiled mural of Nuestra Se\u00f1ora del Pilar. One call-out is that we didn\u2019t notice the stained glass visible in earlier photos.

539054331.name: Simple, beautiful church
539054331.author: a TripAdvisor user
539054331.reviewBody: The church faces the square of Todos Santos and was one of the prettiest I saw in the Cabo area. It\'s very simple, with some nice stained glass, sculptures, tile art, history, and lots of wood. This ochre-colored church is beautiful to look at, inside and out.

511603292.name: Nothing too unusual here
511603292.author: a TripAdvisor user
511603292.reviewBody: Stopping into the mission churches seems like a thing to do, but they all start looking the same. I didn\'t find this one to be memorable.

510700184.name: Pretty
510700184.author: a TripAdvisor user
510700184.reviewBody: Just stop in and walk through. It\'s beautiful...The heart of the square. I love the way it looks at dusk but beautiful all day long.

503914770.name: We attended the Sunday 12:00pm service and it was beautiful
503914770.author: a TripAdvisor user
503914770.reviewBody: The service was lovely, and they had a guitar and singer for the music.  Even though we did not understand the language we loved the atmosphere.

483460785.name: Nice place to visit and view some history
483460785.author: a TripAdvisor user
483460785.reviewBody: The mission in Todos Santos has a rich history, dating back to 1723. The current building isn\'t the original one, but the story outside talks about it. It\'s a rather plain inside, but the history is still there, and it\'s a nice place to visit on a warm day.

459155222.name: A quant chuch in Todos Santos
459155222.author: a TripAdvisor user
459155222.reviewBody: While visiting Todos Santos, we were able to see the church and its grounds.  It was nice to see, that during the day, the church was open for visitors and parishioners.  We didn\'t find out when it was built, but it was nicely decorated.

455392325.name: Don\'t miss the little mural of Saint Pilar in the courtyard
455392325.author: a TripAdvisor user
455392325.reviewBody: This pretty church was established in the 18th century but was burned by indigenous people who were enslaved by the conquering Spaniards. Rebuilt much later it is pretty glows with a golden light inside. It\'s named after the Virgin of the Pillar, the first Spanish madonna associated with Spain\'s patron saint Santiago. There is a charming mural in the courtyard recently installed there that celebrates this Spanish virgin. The revenge of Spain against the indigenous insurgents, I guess.

452833399.name: Beautiful!
452833399.author: a TripAdvisor user
452833399.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous little church in the middle of a beautiful little town! A must if you are spending the day in Todos Santos\nBe sure to grab some regional sweets and local burritos while there!

421911799.name: Beautiful
421911799.author: a TripAdvisor user
421911799.reviewBody: This was a beautiful place! Takes just a few minutes to check out but worth it! The stained glass is amazing!

408074665.name: Feels like one of the old missions
408074665.author: a TripAdvisor user
408074665.reviewBody: This is a beautiful, peaceful church.  Many churches in Mexico are very ornate with seemingly everything gilded.  This church is much plainer, but it makes one feel like sitting and staying a while.

401862697.name: Cabo with in laws to be
401862697.author: a TripAdvisor user
401862697.reviewBody: This mission church is very plain except for the colored glass on the altar. It will not take but a few minutes to tour the mission, then you can walk across the street to see the old theater.

392231615.name: Holy Place !!!
392231615.author: a TripAdvisor user
392231615.reviewBody: My Family & I loved Todos Santos. It is a quaint town, probably about 6,000 people, easy to get around. This Church is right in the middle of things. It is in need of some repair, but you can tell this is a holy place & the people of Todos Santos are Religious. The Mexican people as a whole are, but in these smaller towns you can really feel it.

373598643.name: Beautiful Church that tells a story
373598643.author: a TripAdvisor user
373598643.reviewBody: We spent an evening walking through the charming town of Todos Santos and wandered into the church. There were several people praying and it was so peaceful. If only the pews could talk... you get the feeling there are many stories to be told over the years this church has been a part of the community. It\'s a beautiful place of worship and the perfect place to stop and have a quite moment of reflection.

359008395.name: Pretty and simple
359008395.author: a TripAdvisor user
359008395.reviewBody: Simple and pretty church. It was nice to wander in and take some photos. Don\'t expect some cathedral type setting though.

341066020.name: History
341066020.author: a TripAdvisor user
341066020.reviewBody: I always visit churches in foreign cities and towns because I think they give me a glimpse into the personal lives of the locals. This church is a mix of modern and old. It has beautiful etched windows.

337031641.name: Christmas decorations are beautiful!
337031641.author: a TripAdvisor user
337031641.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to visit this church at Christmas time.  It was decorated beautifully.  Another plus is that it appears to be open all day.

333780649.name: Church 2015
333780649.author: a TripAdvisor user
333780649.reviewBody: What a beautiful church and again an old building. The colored windows and the interior decor were beautiful and clean. This church is still being used for services on Sunday as we experienced

332156154.name: Lovely rural church
332156154.author: a TripAdvisor user
332156154.reviewBody: Small old church dating back almost 100 years. Particularly beautiful when sun streaming in. Nice stop

314878106.name: Pretty Church
314878106.author: a TripAdvisor user
314878106.reviewBody: About 1 1/2 hours from Cabo San Luca this little church is worth a visit.\nThe town however is being redeveloped and the streets are like a construction site.

260645247.name: Sunday Service
260645247.author: a TripAdvisor user
260645247.reviewBody: The church is good for a short look around any day of the week but if you can go on Sunday sit outside after service and have an ice cream from one of the street vendors

209050529.name: Misione de Nuestra Senora de la Pilar
209050529.author: a TripAdvisor user
209050529.reviewBody: Beautiful Church, on a beautiful plaza, in a beautiful small town. Check out the amazing natural light that comes in. Take a stroll around the plaza and the towns art galleries, distillery, restaurant/bars. Relaxed atmosphere and friendly locals make this a welcome respite from the Cabo area.

193010568.name: Misione de Nuestra Senora de la Pilar
193010568.author: a TripAdvisor user
193010568.reviewBody: We were able to attend a service there on this visit and it was interesting to be able to experience a Mexican Catholic service. Although we are not nearly fluent in the language, we were welcomed as any parishioner would be. The people who attended the 6pm service on Sunday were varied and it was evident they were mostly locals. \nThe priest was casual yet comfortable in his duties. His sermon was geared towards the audience and he addressed his flock with a message that was geared towards his community. It is refreshing to see that \'class\' has no boundaries in church.\nThe altar design has been \'updated\', I believe and I liked the abstract-like representation of the cross.

168796738.name: Beautiful Stained Glass
168796738.author: a TripAdvisor user
168796738.reviewBody: We were advised to check out the historical church by our resort and it was so fun. The entire town of todos santos is so cute, this church is gorgeous and we felt a positive presence while there.

151504569.name: This does not exist...it is Misione de Nuestra Senora de Pilar

536983888.name: A Bit of Local History
536983888.author: a TripAdvisor user
536983888.reviewBody: I always like to bring visitors to the Casa de Cultura when they visit Todos Santos for the first time. It\'s a nice way to appreciate some of life the way it was. The frescoes on the walls are beautiful, and as you stroll through the various rooms, there are items on display, collected by the late Professor Nestor who spent many years putting all this together. The building also has a library and the meeting room is used all the time. My favorite part, though, is the palo d\'arco "home" created in the rear of the property, showing how most of the residents lived...including the separate structures for sleeping and cooking, and hen house...even a hanging baby cradle. I have always found this fascinating.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

511604746.author: a TripAdvisor user

Not sure about what\'s exactly used for but I think it\'s of public access although from the outside there aren\'t many signs there\'s something interesting to see inside. As stated in the title of this opinion, the facade looks pretty. All made of red bricks and antique-looking.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

455391259.name: Amazing revolutionary murals not to be missed
455391259.author: a TripAdvisor user
455391259.reviewBody: In a town that has more than its share of ex-pats (i.e. immigrants in American parlance) and gussied-up charm, this is an authentic Mexican cultural center. Pause to examine the murals that celebrate Mexico\'s revolutionary past and physical and intellectual culture. This place is the heart of intellectual life in Todos Santos with a library, a lecture hall, a pleasant courtyard and the aforementioned murals. Some of them are very worn and would benefit from restoration, but the content is historic and full of spirit. You can get an idea, looking at the worn ones, of how the fresco process takes place. Look beyond your own ethnocentric expectations and appreciate the soulfulness of this place. It\'s free.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

450255539.name: Definitely worth a stop! Wonderful History Lesson
450255539.author: a TripAdvisor user
450255539.reviewBody: So we kind of stumbled across this place when we were shopping in Todos Santos. I read one review that says it\'s embarrassing and dilapidated. I guess it\'s all about perspective because we found it quite charming. Yes, it\'s dusty, some windows are broken and it\'s not terribly well organized but for us that just added to the authenticity of what Todos Santos is, "Puebla Magica". There are some amazing old photos and old artifacts and a little "shack" in the back that is apparently an original house of how people lived back then. I found it incredibly interesting. There is also a lovely courtyard that\'s worth seeing all on it\'s own. Do be careful though, as there are a lot of rusty artifacts strewn around and some paths aren\'t level. Probably not a good place for small children but definitely worth a stop!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

430116988.name: Embarrassing!  The town fathers should be ashamed!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

371424253.name: Great Find in Todos Santos
371424253.author: a TripAdvisor user
371424253.reviewBody:
We happened by this little museum on a Sunday afternoon and were so glad that we found it.  
While some of the other reviews complain that it seems deserted and unkept I had the opposite thought. I felt it was very well organized and very well put together considering this is such a small town in the dessert and not a huge city or cultural area.  
They have rooms with displays of antiques, and artifacts, artwork, along with lots of photos with both Spanish and English information about various people and events of Todos Santos.  
In the back they have a cultural area set up with small huts which represent old style country homes of the people in the area along with a small garden which has several cacti, fruit trees, and flowering shrubs.
While there was not a tour guide to show us through we walked through on our own at leisure and really enjoyed the hour or so we spent looking at all the exhibits

347996697.name: A pilar for community and culture
347996697.author: a TripAdvisor user
347996697.reviewBody: I attended several evening lectures during my one-week stay in Todos Santos.  Each night there was something else interesting happening, including a girls\' traditional dance class; traditional gourd painting and carving, and open library hours.  The museum has a terrific wide-ranging collection that includes traditional crafts, archeological artifacts, local artists\' work, sugar industry artifacts and historic photos.  Todos Santos culture is alive and well, and this place has a lot to do with that.  I loved spending time here.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Casa de Cultura

318978043.name: Wonderful, historical insights...Can\'t miss opportunity.
318978043.author: a TripAdvisor user
318978043.reviewBody:
What a great little historical tour of the area.  The museum is a treat and a nice simple presentation and representation of the history of the Todos Santos town and surrounding areas.  Many of the photo captions are in both spanish and english and are quite amazing that, given the severe lack of funding the museum gets for curation, they even still exist.  They present a great insight into the lives and happenings in the area from the last 2 centuries and thankfully they have the museum to show it off.  Otherwise all that history would be lost to us that weren't there.  Additionally, there are artifacts and other information on pre-historic times which are also quite fascinating.

After the walk indoors, a path leads you through a beautiful garden that also has a couple of authentic, and obviously very old, aboriginal huts, as they apparently existed during the times of the first inhabitants.  Very intriguing on how that the same materials used then, are still in use today. Especially, in a society that still is lacking in many of the modern features of our everyday lives, which we take for granted.  Such things as electricity and air conditioning!  The walls were made from the same plants as the roofs on houses made today and by allowing airflow through them, you have, Wha-Lah, Air Conditioning!  Other technologies of the time are just as interesting, too.  You have to see them for yourselves.

This is a can't miss self guided tour and will only take as long as you want to see the entire exhibit, but no more than an 30 minutes if you don't want.   And don't forget, right near the front door is a small box and visitor sign-in book to record your visit and to donate funds of your choice to help with the museum upkeep.  They likely receive no government funding and probably have no endowment.  So, they're existence is entirely based on visitor contributions.

So, don't pay attention to all the negative people that have no idea about what a museum is or should be.  Frankly they are so ignorant, they should just not bother coming to this wonderful country ever again. Your comments of it being "old and dusty" are themselves, "Old and Dusty".   

Instead, come and enjoy a nice, quiet, relaxing stroll through this little gem of history.  You'll love it if you do, and regret it if you don't.  Besides, what's your hurry?  It's Mexico after all, not the US.  If you want the US, go home!

566684195.name: A Highlight of Stay in Todos Santos
566684195.author: a TripAdvisor user
566684195.reviewBody: 3 of us booked a car/driver from Todos Santos Private Transportation, owned by friendly Mario Becerril.  We were met at Todos\'s City Park by Chevo our driver.  We were pleased to board a roomy, clean and beefy Honda 4-WD vehicle.  Though Chevo speaks little English and I speak little Spanish, we enjoyed each other for our 5-6 hour tour.  Chevo expertly maneuvered through the deep sand of the arroyo and narrow, bumpy road mountain road up to La Candelaria, stopping along the way for photo ops of the oasis, birds and gnarly trees.  He took us to Lorena Hankins\'s village home and studio.  Lorena was very gracious in telling how she happened to arrive at Candelaria and then gave a demo on putting the finishing touches on a lidded pot.  After purchasing several of her pieces, Chevo took us to a sugar cane processing establishment and then up to the colorful village cemetery. Chevo asked if there was anything we wanted to see on our "little field trip".  When asked if he knew of something else, he suggested going off road to a lovely waterfall.  Here we enjoyed our pre-packed picnic lunch and a cold beer.  After a final stop at the blanket factory, we hugged our new friend, Chevo, good bye and thanked him for being a part of one of our best days in the Todos area.

284709788.name: Interestingly substantial place in the middle of nowhere
284709788.author: a TripAdvisor user
284709788.reviewBody: First of all you will not find it with maps or electronics. It takes instructions from a live person and real 4 wheel drive to get there. Ask how to find Lorena "the pottery maker"if you find this place. The big surprise is she was  long ago from Portland Oregon. The local brouha is a gringo!

address.streetAddress: Hwy 19 Santa Cantarina Mountains

219137746.name: Loved It!
219137746.author: a TripAdvisor user
219137746.reviewBody: Tried to drive up from the coast, but road was impassable for  cars so went down to Cabo and took the hard to find dirt road up into the mountains.  A number of forks in dirt road with no signs, but people helpful when asked for the way.  It\'s basically a long bumpy drive of about 26 km up a mtn dirt road past cows and goats - you get there, there\'s a small village, not much to see really.  Amazing that people have lived there for so long, just a few families.  No sign of witchcraft, missed the gate with the skull sadly.  Drove back down the mountain.  Enjoyed the trip.  Not for everyone.  Loved the way they are not capitalizing on their fame with tourist souvenirs at all.  The cop in Cabo who gave us directions thought we were crazy to even drive up.

address.streetAddress: Hwy 19 Santa Cantarina Mountains

158155613.name: Our Visit to La Candelaria Mexico
158155613.author: a TripAdvisor user
158155613.reviewBody: We visited La Candelaria on our recent vacation trip to Cabo San Lucus, The night before my wife and daughters went and purchased various items, coffee beans, Sugar, Rice, Baby Formula, and Diapers.  We went as a family as we heard they were off grid, no power, no electricity.  after driving for miles in and over the mountains we came to La Candelaria.  I was shocked to see that had one paved block with side walks, with a church and a school in the middle.  We turned left at the end of the paved road and lucky we had a 4-wheel drive, we came upon an elderly lady who spoke no English and we spoke No Spanish.  We were able figure out her name was Un-Sally and her dog was named Kenny.  We gave her a care package and went back to meet another family at the end of the road across from the playground.  This lady was kind enough to show us her home, She gave us sugar cane and some home made candy.  My son played basketball with some of the kids on the court next to their home.  Grandma was cooking stew on stove outside,  They had a little frog radio playing, I wanted to bad to just send them the one we have just sitting in our garage. We stayed and visited for about 30 minutes, we then gave her 2 of our care packages and were on our way back over and through the mountains only making one wrong turn on our way back.  Coming out seems much more faster then going in.  It was such a fun adventure and seeing how the live with so little was quite an eye opener for me and my family.   I would love to share the photo with this family, If someone knows how I could mail this to them please let me know.\n\nThe Larson\'s

address.streetAddress: Hwy 19 Santa Cantarina Mountains

153972144.name: We have been to Candelaria
153972144.author: a TripAdvisor user
153972144.reviewBody: Well, interesting as it is, Candelaria is very hard to find. We had Moon travel book and couldn\'t follow the directions from a certain point. The roads are very sandy, it is quite remote, and no one speaks English. If you are on an ATV tour, maybe the guide knows about it. We tried a second time with a native  who had been there before. With the road improvements, even he had a hard time. Once we found the town, we spoke with the husband of the woman (an American) who teaches native women to do pottery, so they will have a means to support themselves if need be (which is often the case). I had bought some pottery in Todos Santos, and in Candelaria had the opportunity to buy some from the Master! I was thrilled.  There really is not much of a town. All I can add is make sure you follow the directions off Rt. 19 if you don\'t go,the ATV route.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

566911580.name: Pueblo Magico
566911580.author: a TripAdvisor user
566911580.reviewBody: Calle Benito Juarez is the main street in Todos Santos. It\u2019s an easy drive from Cabo on a well-maintained 4-lane highway. We rented a car for the day and really enjoyed ourselves. The Mexican Tourism Secretary declared Todos Santos a Pueblo Magico (Magic Town) in 2006. To be honest, we were drawn there by the urban legend of Hotel California and didn\u2019t expect much else. We were surprised by the picturesque cobblestone streets and original brick buildings that have been turned into art galleries, shops and restaurants. We browsed the stores, visited the Mission church, and lingered at Tequila Sunrise for lunch. The main square had local vendor stalls (not sure if they are there every day). I got some darling hand-made dolls for our girls and dried fruit for snacking. On the drive to Todos Santos, we stopped at Playa Los Cerritos and Punta Lobos (we tried for Palm Beach but turned around). I know that many tours make the trip in half a day. That seems rushed to me. Take your time and visit the beaches too. I\u2019m sorry we didn\u2019t plan to spend a night or two in Todos Santos. And now for a fun piece of trivia: The Tropic of Cancer (Tropico de Cancer) runs through Todos Santos. One of the shops had a plaque outside.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

397028212.name: A taste of old Mexico but fast becoming a major tourist location.
397028212.author: a TripAdvisor user
397028212.reviewBody: Shop after shop for both men and women.  Shop owners are welcoming and great at answering questions.  Visit this small town before it is ruined by future hoards of people!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

364890739.name: Cute spot if you are already in town
364890739.author: a TripAdvisor user
364890739.reviewBody: We were in Todos Santos and had the chance to visit Calle Juarez. Cute street with lots of typical shops, mexican handcrafts and one or two places to pick up something to eat. Not much to do really, we tried to walk around and visit the little shops but again nothing exciting and way overpriced (shop in Cabo instead). \n\nI would visit if you are in Todos Santos already, but would not recommend driving from Cabo just to visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

351130956.name: Quaint
351130956.author: a TripAdvisor user
351130956.reviewBody: Beautiful little Mexican town with great little shops.   Great finds  Don\'t forget to negotiate the prices.     Great little restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

344091367.name: Typical Tourist Traps
344091367.author: a TripAdvisor user
344091367.reviewBody: It is like every other touristy street in any other town in Mexico or elsewhere. There were not many people, considering it was high season. Everything was overpriced and cheap-looking. it\'s an OK place if you have nothing else to do.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

289342304.name: Lots of Great Shops & Galleries
289342304.author: a TripAdvisor user
289342304.reviewBody: Even though the town is pretty torn up, we were still able to navigate our way through the mess to enjoy the day browsing through the many great shops along this street. Lots of wonderful artwork, restaurants and unique souvenirs and gifts that you won\'t find in Cabo.   On stopping in at some of the galleries we were fortunate enough to meet some of the artists and had the opportunity to observe two of them working on new paintings.  \n\nReally doesn\'t make sense that they have torn up the entire town the way that they have instead of tearing up and repaving in sections, but it is what it is so we had to make a conscious effort to get beyond it since we had limited time and wanted to see all the good things that the town had to offer.  Glad we did, but pack your patience!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

287895292.name: most stores were closed
287895292.author: a TripAdvisor user
287895292.reviewBody: When we got there we discovered the town was still under contraction from the hurricane.  So the streets were all unpaved and dusty.  a lot of the stores were closed.  The town has cute architecture from the colonial era and its quieter than Cabo.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

284479270.name: Temporaraly quite messy shopping street, but will improve by the end of summer
284479270.author: a TripAdvisor user
284479270.reviewBody: The streets of Pueblo Magico are going through a major renovation. All utilities like water sewer and electric are buried underground and before it will get nice again, it is going to be not so pleasant walking along many Todos Santos streets.\nBut don\'t let it be a deterrent not to visit the shops and restaurants because the merchants need your pesos.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

273230259.name: Great day trip & break from crazy Cabo
273230259.author: a TripAdvisor user
273230259.reviewBody: We drove ourselves along the well maintained highway from Cabo to Todos Santos. Nice drive with lots of sea views and cacti! The town is really small; we found a parking spot & basically walked down on side of the street & back the other. We arrived around 10am, so things were just opening up and was sparsely populated at that time of day. There are lots of shops with the same pottery, glassware, metal work, etc. found in Cabo but the sales people here were less pushy and more laid back. I did pay a little more for the things I bought compared to Cabo but the friendliness and ambience was worth it. We kept receiving offers to try their special blend of tequila. Each store seemed to have their own label. We ate lunch at Hotel California; it was delicious! We left after lunch.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

268879396.name: Road is under some major construction
268879396.author: a TripAdvisor user
268879396.reviewBody: Is tough to get around with the street totally torn up. Be prepared to detour and take it slow. Most of the sidewalks are non-existent but businesses are open if you don\'t mind menouvering around concrete rubble :/
