address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

267451359.name: Great shopping!
267451359.author: a TripAdvisor user
267451359.reviewBody: Great shopping - lots of different shops along this street. There is a small public library with courtyard toward the beginning of town to relax and take a break. The shops sell a lot of the same stuff but part of Mexico is mixing it up with the locals. The stores are frequented by a lot of tourists so the sellers are not as desperate as those in Cabo. Plan a couple of hours for shopping plus a couple more hours if you are viewed art galleries.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

241856813.name: Pretty
241856813.author: a TripAdvisor user
241856813.reviewBody: This is a very pretty street, and an excellent place for a stroll, but not so great for people watching, unless you enjoy watching American tourists! Lots of shops, galleries, boutiques. Shop until you drop!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

230008516.name: You\'ll Need One of Those Nylon Shopping Bags
230008516.author: a TripAdvisor user
230008516.reviewBody: Perfect for a stroll down the street after a wonderful lunch at Cafe Santa Fe.  There are numerous shops and gallerias to dodge in an out of as the fancy suits you.  Yes.  You will find the Hotel California here and you can buy T-shirts with a picture of the hotel on it.  But . . . this is not, sorry to burst any bubbles, I say NOT the Hotel California that was referred to in the Eagles song.  The hotel is actually a metaphor that the band used in the lyrics to allude to their experiences.  Nevertheless, you can buy one anyway and just tell everybody that your got to go where Eagles dared.\n\nDon\'t forget to take one of those nylon mesh shopping bags with you that you bought in the market back in Cabo.  They come in plenty handy when you begin amass all those knick-knacks and souvenirs for Aunt Martha, little Johnny and the next door neighbors kids for watering the plants while you were gone.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

198462362.name: Many Galleries closed on Sunday
198462362.author: a TripAdvisor user
198462362.reviewBody: Be aware that if you go on Sunday you are not going to get into many of the galleries, and one or two of the restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

152473290.name: Shopping
152473290.author: a TripAdvisor user
152473290.reviewBody: This is a nice, safe street to walk around and shop. A few of the shop owners across from Hotel California were a little bit of a pain when you walk buy-- come on in, come see my store, etc. Other stores up the street further were not pushy at all and just said hello. There are some restaurants on the street as well. We enjoyed walking around here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

146453874.name: makes for an excellent afternoon
146453874.author: a TripAdvisor user
146453874.reviewBody: This is paved street with a mixture of nice/updated properties and run-down properties, a few cool open tile floor plaza areas right off the street, many nice little artsy/boutique shops, restaurants, and general souvenir stores.  Most of the roads off this main street are dirt, and the further away you get from the main street the fewer touristy places you\'ll find.  Most of the tourists stay right on and/or just off the main street.  There are some nice shops and restaurants off the main street, but it depends which streets you go down.  If you\'re staying in Cabo, a trip to Todos Santos makes for a very cool day trip.  Grab lunch, walk around, and shop.  Most of the tourists are Americans.  Even some of the shop owners are Americans.  Remember to negotiate the price for items you buy.  Unlike in America, the listed price for items in many of these shops are negotiable.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

131271094.name: Small Walk-able shopping
131271094.author: a TripAdvisor user
131271094.reviewBody: Todos Santos is a Small Town, Called Juarez is the main street with most of the artisan shops, galleries, Hotel California, and eateries. There is more off the on other streets, but Calle Juarez contains most of it. The street is a slight hill but easy to walk up. In front of hotel California there is a big shop area where there are guys trying to get work deals with you to buy stuff. There are some great little gallery, where you sometimes find artist painting. Ate at a few different food places from ice cream to tacos, to cafe cafelix to tequila sunrise and all places were good and people were friendly.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez

554830894.name: Quality art and souvenir store with fair prices.
554830894.author: a TripAdvisor user
554830894.reviewBody: Quality art and souvenir store with fair prices and no hassle with bargaining - the prices are set. Good variety of things and fairly good quality.

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

437211403.name: Our favorite shop in Todos Santos.
437211403.author: a TripAdvisor user
437211403.reviewBody: I visit Todos Santos every couple of years for the last 16 years since a friend owns a home near town.  We always spend at least one day shopping in town and Manos Mexicanas is our favorite shop.  It is a great place to buy local items at reasonable prices.  I always find something I can not live without.

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

435902026.name: Meeting with don Ram\u00f3n and his lovely wife
435902026.author: a TripAdvisor user
435902026.reviewBody: This store was recommended by another local merchant, knowing that I don\'t buy touristy junk. It was well worth the 2 block walk in the hot sun to walk into this delight. More than a store and surely better than any museum. Hadn\'t my husband been waiting for me down by the church sitting on a cool bench while he smoked a Cuban, a rare treat for him, I would have lingered longer. But alas! Then I would have bought more and my funds and luggage space were limited for this trip. Don Ram\u00f3n answered all my questions, entertained me with some of his  history, and explained about all the art and artifacts displayed for sale. His wife, equally delightful, is a petite lovely woman and we talked about food, their long marriage as well as mine. This is one stop I won\'t miss during my time in Baja from now on. To find it, you must leave the main street and wander around where the locals live. No better way to get to know an ancient culture and its people.

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

361036681.name: Most vibrant colors in clay I\'ve ever seen
361036681.author: a TripAdvisor user
361036681.reviewBody: We were taken here by our Land\'s End Tours guide and were amazed at the beautiful pieces in this gallery.  Apparently there are very few people in the world that can achieve the unbelievable colors with clay that this man can.  My pictures unfortunately don\'t do justice.  We bought a small piece and hopefully on our next trip we\'ll bring home something bigger.  Very nice people and not pushy at all, left us to ourselves unless we needed answers to any questions.  Would highly recommend a stop even if not interested in buying anything just to see something out of the ordinary.

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

357382852.name: Amazing pottery!
357382852.author: a TripAdvisor user
357382852.reviewBody: This is a great shop in Todos Santos, featuring the most beautiful pottery in a wide range of amazing colours. Definitely a place to visit on your walk about town!

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

334327292.name: Fabulous pottery and handmade jewelry
334327292.author: a TripAdvisor user
334327292.reviewBody: Bright and colorful clay sculptured pottery and beautiful handmade silver jewelry.  Worth a stop!  Best gallery in Todos Santos

address.streetAddress: Topete Esq. Centenario

565146462.name: amazing place and friendly people
565146462.author: a TripAdvisor user
565146462.reviewBody: The food was excellent and the servers were very friendly and attended to our requests.  The menu was easy to read and everything was available.

470865768.name: Hidden Gem
470865768.author: a TripAdvisor user
470865768.reviewBody: I  live in the residential park behind the hotel and I know the family that runs it.   The rooms are quaintly decorated with Mexican furnishings. All 4 rooms are comfy and secure.  When I have family or friends visiting, I always recommend the Posada El Molino.  I look forward to meeting guests around the pool at happy hour... all are welcome!

242133798.name: Memories
242133798.author: a TripAdvisor user
242133798.reviewBody: I once, on an earlier trip to Baja, saw sugar being made in similar circumstances, so it was quite interesting to be reminded if that experience. I wonder if that occurred here?

241173686.name: Plenty there
241173686.author: a TripAdvisor user
241173686.reviewBody: We trekked on down to find this sugar mill (sort of behind a gas station on the grounds of condos) and I was pleased to see that there was so much left.  One major machine that was either a chopper or cane squeezer, and a brick-lined trench that led to the chimney, which probably held the large cauldrons, with fire underneath, for boiling the cane juice.  A small cauldron at the side is, I think, too small for industrial use of this magnitude.  A nice historical industrial site.

185222113.name: El Molino is Great
185222113.author: a TripAdvisor user
185222113.reviewBody: We stayed at the beautiful El Molino for 6 weeks in March and April of 2013 and that was one of our most memorable staycations ever. El  Molino (the mill) was once an old sugar cane mill and it was converted into a place that you can pull your trailer or motorhome or rent or buy one of the many unique places that are there already. Dick and Marge Olson were the best hosts and will cherish the friendships that were made with all the people at El Molino.

102331350.name: Living here and loving it.
102331350.author: a TripAdvisor user
102331350.reviewBody: I live in the park and feel fortunate to be here. The prices are great and the owners are now selling the parcels.

94777050.name: One Trip I Love to Make Every Year
94777050.author: a TripAdvisor user
94777050.reviewBody: This beautiful little park has a great pool with lovely garden and many reminders of the historic sugar mill.  Although the El Molino was once a trailer park, I wouldn\'t describe it as one now.  Most spots have full function kitchens and living areas built under open palapas. I love spending all my time outside in the warm Baja weather.  The El Molina is quiet and close to all the shops - very convenient location.  I have stayed there many times and I look foward to every comfy stay.  The rates are reasonable and the property is well maintained.   Dick and Marg and Alice and the rest of  the El Molino gang are friendly and most welcoming.  I also look forward to seeing the park\'s most beloved three-legged pouch, Scooby.  Only nine more sleeps until I\'m there again, February 2011.

580183938.name: Nice little park
580183938.author: a TripAdvisor user
580183938.reviewBody: This is a very nice, shady park in the heart of Todos Santos. It was one of the few places in the Baja we found with a play structure that actually has shade making it usable during the day. Sadly, three of the large slides (the blue ones) were all cracked/broken making them dangerous and unusable. The kids still had fun climbing on the structure and going down the other slides. There is also an area for skateboarding/biking. Overall, it is a nice park that made for a great stop for some shady fun on our drive from Cabo to La Paz.

address.streetAddress: Colegio Militar Zarageza

340236145.name: Excellent playground for the kids!
340236145.author: a TripAdvisor user
340236145.reviewBody: A great playground for the kids with very new equipment. There are at least 4 slides, one of them a long covered tube slide, and rest open and suitable for young children. Steps, climbing, ramps, rope, things to turn - bigger than most of the one\'s we\'ve played on in the U.S. \nQuite large, suitable for a lot of kids at once and a variety of ages; there were kids as young as 18 months and up to 7ish all enjoying the equipment as the adults mostly sat in the shade and watched.

address.streetAddress: Colegio Militar Zarageza

289346237.name: The Center of Todos Santos
289346237.author: a TripAdvisor user
289346237.reviewBody: This theatre is located across from the town square smack dab in the heart of Todos Santos.  Although it wasn\'t open on the day we were there, but it\'s a beautiful building with a lot of history based on the info on the marker out front.  Don\'t miss it if you plan to visit.

241446173.name: Fun to tour
241446173.author: a TripAdvisor user
241446173.reviewBody: The people here were kind enough to give our large group an impromptu tour.  It\'s a lovely theater but if you are there for a performance, get seats in the balcony which appears to have better air circulation.

207595281.name: The newly and beautifuly restored old theater
207595281.author: a TripAdvisor user
207595281.reviewBody: There are special events held here like the Todos Santos Film Festival, ethnic dance recitals and town meetings. Wander in and check it out. It is on the old square that has been totally redone and by the old mission church.

184924069.name: Gorgeous building!
184924069.author: a TripAdvisor user
184924069.reviewBody: We kept walking around Todos Santos and saw many lovely buildings - this was one of the most beautiful. There was a lot going on there and we found out from some locals that they are very proud of it. Just another great feature of this great area!!!

157051109.name: Great historical venue for a film fest!
157051109.author: a TripAdvisor user
157051109.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to make it into town for the end of the Film Festival.  This was a great event and the historical teatro was the ideal venue.

153433544.name: a lot of people at the opening of the Film Festival
153433544.author: a TripAdvisor user
153433544.reviewBody: The place was crowded and we got the last free seats. My sight onto the screen was blocked by the corner of the toilet entrance. As I am not tall my sight was also blocked by the handrail when sitting on the upper floor.

124663732.name: Beautiful, a must visit!
124663732.author: a TripAdvisor user
124663732.reviewBody: Saw a show during the "Art Festival". Artsy theater..a must visit!

643836680.name: Got to see this gem!
643836680.author: a TripAdvisor user
643836680.reviewBody: What a special find while out shopping.  His artwork starts at $25 for small painting.  Very reasonable with much talent.

address.streetAddress: Militar

676029143.name: Great beach area for the CHILL
676029143.author: a TripAdvisor user
676029143.reviewBody: Stayed at Cerritos Surf Town on the beach...can it get any better than that? totally chill place, barely a sole to be found. Highly recommended!

676026646.name: Surfing and sunburning
676026646.author: a TripAdvisor user
676026646.reviewBody: The waves were too big for new surfers so we just swam and played on the beach.  Next time I will rent shade  & chairs.    There are a lot of vendors of local tourist bling - hats, jewelry, massages.  The Bar was closed so we went to the new gazillion dollar condo complex being built.  An enterprising lady there has good drinks, nice & cold.  We will go again.

669047254.name: Pacific Perfection
669047254.author: a TripAdvisor user
669047254.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite beaches to visit each trip to Cabo.  It remains unspoiled and uncrowded- reminiscent of days gone by before the shoreline got crowded with condos/hotels.  (Though, I sense the wind of change coming to steal this bit of paradise as it did with Playa Chilleno and Santa Maria). It is a relaxed dog friendly beach with a clear surf vibe.  Powdery dark sand vs pebbles. Clear water and waves breaking on the sandbar.  Shallows and tidal pool areas to explore during low tides. If you sit to the far left facing the ocean (or take the dirt road immediately prior to one advertising Cerritos beach club) bring your own chairs and supplies.  No facilities other than a port a potty.  We shared our immediate stretch of sand with one other couple during busy Easter week. Occasionally a vendor might make their way down but are very friendly and not overly pushy. The homemade coconut popsicles are totally worth the 40 pesos.

668996661.name: Good beach but it can get crowded
668996661.author: a TripAdvisor user
668996661.reviewBody: This is a nice beach where people learn to surf.  I tried it and my back was not helping, good thing they offer back massages at the beach.

668947030.name: Ride Horseback Here!
668947030.author: a TripAdvisor user
668947030.reviewBody: We went on a trail ride through the palm tree jungle out to this beach. It is absolutely desolate - even when others are there.

668664559.name: Gorgeous spot
668664559.author: a TripAdvisor user
668664559.reviewBody:
My family was attending a destination wedding in Todos Santos, and part of the schedule included a beach day at Plata Los Cerritos.  Proved to be a great idea.

We drove past the entrance road, a good bet is to enter the Barracuda Cantina into your GPS, the (as everywhere in the area, except 19) unpaved but relatively smooth dirt road past there leads right to the beach, parallel parking along the sides of the road.  The view is fantastic both left and right.  Nice waves, most surfers were not staying on their boards very long.

Beach chairs and umbrellas are available for rent, in turn allows for access to the bathroom at the surf shop...better option is lunch at the Cantina, their bathrooms are basic (don't plan on locking the door) but meet the needs.  Fair number of folks hawking their wares, not aggressive.  Massages available.

Proved to be a great idea to include the "beach day"!

666830629.name: Relaxing day at the beach
666830629.author: a TripAdvisor user
666830629.reviewBody: Stopped here on a day trip from Cabo (60ish minute drive) with the intention of having enough time to continue on to explore La Paz, however we loved it here so much we spent the entire day! We had rented a Jeep but the dirt road drive to the beach is not very long at all. A car would be fine. The beach is simple. There\u2019s a restaurant with bathrooms plus a bar that makes delicious Tito\u2019s & lemonade. There were several people surfing and taking surf lessons. There are rocks you can climb on along a hotel that were pretty cool to see crabs on. The best part was the incredible massage right on the beach. There are a ton of different people offering massages. I thoroughly enjoyed my 60 minute massage listening to the waves and feeling the ocean breeze. I would recommend bringing in a cooler with drinks and snacks as it is limited. We did enjoy goat quesadillas in the parking lot from a food truck. Just a perfect day relaxing at the beach!

666441703.name: Fantastic family beach vacation
666441703.author: a TripAdvisor user
666441703.reviewBody: Traveled to Mexico and stayed for 9 days with just a short walk to Cerritos Beach. A little nervous at first as we turned off the highway onto a dusty gravel road but quickly became comfortable as many expats and tourists were in the area. Another family and ours rented two condos in the same corner unit at Cerritos Puesta Del Sol (the yellow condos) with onsite security. The upper unit had a rooftop entertainment area with seating under a shade structure, lawn chairs, BBQ, fridge, sink, table, and spectacular views. The lower unit had both a front and a larger, more private rear entertainment area. This back area was unique and perfect for our group. We spent several \u201cmovie nights\u201d and cook outs in the rear palapa area equipped with ample seating for both families, outdoor shower, BBQ kitchen with fridge and sink, fireplace, dining table, and place for TV. Shaded throughout the day and comfortable at night. If you are thinking of staying in Cerritos with a group or large family, my recommendation would be to find a corner unit at Cerritos Puesta Del Sol with a large outdoor entertainment area like this one. Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, bars, convenience stores, and activities in area to keep us busy for 9 days. Todos Santos has plenty of good restaurants and frequent events, like a microbrewery festival for the dads, shopping and mimosas for moms, and frequent baby turtle releases which was great for the kids. Cerritos, Palm, and Balandra beaches were fantastic.

659053248.name: Nice waves, sandy - chill
659053248.author: a TripAdvisor user
659053248.reviewBody: We stayed for almost the entire day. The waves were fun to bodysurf - one of the few in the area where one can easily get into the water. Beach is clean. Very few people selling their wares. This area is building up with new hotels and homes. It will be very different in a few years.

656806455.name: Remote enough for ya
656806455.author: a TripAdvisor user
656806455.reviewBody: Took 40 minutes to walk here.  Nice, but not good for swimming in my opinion.  I need to find easier access, or drive it, as a muddy road was a problem

655106787.name: Developers Are Encroaching
655106787.author: a TripAdvisor user
655106787.reviewBody:
This was by far our favourite beach in the area. Unfortunately resort development has increased dramatically and it’s starting to get ‘crowded’ and accessible parking is starting to wane. 

The Cerritos Beach Bar closed its ‘doors’ our final week there as the owner was disgruntled regarding the development happening right next door. This has severely impacted the accessibility of food, drinks, parking and banos. 

While there remains parking at the surf colonies, there is no beach bar, toilets are heavily used porta-potty’s. The surf colony charm is affected by the development of condos!

Will be time to explore further as this beach falls victim to development right to waters’ edge.

652815640.name: Barracuda has the best tacos I\u2019ve ever had!
652815640.author: a TripAdvisor user
652815640.reviewBody: We decided to stop in Cabo before going to our hotel. This was a mistake because finding it in the dark was quite the challenge. Luckily we saw lights on at barracuda. They were closed but offered us food anyway. We just wanted directions at that point but decided we would go back because they were so nice. Best decision we made on this trip. We sampled pretty much everything and realized we struck gold. The grilled shrimp tacos we our favorite but everything was great. If you are near Cerritos beach and don\u2019t eat there you are missing out! You\u2019re welcome!

652807032.name: Awesome
652807032.author: a TripAdvisor user
652807032.reviewBody: Wonderful beach with lovely people but not too many. Great for sunning, swimming, wading & surfing (Or so I hear). Minimal beach combing - some rocks but almost no shells. The sound of the surf is the best lullaby at night.

651784821.name: Beautiful Beach
651784821.author: a TripAdvisor user
651784821.reviewBody: My family and I stayed there for a few nights over the Christmas holiday.  The water was warm, but rough.  I still went in with my kids everyday to ride the waves.  The atmosphere is laid back, beach is clean and the water was wonderful.  \n\nThere are places to rent surfboards and get surfing lessons or ride horses.  We didn\'t surf, but I will next time I visit.  I thought this was a great place to bring the family- my kids loved it!!  We will definitely visit again (along with another stay in Todos Santos!)

650621608.name: Too many people
650621608.author: a TripAdvisor user
650621608.reviewBody: We were not impressed with the people wanting to sell massages, etc. on the beach. It may be ok for a bit younger crowd, but this vacation we were looking for quiet and peaceful.  Granted, it is one of the few places you can swim in the ocean with a better amount of safety, but it just wasn\'t for us.

649930333.name: Solitude
649930333.author: a TripAdvisor user
649930333.reviewBody: We had the beach to ourselves. Rented a couple of Bikes from Soul America Ebikes in Todos Santos. They were so helpful and really affordable rentals. Beautiful ride to the beach along some really fun trails.\nI would put that on a must do list if you go to Todos Santos.

649581128.name: Windy, Beautiful and Happy
649581128.author: a TripAdvisor user
649581128.reviewBody: I only stopped here briefly at the request of a day tour I was on to Todos Santos.  I wanted to see this area, which was described to me as a "surf camp".  The road is a dirt one.  Hard packed.  If you dont have AWD/4x4, the road can be quite fun!  I saw a number of overlander vehicles parked near the beach.  Random nice waggy tailed dogs wandering around.  The beach had a number of tents set up and people asking if we wanted massages or to rent the various body boards available.\n\nThe beach is wide and clean.  I wandered into the water.  Nice temp for January.  There are a number of places to stay: camp, hotel, condo, etc. I really like the calm easy atmosphere of this area and would love to come back and spend more time here.

646695593.name: Cerritos is one of my favorite beaches
646695593.author: a TripAdvisor user
646695593.reviewBody: If you are looking to try surfing, body surfing or just get wet this is the perfect beach. I\'ve been here twice and this year we brought the whole family including mom who says she got the best massage.  I also love to do a little beach shopping while sunbathing. The local vendors will approach you but are not pushy like in Cabo. I enjoy a good barter and really love the jewelry and mexican blankets I\'ve gotten here.

645420954.name: Cerritos Beach
645420954.author: a TripAdvisor user
645420954.reviewBody: I loved Playa Los Cerritos! Nice quiet beach with soft sand and not too crowded! We were staying at a condo nearby and walked to the beach daily!

642880446.name: Cerritos Beach
642880446.author: a TripAdvisor user
642880446.reviewBody:
Great for families & surfers.
Best to bring your own refreshments and if you park close to the cliffs, parking will be free.
Some vendors on beach with the usual souvenirs from the mainland.
Watch your belongings & leave valuables at home.
Will be having a massage on the beach soon & will report back.

642457056.name: Get Here Before Its Gone!
642457056.author: a TripAdvisor user
642457056.reviewBody:
Awesome, clean beach--get here before the condos come and tourist hordes!

Water is clean and sand is great--almost unspoiled--locals who rent boards and body boards are friendly and you should talk to them before getting in the water.

The waves and conditions can be extremely fickle here--we went for a day and it was all peaceful and the waves were flat and calm, and then on our next visit the waves were about 4 feet high, there was an audible roar from the waves, and a really strong undertow and rip current. Even if you're a good swimmer--the undertow and rip can be anywhere from non existent to nasty. 

Beach was not busy, totally peaceful, and loved the sound of the waves!

642034856.name: Good spot for surf lessons
642034856.author: a TripAdvisor user
642034856.reviewBody: We were advised to go to Cerritos to get a relaxed beach and do some surfing.  It is an easy drive from Cabo (about an hour depending on traffic in town) and you head down a dirt road.  There is limited parking, so I would advise arriving early.  It\'s a bit of a free for all - there are several "surf schools" set up on the beach in a pop-up kind of way.  These are all on the north end of the beach.  We used Tacho at Westside and were very satisfied.  $60 included board, wetsuit (water is chilly) and about an hour in the water after instruction on land.  Was a little crowded where they were doing the instruction, but waves were great for beginners.\n\nWalking a little bit south and the beach is basically deserted, so nice and quiet if you like that.  There are no public restrooms on the beach.  There is a small restaurant that has bathrooms but you have to pay premium prices for drinks or food to use them.

639823418.name: Searching Barracuda Cantina
639823418.author: a TripAdvisor user
639823418.reviewBody: Beach for surfers. Rentals, schools etc. In my case i was searching Barracuda cantina, one of the best all Baja cantina. Incredibly fresh fish tacos 40 MXN Bohemia beer 45 MXN Enormous plate of guacamole. A MUST

639300148.name: Beautiful
639300148.author: a TripAdvisor user
639300148.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach, even better if you are a surfer
Lots of typically beach amenities: surfboards, umbrellas rental, restaurant,
But no public bathroom or changing areas.Parking could be problematic. 
High rating based on scenic beauty.

638614911.name: Best swimmable beach on Pacific side
638614911.author: a TripAdvisor user
638614911.reviewBody: With its flat, sandy beach, this is a safe place to swim, surf and hang out.  Its not near much, but there are vendors on the beach who can provide surf boards, umbrellas etc. The road to this beach is a dirt road, so beware of the bumps! After swimming, go to Todo Santos for some lunch.

636326313.name: One of the Better Beaches on the West Side
636326313.author: a TripAdvisor user
636326313.reviewBody: One of the better beaches on the west side of the Baja.  Close to Todos Santos, an artsy, unique place to visit.  If you\'re in the area check-out the town!!

634941680.name: Great Surfing Beach and Wading
634941680.author: a TripAdvisor user
634941680.reviewBody: Our family stopped by he beach to check it out.  Two of us were surfers and two not.  We enjoyed our time in the water and people watching.  No surfing today, but maybe tomorrow.  We had fun watching the surfers.

632365372.name: Gringo Expat territory
632365372.author: a TripAdvisor user
632365372.reviewBody: Always great. Complete opposite of Medano Beach. Catering to the expats and locals who live in the surrounding communities. Excellent spot to come take a surf lesson, boogie board, horseback ride or just hang with the fam. There\'s a gate that says "members only". You ARE a member! Just get out, hit the buzzer and tell them you\'re there to spend the day. They want to just make sure you order something from the restaurant which, by the way, has probably THE best fish taco\'s in all of south Baja. We know it\'s a bold statement but... 3 tacos with 2 large portions of un-breaded, flaky, grilled white fish that was more than enough for 2 people!

630762434.name: beautiful and uncrowded
630762434.author: a TripAdvisor user
630762434.reviewBody: Clean and accessible beach. We walked and came across a runner and two couples on one side of the beach. We watched the sunset and enjoyed the beach.

619608006.name: Great surf, beautiful beach!
619608006.author: a TripAdvisor user
619608006.reviewBody: I frequented Cerritos a few times on my trip. Loved this beach. The water was warm, beautiful and clear.The surf was pretty great too. You can rent boards, chairs, umbrellas from a few places on the beach. Drive from Cabo is super easy.

613491566.name: What a beach!
613491566.author: a TripAdvisor user
613491566.reviewBody: The typical pacific beach, very long and very wild! the waves are not that big in August so not dangerous to swim, few surfing schools on the beach

613281586.name: Awesome Beach
613281586.author: a TripAdvisor user
613281586.reviewBody: Nice beach, some waves, very quiet, one place on the beach that has $1 tequila shots. There are some guys renting chairs and umbrellas. Nice spot to go if you are couples. About 1 hour north on 19 from Cabo San Lucas. If you went that far, mite as well go to Todos Santos.

612653092.name: Laid back family beach \ud83c\udfd6
612653092.author: a TripAdvisor user
612653092.reviewBody: With the dirt road into the beach from the highway, it still feels a little remote with some of the old hippy charm. At the moment it\u2019s not overly developed but not sure how much longer that will last. Some good waves \ud83c\udf0a for surfing whether it be board, body or boogie. Lots of rental places so you can strike a good deal for sports gear plus chairs and umbrellas. The water was a little chilly, even in late July. We got massages on the beach too. Great way to spend a family day.

612618373.name: Best for day use due to development
612618373.author: a TripAdvisor user
612618373.reviewBody: Nice long beach but difficult for camping as much of the beachfront property is either being developed or private.

604331556.name: Love Cerritos
604331556.author: a TripAdvisor user
604331556.reviewBody: Fun surf beach, punchy little beach break and friendly locals. Will definitely come back we stayed at Villas de Cerritos Beach, short walking distance to the beach.

603606103.name: Fun swimming beach
603606103.author: a TripAdvisor user
603606103.reviewBody: We love this place. we visit every time.  great tacos around the corner. dont miss taking a long long walk

603139268.name: Great surf beach with food and drinks near by.
603139268.author: a TripAdvisor user
603139268.reviewBody: Great beach for learners and advanced surfers. There are several good options for food and drink right off the beach

600284522.name: GREAT Surf lessons
600284522.author: a TripAdvisor user
600284522.reviewBody: Went to Los Cerritos beach so my 16 year old daughter could have a surf lesson. We hired Edgar and I highly recommend him. He was patient and very professional. For $1000 pesos you learn the basics on the sand (15 - 30 min) and then you have a full hour in the water with him as a coach. Ask for him on your way walking to the beach. You get to keep the surf board for the day and you can even swap it for a boogie board if you want you. Safe place to learn how to surf.

599684890.name: Big beautiful crashing waves \ud83c\udf0a
599684890.author: a TripAdvisor user
599684890.reviewBody: Lovely beach off the path, on the way to Todos Santos. Good spot to rent a surf board, big waves. Glad we made the stop for a quick swim!

594066519.name: I don\'t get it.
594066519.author: a TripAdvisor user
594066519.reviewBody:
First, I LOVE BCS Mexico.I own a condo in La Paz, have a farm in Seattle and have traveled Mexico for 30 years. What I love most about La Paz ( So.Baja) are the people. La Paz. Cabo, East Cape. Some of the best people I know. Americans can learn a lot from them. In my opinion, the best beaches in Southern Baja are in La Paz. Been to Todos Santos before but never to the beaches. So after a hot July afternoon of shopping some furniture, we did (like many locals) head to the beach when things are  bit cooler...around 5pm). We drove the dirt road to Playa Los Cerritos for the first time. We don't surf..we like scuba diving and fishing and had heard its not a good swimming beach. We found the beach just "ok". was looking forward to some local food, cooling off, relaxing. Los Cerritos is geared for surfing and boarding. ( we of coarse knew this prior to coming) We set up our umbrella and chairs. My wife went to change and use the banos. The beach club said no. Not even if you buy something. They sent her to the public outhouse. She walked over...it was locked. 
With no services I cant see what anyone sees in this beach. Even as a destination to vacation...I dont get it. I think there are MUCH better areas to go in BCS. Im sure we'll go back but very limited. I found it nothing more that an extention of Cabo (even though we're not partyers I like Cabo much much better). We didnt find the people as warm either. Indifferent would be a good word.
A possible explaination may be that perhaps ,as a small town, these folks are tired of getting hammered by American tourists gringos. IDK. All I know is that this is a 2 star beach to me. ( 2 stars because the water is always nice 😎)
Sorry. I thought the beach ( what I would describe) as gray.
BTW
With perspective I have traveled to most prominent beaches in the world. ( scuba diving,).
los Cerritos...disappointed...I don't get the great reviews.

593543476.name: Great boogie boarding and surfing
593543476.author: a TripAdvisor user
593543476.reviewBody: We hired a driver for the day taking all 11 of us to this beach then into the town of Todo Santos. This beach had plenty of waves for my younger two boys and also larger waves for my oldest. We drove to Cerritos Surf Colony right on the beach to access the surf....Although we did not rent a place here, we were able to rent chairs and umbrellas for down on the beach. We were also able to order drinks and food from the pool side bar they had. This is a must visit beach if you like waves!

590636636.name: Fun with the waves!
590636636.author: a TripAdvisor user
590636636.reviewBody: My kids are 9 and 12 and they wanted more waves than we had in our palmilla local beach.  They absolutely loved Cerritos - my 12 year old daughter would hardly come out of the water.  Suitable for kids 7 years and older that are good swimmers and confortable with waves.  My  3 year old niece loved splashing around in the shore.  The water was on the colder side... but still ok.\nSand is fine/sticky - but marvelous for building sand castles.  A fun day at the beach!\n

590015353.name: Surf for everyone
590015353.author: a TripAdvisor user
590015353.reviewBody: Warm water and a looooong expanse of beach great for everyone. Walk or sunbathe on the beach, but the main attraction is the surf. Local board rentals and lessons are available right in the beach. Lots of beachbreak for beginners and a right point for others.\nEasy drive from Todos Santos and Los Cabos - could probably even make a long day trip from La Paz. Dirt road to beach leads off main highway just before El Pescadero heading south. Parking along road - latecomers walk farther.

580926336.name: Clean and quiet
580926336.author: a TripAdvisor user
580926336.reviewBody: Clean and quiet beach, We has a good time relaxing in the sun. Far from our hotel. about 45 min. drive.

580220705.name: Frequent visitor - Lovely beach
580220705.author: a TripAdvisor user
580220705.reviewBody:
WE have been gong to this beach since 2012. It has definitely changed - so much development has occurred in those few years. The north side of the beach has restaurants and bars and LOTS of PEOPLE.  
If you want to really enjoy peace and quiet you have to hike down the beach or find an access point that doesn't go through private property.
The water and the sand are lovely and you can walk out without going under ( I guess that depends how tall you are) for some distance. Surfing is best done on the north side - the waves get bigger due to the rocks below the Hacienda Cerritos hotel.
We stay in El Pescadero on the beach ( vrbo ) but you can't swim on that beach. It is quieter and has more facilities ( ie groceries etc).

579322325.name: Quiet beach with big waves
579322325.author: a TripAdvisor user
579322325.reviewBody: The beach has some fine black sand between the desert sand. The waves create great patterns. There hardly any people present. The waves and tide make it unsuitable for swimming, especially for little children.\nFor walking your dog or running it\'s perfect.\n

578655325.name: Really nice and long/big beach
578655325.author: a TripAdvisor user
578655325.reviewBody: We didn\u2019t stay long, just passing through. Didn\u2019t notice a horse manure smell, as noted in another recent post.... perhaps don\u2019t plant yourself next to the porta potty, or the possible pile of horse dung? (I don\u2019t know if horses are there or not). Also can\u2019t comment on the walking vendors, but it is a public beach in Mexico, get over it and learn how to say \u201cnot today\u201d in Spanish (hint - it\u2019s \u201cno hoy\u201d and then his silent) ..... it\u2019s a beautiful stretch of sand and the waves, while small, were surf-able. Lots of beginners out there with rentals (available right there). As we walked from the parking area to the beach, someone asked if we wanted to rent an umbrella, so those are available too. We came from La Paz to visit Todos Santos, so really didn\u2019t have time, nor come prepared, for the beach. I didn\u2019t see anything that would have kept us from hanging for the day

576651032.name: Not my cup of tea
576651032.author: a TripAdvisor user
576651032.reviewBody:
Everyone raved to my husband and I about how great Cerritos beach is. 
And maybe it is for surfing because if the waves.
We just went to relax and have. A few beers in the sand.
1. You can’t move 10 feet without someone trying to sell something to you; and 
2. When we were there it smelled like a horse stable.
To each their own, but this was not my cup of tea.

572991767.name: An Incredible Stretch!
572991767.author: a TripAdvisor user
572991767.reviewBody:
"Stretch"-- is the correct terminology for this  incredibly clean, pristine, and uncluttered
BAJA  Beach! A paradise in many areas for surfing. Probably will become the eventual focus for development---until than----Don't miss the opportunity to stroll
this pastoral Pacific Beach experience.
Recommended!

572242594.name: Stay Here!! Not Cabo
572242594.author: a TripAdvisor user
572242594.reviewBody: This beach is the best!! Nothing like the hustle and hassle of Cabo.  You will be the only people there (almost).

572001568.name: Great for surfing
572001568.author: a TripAdvisor user
572001568.reviewBody: This is a great beach for hanging out on and a great surf. The downside Is that they are building and you now have to walk around and could not walk through so it is a very long walk to get there

570290302.name: Awesome beach
570290302.author: a TripAdvisor user
570290302.reviewBody: Not crowded, clean with a couple of options for eating, massages by the beach are amazing!! really affordable comparing with Resort\u2019s  prices. \nWeaves not too big very friendly, I\u2019d say fun and safe for kids. You can find by the beach some water sport rentals, good prices too. Like like \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffc\ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffc

570279121.name: Beautiful beach
570279121.author: a TripAdvisor user
570279121.reviewBody: Awesome beach, remote and unspoiled great for surfing and/or just relaxing on the beach. Cerritos has a couple locations to stay right on the beach in a cassita.

570271623.name: Best Beach Day Trip
570271623.author: a TripAdvisor user
570271623.reviewBody: This is a more free-spirited beach than those in Cabo area.  It is large and expansive so there is a lot of space to get away from the more crowded and tourist section offering surf lessons and chair rentals, etc.  It is unguarded and a bit rustic lacking in facilities so bring a cooler with food or drink. The waves break out on the sandbar (no shore-break) and if you are lucky enough to get there during low tide- the shallows are perfect for kids.  Fine sandy bottom\u2014 although the sand is more gray in color than white.  There are some vendors that come by but none were aggressive or obnoxious. Try the $2 homemade popsicles \u2014coconut, mango, banana, strawberry\u2014very refreshing. It\u2019s also a dog friendly beach and I enjoyed watching the canines thrill in the joy of life\u2019s moments.  The town of Cerritos was just a few miles ahead and offered quite a few local spots for quick bite to eat.  Worth the trip.

569546915.name: Try Going To The Undeveloped Part
569546915.author: a TripAdvisor user
569546915.reviewBody: I\'ll throw a little disclaimer out there and say the part of the beach I went to might have actually been called something else, but we just went where the GPS said the beach was. It was down a dirt (sand?) road and the only other people on the beach were a couple of surfers and a Mexican family that had set up for the day (they had the whole deal with a BBQ and tent and everything up). We just sat down for awhile and watched the waves, because they were too high for swimming, though the surfers looked like they were having fun. I think the part of the beach where the road signs point you to is the more "touristy" area (which we also visited, it was a very different vibe but not as touristy as beaches in Cabo, for example). If you can find your way to the undeveloped area, it\'s a nice peaceful place to just sit and chill for a bit.

568742249.name: Okay for an hour or so....
568742249.author: a TripAdvisor user
568742249.reviewBody:
Went here hoping to have some lunch, relax in the sun, go for a swim. 
Disappointed to find there was nowhere to eat and drink anywhere near, as non residents are not allowed anywhere near the hotels and the only restaurant was shut. 
Undaunted, took our coolbag with fruit and drinks on the beach. It was a nice beach but quite crowded, touristy with vendors selling all sorts of stuff on constant patrol. 
The stalls hiring cheap little body boards would not hire by the hour,  the  half day hire charge was ridiculous, so we didn’t bother! It did make playing in the surf a bit tricky, watch out for the rip tides!! 
Glad to return to our delightful casita to be honest!

568555591.name: Great tourist-y family style beach
568555591.author: a TripAdvisor user
568555591.reviewBody: This is a happy place for many people!  The vibes are definitely "happy tourist" ones - but locals also frequent this beach since it is one of the few places you can safely swim in the area... the surf lessons have a good reputation, and the beach is as pretty as a beach can be!

567777238.name: What a Beach!
567777238.author: a TripAdvisor user
567777238.reviewBody: Cerritos beach  is an awesome place to swim and stay ,,the Hacienda on the point above the beach has a great atmosphere and reasonable prices the food is excellent not Costco burgers like other places ,,,,the playa is fun for swimmers and surfers alike lots of surf instructors and pretty safe beach

567412500.name: Beautiful Expansive Beach
567412500.author: a TripAdvisor user
567412500.reviewBody: We stopped here on our drive back from Todos Santos to San Jose del Cabo. Beautuful expansive beach and hardly anyone here. The area has not (yet) been built up or "Western-ized". Bring your sun chairs and umbrellas, enjoy the fresh sea air and sunshine and enjoy the day!!

567350064.name: Beautiful Place to Surf!
567350064.author: a TripAdvisor user
567350064.reviewBody: We arranged a day of surfing at Playa Los Cerritos with Todo Santos Eco Adventure.  They arranged for us to have a surf lesson on the beach, gave us directions and information regarding what we needed to know.  It was awesome!  Thanks TSEA for such a fabulous day in Mexico!

566851069.name: Largely Undeveloped
566851069.author: a TripAdvisor user
566851069.reviewBody: We made a stop at Los Cerritos on our drive from Cabo to Todos Santos. Look for the sign and dirt road around Km 66 on Highway 19. This is a beautiful long beach with crashing waves, and it was nearly empty when we visited on a Monday morning! A handful of surfers braved the chilly water and several dogs frolicked along the shore. There are a few hotels and a surfer\u2019s colony, but for the most part the beach is largely undeveloped. Construction is in-progress though, so make your way here before the condos take over. We didn\u2019t see any beach restrooms or vendors, so plan accordingly. There are surf board rentals and lessons available. Playa Los Cerritos is worth a detour.

566342684.name: Great place to learn to surf
566342684.author: a TripAdvisor user
566342684.reviewBody: We came here to learn to surf.  The beach and area are not very built up.  There are no bathrooms or showers. The waves are perfect for learning to surf.  You can get a massage on the beach for $20-30 per hour.  It\'s a fun place to go.

565364057.name: Great boogie boarding beach !
565364057.author: a TripAdvisor user
565364057.reviewBody: We brought our own boogie boards to this beach and it met our expectations as far as the waves . We were however disappointed that there was nowhere to eat or have a drink on the beach other than 1  expensive "private " restaurant who had their own parking lot , if you ate there. Pack your own food in and out .  The roads to and from the beach are rough so you\'d be best advised to rent an SUV. The car was adequate but certainly not great on the road in /out.

564686180.name: Great day at the beach
564686180.author: a TripAdvisor user
564686180.reviewBody: Perfect for our needs - sunbathing, boogie boarding, relaxing. For $10 we rented to beach chairs and an umbrella for the day. Be prepared for lots of local vendors trying to see you their wares. A simple, "No, gracias" was enough - but we repeated the phrase about 30 times that day.

563164636.name: What a disappointment!
563164636.author: a TripAdvisor user
563164636.reviewBody: We have been coming to this beach for over 10 years and loved it! So beautiful and peaceful. Great place to watch the surfers and waves!  Loved the bar and restaurant! NOW you have to join the "beach club" to use it. In order to park and eat/drink, you have to spend $1000 pesos a person and must show a receipt before they will open the gate for you to leave! They are building condos right next to only public parking area.  Hope the condos don\'t take over!

561614086.name: Silky soft sand
561614086.author: a TripAdvisor user
561614086.reviewBody:
I came to Cerritos in 2017 for a surf lesson with Mario's. Beautiful long beach with silky soft, fine sands, at high tide, you can walk out over a hundred yards and still be only waist deep. The shallows shimmer with black and gold sand, at least at the north end where we were hanging out.
Home of the Cerritos Surf Club and a full service restaurant, we didn't dine there so can't comment on that. They will, however, only allow patrons to use their restrooms, and the only others are long walks from the beach. One was an outhouse back at the main parking area, with a sign on the door that said they charged $10 for its use.
There were several places there giving surf lessons and renting out surf and boogie boards for $15 and $10 for the day, as well as umbrella rentals. There are also a handful of tents set up for spa services and half a dozen vendors hawking their wares, but they weren't overly obnoxious and generally took your first "no" for an answer.
Oh, and for the record, the half a dozen or so dogs we saw seemed to really love the place, including one that even surfed!

558665742.name: Beautiful beach
558665742.author: a TripAdvisor user
558665742.reviewBody: Spent a couple of days here, busy at one end of the beach where people are surfing, otherwise no one on it.  Fantastic

557246345.name: Enjoy the sun
557246345.author: a TripAdvisor user
557246345.reviewBody: It is an amazing beach to swim and lay in the sun. Watch out for the undertoe thst will pull you out and take you for a spin

553881955.name: Beautiful, clear water. Swimmable!
553881955.author: a TripAdvisor user
553881955.reviewBody: We didn\'t expect such a lovely beach. The pictures made this beach look dirty and harsh. We loved the beach and had a couple of great days there.

552491913.name: Great place to boogie board and learn to surf!
552491913.author: a TripAdvisor user
552491913.reviewBody: Cerritos has been up and coming but thanks to the amazing work of the locals, this beach is still top notch! Clean, dog friendly, waves big enough to surf, small enough to boogie board! There are guys with chocolate covered bananas and ice cream going up and down the beach, or hit up one of the local restaurants and get the ceviche!

551231376.name: Lovely Beach
551231376.author: a TripAdvisor user
551231376.reviewBody: This beach is perfect for little and big kids. Great shallow areas and fun big waves. Rentals for boogie boards and surf boards on site.

549626242.name: Surfing is great
549626242.author: a TripAdvisor user
549626242.reviewBody: Very good waves\nAmazing surf class at Cerritos surf and town\nBreakfast not great but ceviche lunch just perfect.

549403345.name: Nice
549403345.author: a TripAdvisor user
549403345.reviewBody: Crowded beach with great whale watching and perfect waves for teens.  Lots of novice surfers who think they\'re pros.

549061758.name: Quiet surf village
549061758.author: a TripAdvisor user
549061758.reviewBody: Always a favorite to visit when in the area!\nGoing to blow up in the next couple of years, a pity. Always a full of dogs having fun in the surf!

548923084.name: Nice beach, less crowded then Cabo
548923084.author: a TripAdvisor user
548923084.reviewBody: Our local friend took us here for lunch at the beach club.  It is a very pretty and swimable beach.  The beach club had good live music, a nice place to watch the sunset.  They have few vendors and massages on the beach that looked amazing!  We will be back here, it is only about 30 minutes from Cabo and the drive was easy on a 4 lane highway.

548502728.name: Amazing place to get away
548502728.author: a TripAdvisor user
548502728.reviewBody: We started a great walk from this desolate pacific beach!! \nFor fun go hike up the hill to the South- this is the improvised fishing area for the local area. Hotel next door looks dreamy

547871962.name: Great surf spot
547871962.author: a TripAdvisor user
547871962.reviewBody: One of the best beaches to go around Todos Santos for surf, for beginner, to advanced surfers. It is definitely on the touristy side, which is potentially the only downside. However, the farther South you move down the beach, the quieter it is. If you\'re in the mood for a surf lesson or massage, this is the place to go. Plenty of great options to choose from, but ask for Oscar if you\'re looking for a lesson, he\'s awesome.

547743577.name: Dirty
547743577.author: a TripAdvisor user
547743577.reviewBody: I had last visited this beach 5 years ago when it was a more pristine beach. This time I found the beach to be dirty and cluttered with vendors. Surf, boogie board shacks. The sand was fine but dirty and the alot of debris over beach very disappointing.

547436861.name: Great beach for beginners to learn surf
547436861.author: a TripAdvisor user
547436861.reviewBody: We went with some friends to try surf and it was a great day. Great spot with easy waves to make your first steps into surf. You can surf the long foamy after-waves. \nFun day. We would love to return. Totally recommended.

544115864.name: Very fun beach
544115864.author: a TripAdvisor user
544115864.reviewBody: This is a very fun beach to play on. They have a beach vendor making enchiladas that are awesome. They have many people offering massages also. I will come back for sure.

542540800.name: Fun beach
542540800.author: a TripAdvisor user
542540800.reviewBody: Fun beach! Nice small waves and swimmable section. Friendly people lots of dogs and surfers. Bring your umbrella and chairs, sticky sand and no shade.

542020998.name: Great beach, nice surfing even for beginners
542020998.author: a TripAdvisor user
542020998.reviewBody: This is a relaxed beach where you can easily rent a parasol and some chairs. And, of course, surfing gear. Make a good deal with the guys on the beach and enjoy the waves. To be honest, we suck at surfing, but still had a good time in the waves of the Pacific. Do know that there are few places to get a drink or food on the beach, so bring your own!

539102748.name: Surfs up
539102748.author: a TripAdvisor user
539102748.reviewBody: Cerritos is the best beach on the pacific side of Baja California Sur  for surfing and swimming. We go there all the time. Great for families

533479784.name: great place for body surfing and boogie boarding
533479784.author: a TripAdvisor user
533479784.reviewBody: Near the point at the southern end of the beach, there are great breaking waves off shore where the surfers catch great rides.  Closer into shore shore there are still enough of the incoming waves to enjoy body surfing and boogie boarding. The beach area is very large so there is no crowded feeling.  The free parking close to the beach is adequate

525005061.name: Amazing Surfing Place
525005061.author: a TripAdvisor user
525005061.reviewBody:
Beach break. Pretty big waves.
Possible to rent a nice surfboard on a beach around 20/30 per day, possible to have discounts if you want to rent a board for few days.
Beach not so good just to lay there.
It's more surfers place.

515341817.name: August
515341817.author: a TripAdvisor user
515341817.reviewBody:
You can't beat this chillin beach, one of the only swimmable beaches on the west coast of Baja Sur

Check it out, surfing from beginners to the most experienced, 

Or just enjoy a few beverages and have fun in the sun!

513889129.name: #1 Baja Sur Beach - Pacific Side
513889129.author: a TripAdvisor user
513889129.reviewBody: This is the beach your looking for.   Beach bar, Surfing and Pacifico.  Be sure to stop in at Free Souls.   Wow.  Simply Amazing.

512847028.name: Quite a change from 5 years ago
512847028.author: a TripAdvisor user
512847028.reviewBody:
We spent the day at Playa Los Cerritos with some friends. This beach has changed quite a bit since we visited it 5 years ago. Then there was the dirt road down to the beach, a restaurant/bar on the beach, and bathrooms were not free unless you were buying from the bar/restaurant.

Now they still have the dirt road, but there is a parallel road just south of it that is paved. You go on that until you hit the gates for the hotel/condos/whatever that is there, and then turn right onto a shorter dirt road to the beach. Look for the unique domed hotel(?) [see pictures] on the point that can be seen from Highway 19 and that shows you are at Cerritos Beach

What you encounter now, before the restaurant I mentioned, is the Cerritos Beach Club. We used this. You pay $25 US per person for the use of the facilities -- a beach towel, the large pool, the umbrellas, hammocks, beds, and tables around the pool, the showers to wash the sand off, the bar and restaurant there, the waiter service around the pool, the parking, and the bathrooms. Anything you eat or drink is deducted from your $25, so try to keep track of prices so you don't go over your $25 limit. The fee can be paid with a credit card.

The beach is very swimmable at low tide, and during the summer (we were there in August), the waves aren't that big and the water temperature is pleasant. Beach equipment can be rented from a shack right in front of the beach club. Boogie boarding was what are friends liked to do.

The original restaurant had signs saying no coolers were allowed on the beach in front of the restaurant. They also had massage tables there. (Can't remember if they had massage tables 5 years ago).

512024004.name: Great beach to learn how to surf
512024004.author: a TripAdvisor user
512024004.reviewBody: You can learn how to surf here. Beware of the tides listen to the locals. Very nice sand very different to the beaches in Cabo. Worth the visit we will be back for more surf lessons .

511604541.name: Lovely sandy beach
511604541.author: a TripAdvisor user
511604541.reviewBody: Difficult to reach because the road is bad and it\'s quite a distance from Los \nCabos. I was on a tour that stopped here for about 10 minutes. It\'s very disappointing to finally get to a swimable beach, only to be unprepared and unable to stay. It\'s a beautiful place. If you\'re hoping to enjoy a swimable beach while in the area, try to get lodging as close to this beach as possible.

509723013.name: Great off-season
509723013.author: a TripAdvisor user
509723013.reviewBody: Perhaps the only beach between Todos and Pescadero you can easily get to, and also one of the most swimmable beaches, as the rip tides even a few hundred yards north or south are a bit dangerous. The beach club there is nice, and you can rent any kind of beach paraphrenalia you might need...umbrellas, boogie boards, etc. Surf lessons if that\'s your thing. Touristy beach club shack that is fine for a maragita or a cold cerveza. Bar food that is really good--burgers and nachos. High-season is a bit crowded and nuts. Off-season has a thin crowd and, for an old man like me, much nicer. Have a cold beer and watch some pretty big surf roll in.

505974890.name: Great swimable beach
505974890.author: a TripAdvisor user
505974890.reviewBody: Visited this beach about 10 years ago. Wow has it changed. There was nothing there back then but now they have a restaurant on the beach with a bar and you can get massages on the beach. It\'s quite the happening little place now. The water is still the same with the gold flakes and there is a little bit of surf but not like the rest of the beaches around Cabo.

505937691.name: One of the few swimmable beaches by Todos
505937691.author: a TripAdvisor user
505937691.reviewBody:
We have been coming to Cerritos for several years now, and it is one of our favorite beaches in the Todos area. With the tides, many of the beaches are not recommended for swimming, but at Cerritos the gradual slope of the beach allows you to wade in as far as you want without a steep drop-off. 

The bar is a great place to get margaritas, it is important to stay hydrated ;) And there are bathrooms you can use there as well. They do ask that you are a paying customer to use them.

One year we took surf lessons with Mario's surf school. While not the easiest place to learn to surf, they do a great job of helping you get used to the waves and board.

The beach is long and being developed more and more ever year, however the further south you go from the bar/restaurant you can have peace and quiet. 

Don't forget to purchase a bottle of Cerritos tequila before you leave the beach. It is sold at the bar, and the only place we have seen it in the area.

501025639.name: Swimable beach
501025639.author: a TripAdvisor user
501025639.reviewBody: Great way to spend a Sunday afternoon and interact with the local people.  Wish I could spend every Sunday here.

496819179.name: Great beach with a great beach bar and lots of toys to rent
496819179.author: a TripAdvisor user
496819179.reviewBody: We go here every time we\'re in Cabo. It\'s a bit off the beaten path but well worth finding. Decent waves for boogie boards and beginning surfing, but water is often quite cold. Kids have a lot of fun here renting surf boards, boogie boards etc. Decent bar on the beach with decent food and bathrooms.

494368659.name: Chill surfing experience
494368659.author: a TripAdvisor user
494368659.reviewBody: Three father/daughter diads, we spent a day at Cerritos Beach. It was a quiet place with a fun restaurant, not too many hawkers (but definitely some), massages on the beach ($23 for an hourlong massage!) and Mario\'s Surfing School, where the old folks and teenagers all had fun learning to ride! Great spot.

488864039.name: Always a winner in our minds....just a great beach experience every time!
488864039.author: a TripAdvisor user
488864039.reviewBody:
We've been to Cabo 5 times over the last 8 years and Playa Los Cerritos is out "go to beach".  Although drive from Cabo san Lucas is a bit tedious we are so glad we did it each time we arrive.  With a 7 night stay last week we spent three days at Cerritos and it was great.

We "camp" out so to speak at the restaurant and the guys there are great.  Food is solid, and priced pretty typically for a tourist destination.

Love it...and can't wait to go back.

487172765.name: beautiful, clean beach
487172765.author: a TripAdvisor user
487172765.reviewBody: Have always loved this beach. Very few vendors and very clean. You can walk for miles with no one bugging you and there is an arae that is safe for swimming.\nLove this beach!

486413885.name: Beautiful, dirt road beach with great beginner surfing
486413885.author: a TripAdvisor user
486413885.reviewBody: I am sure that this beach has grown a bunch since being "discovered" but it is a beautiful long sandy beach with a sandy bottom that makes it easy for beginning surfers to catch (and fall off) a wave safely. The road down there is around mile marker 65 and comes up fast so beware. There is a bunch on surfer casitas there and some small hotels. The beach club had ok food and facilities. They have surfboard rentals on the beach and there were even some ladies setting up massage tables on the beach for a post surf rub down if you need it. We loved it and my daughter had such a great time prancing up and down the beach looking for shells.

486207140.name: Great Bearch, worth a visit if you are stuck in the hotel Californa
486207140.author: a TripAdvisor user
486207140.reviewBody: We actually paid to a few dollars to be in the surf colony which was well worth the addition money. The pool was great and when we were there, no one was around (mainly because it was hurricane season!!!). Still, it was nice to be able to get away from the crowd.

484209065.name: Peaceful beach with great surf away from the Cabo scene
484209065.author: a TripAdvisor user
484209065.reviewBody: If you are someone who does not love all of the development in Cabo, and are looking for a more authentic experience, I highly recommend Playa Los Cerritos.  But if you need a lot of amenities, probably not the right spot for you.  We spent 2 wonderful days here, escaping the Cabo spring break scene.  The first day we rented boogie boards and the next day took surf lessons - a great beach for first time surfers and for expert surfers, there are two layers of waves here.

483865734.name: One of the few swim beaches
483865734.author: a TripAdvisor user
483865734.reviewBody: This is the swim beach in Todos Santos. You\'ll also find vendors here and you can take surf lessons as well. The day we went it was a big surf. Nice location. Near the Cerritos Beach and Surf Club.

482225083.name: Sandy beach with surf lessons
482225083.author: a TripAdvisor user
482225083.reviewBody: Great for the kids to go out and take surf lessons or boogie board, while the parents sit on the beach with a book and a drink.

481568197.name: Abandoned development, dusty wasteland
481568197.author: a TripAdvisor user
481568197.reviewBody: A few hotels are trying to make a go of it here but don\'t be fooled. This is clearly an area of abandoned development. Driving in from the freeway, the natural desert/dune Flora has been cleared away leaving a desolate wide swath of dirt dotted with the odd hotel/condo. The whole area is depressing. There are much more beautiful swimming beaches and charming towns close by.

481273853.name: Secluded, enormous surfer beach.
481273853.author: a TripAdvisor user
481273853.reviewBody: If you can find it, this beach has a fun, laid back vibe. You can set up your umbrella and watch the surfers all day.  Although enormous, the best swimming area is fairly small. It has its share of beach vendors and massage tables, but they are polite and will leave you alone if you\'re not interested. You can rent surfing stuff and buy cold drinks at the surf shop. Some big caveats here, no public bathrooms, no cheap beach food, and a horrible dirt entry road off the highway.  Think of it as a simple local beach away from hordes of tourists where you can relax and swim for a few hours.

478942662.name: Surfing and beach massages
478942662.author: a TripAdvisor user
478942662.reviewBody: Not a lot of great signage to get to the beach from the highway and there is a somewhat rough dirt road to the beach.  Surf board rentals with wet suits are at the beach as well as a multitude of local masseuses.  You can play in the water but more of a surfing beach that a wading beach.

478259692.name: Surf, brews and tunes
478259692.author: a TripAdvisor user
478259692.reviewBody: Crowded beach with restaurant, drinks, entertainment, umbrellas, massage tables, people selling jewlery, bowls, blankets and fruit and renting boogie boards. Massive waves (20 feet?) for the surfer crowd. Walk beyond (not far!) all of this for uncrowded, soft white sand and stunning surf.

476937676.name: Discovered my love for buggy boardimg
476937676.author: a TripAdvisor user
476937676.reviewBody: One of the only few beaches on the pacific side to swim and get a good taste of the ocean. I had my first buggy board experience and am in love now. Definitely the way to kill a sunny afternoon in the best possible way. There are two places to get cool beverages. I recommend walking down the beach a bit to get away from the crowd and go to the little place close to the surf hotel to rent your equipment and get your beer. The prices are better and the atmosphere is chilled.

475416280.name: Was pretty crowded but nice spot to watch surfers
475416280.author: a TripAdvisor user
475416280.reviewBody: The day we came the beach was pretty crowded. We took a surf lesson with a guy that talked to us on the beach. He offered an hour for 50 dollars and told us we could use the board after the class as long as we wanted + he gave us an umbrella and chairs for the day. It was a really nice experience and we enjoyed our day trip here. Definitely visit the free souls restaurant. That place is awesome!!

474245697.name: Great Beach
474245697.author: a TripAdvisor user
474245697.reviewBody:
Made to the beach on several occasions on this last trip, although the water was on cooler side, lots of people were having a great time,

Sat by the beach club and enjoyed live music on both Saturday and Sunday, and you can't beat a massage with Gabby on the beach ( light green tent)

Had three of them this trip!

The beach was very clean!

473181213.name: Great place for surfing!
473181213.author: a TripAdvisor user
473181213.reviewBody: Did some surfing while my wife sunbathed. I think it\'s $5 or so to park. You can rent umbrellas, surf boards, wetsuits, etc., from various vendors on the beach. It was a great little beach to go too.

472991125.name: Recommended for swimming and surfing
472991125.author: a TripAdvisor user
472991125.reviewBody: This is one of the few popular swimming beaches along the 160 miles of shoreline between Cabo San Lucas and Magdalena Bay.  Cerritos is a semi-point beach break with a gently sloping, fine sand beach.  Easy entry to water without a pounding shorebreak on most days.  The currents are mild, except when the surf is overhead on the outer bar, then beware of the rip current along the rocky point at the north end of the beach.  Surfers use this rip current to swiftly pass through the breakers to their takeoff areas.  Not the best surfing in Baja for pros, but best for beginners to give the sport a try.  There is no real separation between the swimmers and surfers, so be aware of loose surfboards rolling in when the waves are high.  There are now several restaurants along the beach, a variety of accommodations nearby, surfboard rentals and lessons, and lifeguards occasionally on duty - Check.  Often crowded with beach vendors, and fun for people watching or meeting new friends.

472950756.name: Love this beach
472950756.author: a TripAdvisor user
472950756.reviewBody: I love Cerritos beach, you can safely swim, boogie board, & surf here. The reason I give it only 4 stars is because there are no trash cans or public bathrooms. Oh and the parking is limited.

472925334.name: Amazing sunshine sand & surf!
472925334.author: a TripAdvisor user
472925334.reviewBody: I really shouldn\'t review this because I don\'t want to spoil this place!  I LOVE this beach!  I mean, really, why go to the beach if you can\'t swim in the ocean?  Which is true of most of the rest of Cabo.  And, although the crowds hang to the North end, there are many more miles in which one can find their own, and avoid the vendors and crowds.

472902604.name: Massage on the Beach
472902604.author: a TripAdvisor user
472902604.reviewBody: With dozens of umbrellas and people soliciting you, I\'ve signed on to write my first review because the massage I received on the beach yesterday was just that good. If you need to work out some knots, go see Zulema, a petite woman always wearing a white polo with her name embroidered on it. I\'ve had my share of massages (spas, medical massages, etc.) but Zulema has some magical hands. This was the best I\'ve ever had. This service would have cost $150+ back home in NY, but it was only $20 for 45 minutes and she kept me on the table for over an hour so I tipped her another $20. She\'s strong and knows what she\'s doing. I\'d have packed her in my suitcase to bring home if I could!

472259675.name: Great Beach but can be Dangerous
472259675.author: a TripAdvisor user
472259675.reviewBody: My favourite beach in the Cabo area.  I go there several times each winter when I\'m cabo for 4 months.  But be careful!  I was there today, April 2, 2017, and had to be rescued by the lifeguards, to whom I am extremely grateful.  Waves were very big, in my experience, and I got out too far past the breakers and could not get back!  The lifeguards explained there was a significant rip tide that day and it pulled me out and I could not swim back.  I thought I would drown due to exhaustion.  So, be careful!  I\'m not going in when the waves are that big again and my eternal gratitude to the lifeguards who probably saved my life today.

471731800.name: Good beach for learning to surf and boogie boarding
471731800.author: a TripAdvisor user
471731800.reviewBody: This beach is a safe, swimmable beach.  It has several vendors renting boogie boards and surf boards as well as providing lessons.  You will need to pay for parking and for using their preinstalled umbrellas.  However, prices seem to be negotiable so make sure you make a deal.  You will also be approached by vendors selling jewelry and straw hats.  It was fairly crowded, but my son had a ball boogie boarding all day.

471478369.name: Mary Jane E
471478369.author: a TripAdvisor user
471478369.reviewBody: My Granddaughters love to buggie Board and this was the best spot around Todos Santos.  It is always crowded but still great surf with less undertow than other beaches.  You can get an umbrella and lounge chairs from the Beach Club Restaurant as long as you spend $20 per adult on food and drink.  Not hard to do as the food is expensive.  Fish taco, ceviche and hamburgers were all fine.

469958155.name: Wonderful Beach
469958155.author: a TripAdvisor user
469958155.reviewBody: This beach is so great that we bought a condo and moved here. Great for surfing, boogie boarding, swimming or watching an amazing sunset.

469843329.name: Excellent beach!
469843329.author: a TripAdvisor user
469843329.reviewBody: We found a lot of the beaches near Todos Santos were not swim-friendly but Cerritos Beach was great for swimming, surfing and boogie boarding...we came back here several times during our stay in Todos Santos. Beautiful beach with nice surroundings! And make sure to get a beach massage from Brenda and her mom...aaaaahhhhhhh!

469006961.name: Sundays at Cerritos
469006961.author: a TripAdvisor user
469006961.reviewBody: Great beach to hang out at on a Sunday. If you love to surf, this is the place to be. But even if you just want to hang out at the beach, have a few drinks and relax, can\'t do much better than this in the Todos Santos area.

468137340.name: Great beach but beware of theives
468137340.author: a TripAdvisor user
468137340.reviewBody: Surf is great and so is the swimming but one day we couldn\'t leave our stuff because two guys were scoping it out.

467942485.name: Great waves and tidal pools
467942485.author: a TripAdvisor user
467942485.reviewBody: Waves were perfect for learning how to surf and for body surfing.  Massages on the beach were highly rated by some friends.  Beautiful breeze every day.

467386901.name: Good Beach for Surf Lessons
467386901.author: a TripAdvisor user
467386901.reviewBody: Somewhat remote beac,h but with most of the amenities (restaurant, bathrooms, etc.) of a larger more populated beach closer to Cabo proper. Great area to learn to surf, and plenty of lessons/instructors available. Too many beach merchants constantly approaching to try and sell you the same old tourist souvenirs, but to be expected in any area with a tourist population.

466843511.name: Great Little Surf Beach
466843511.author: a TripAdvisor user
466843511.reviewBody:
My husband and I went with three other couples for a week to Serrito's. We stayed in a condo close by. It was a five minute walk to the beach. We enjoyed walking on the beach in the morning, sitting around enjoying lunch on the beach in the afternoon, and even a few evening stroll's.

The guys got up really early and went surfing. There is a really nice surf culture that hangs out at this beach. We met many travelling surfers. Everyone was very nice and not territorial on the water.

There's an amazing structure, I'm not sure if it is a hotel now, we heard many stories and rumours about it. It's yellow and it sits on the top of the hill. Has a great view. There are many rumours that we heard, that the owner stole the land from a local, that they went bankrupt and couldn't pay their workers, but it was supposed to be a personal residence and now it's a hotel, we never got the truth but we did learn the hard way that they do not welcome visitors that want to check out the view so don't bother!

Cerrito's beach has a few little surf camps right on the ocean that you can stay in. And there are many vendors that walk up and down and ask you if you'd like to buy something. There are also a few guys set up renting surfboards and such. Beyond that, it is still not very populated at this beach.

466617210.name: The St Pete Beach of Baja
466617210.author: a TripAdvisor user
466617210.reviewBody: There are certainly quieter beaches in this area (Playa las Palmas), and beaches with more upscale service (El Faro), but we deeply enjoyed Cerritos: ample (free) parking, clean bathrooms, a large menu and an attentive staff who kept us hydrated and well-fed for many hours of sunning, people-watching and body surfing. It\'s true, the vendors are omnipresent and somewhat pushy if you express anything but "Nada, gracias", but also respectful and fun. We enjoyed talking with them in our terrible Espa\u00f1ol.

465700389.name: Lots of Vendors
465700389.author: a TripAdvisor user
465700389.reviewBody: Great swimming beach, but you will be approached by LOTS of vendors trying to sell you anything from blankets to temporary tattoos.

464916226.name: Fun beach
464916226.author: a TripAdvisor user
464916226.reviewBody: Little beachside bar was fun and affordable. Small fee to enter beach applies to bar. Beautiful beach and smallish kid friendly waves for boogie boarding!

464172696.name: Great beach good surfing
464172696.author: a TripAdvisor user
464172696.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, surfing was for experience surfers overall. The Mario school of surf was very good and look like everyone was having a great time. I\'d highly recommend working with Mario for surf school.

464020336.name: Surfing!
464020336.author: a TripAdvisor user
464020336.reviewBody: If you are into surfing or want to learn to surf, this is your beach! You can rent a board for $20USD a day. Wet suit was thrown in. You can also get yourself chairs & an umbrella. The beach has a sand bottom which is great for surfing. Lots of families just hanging out and enjoying the sun & surf. Wear sunscreen! The sun is intense!!!

463884624.name: Nice beach but there\'re way better options not far away from here.
463884624.author: a TripAdvisor user
463884624.reviewBody: Been here many times and it is as good as they say but not my cup of tea. It\'s usually crowded and has great waves for surfing but if you\'re not surf you might be able to find more beautiful beaches somewhere else.
