It\'s no big deal when compared to other beaches around, really. Cerritos usually gets featured in lots of media articles and such but I think it\'s because of it popularity, not so much for being mesmerizing.\n\nGood thing about cerritos is, you won\'t struggle to find basic services such as bathroom and restaurant or even accommodation if you\'re looking for a roof. Granted, you\'ll be able to take the best surf lessons around if that\'s what you\'re after.

463741045.name: Always fun!
463741045.author: a TripAdvisor user
463741045.reviewBody: Great walking beach, surfing beach, people watching beach, $35 for hour massage beach!!!  Restaurant is expensive. Bring a cooler!

463346549.name: Great beach, you can "swim" and have a drink
463346549.author: a TripAdvisor user
463346549.reviewBody: Great beach that you can wade into though as usual further out and you risk the undertow.  This is a throwback beach that is off the beaten path, full of wonderful different folks of all types.  Kids can play in the sand while adults have a beer on the beach at one of the bars.  Great sunset!   The road to and from is new.  If driving back to Cabo the road is excellent however there are no highway/street lights.

462100296.name: Surf beach
462100296.author: a TripAdvisor user
462100296.reviewBody:
Nice surf beach with bar located on beach. 

Only issue was the sales people consistently trying to sell you things. Not a big deal but there are other less populated beaches that we enjoyed more. 

Surf was consistent in the morning and later in the afternoon. Probably about 20-25 guys in the water everyday during our stay. 

Many accommodations close by for easy walk to beach.

461860628.name: Lovely little beach!
461860628.author: a TripAdvisor user
461860628.reviewBody: A really nice, small beach with good waves for surfing.  There are some sellers that you have to brush off, but otherwise this is great.

461730041.name: Beautiful, wild beach.
461730041.author: a TripAdvisor user
461730041.reviewBody: Long, beautiful beach with the Pacific breakers rolling in. Surf equipment for hire. Behind the beach, the view is pretty grim, but the sea more than makes up for it.

460795121.name: Gorgeous beach
460795121.author: a TripAdvisor user
460795121.reviewBody: Spectacular swimmable beach. Used to be much nicer before development started. Sand like talcum powder. Water wonderful. Often see whales right off shore. Bring food and drinks. Surfing lessons available too.

460536964.name: Great swimmable beach but watch your valubles!
460536964.author: a TripAdvisor user
460536964.reviewBody: There are thieves watching swimmers who leave there things on the beach. And the current can be very stong in aress but overall we liked it and had fun. Its ten minutes outside of Todos Santos

460425330.name: beautiful beach for a walk or a dip in the water
460425330.author: a TripAdvisor user
460425330.reviewBody: Leaving Todos Santos the beach, local hotels and restaurant are just 20 minutes away.  Parking at several areas and short walk to the beach.  Nice long flat beach to walk, and you can walk fairly far out in shallow water to swim before you get to the bigger surf.  Some surfing and body surfing.

460400666.name: Unfriendly guard
460400666.author: a TripAdvisor user
460400666.reviewBody: When we arrived at the beach there was a sign said that the only access was through the cerritos beach surf  club.  At the gate there was a guard who said it was private and there was no access.  He was very clear.  We finally asked if we could go to the bar and he let us through.  We had a drink at the bar and it was fine.  However it was an unpleasant encounter.  In Mexico the beaches are public above the high water mark.  It is distressing that a private individual can block access.

458916559.name: nice beach but many salesman
458916559.author: a TripAdvisor user
458916559.reviewBody: We stopped at this beach on our way from cabo to todos santos as was suggested to us (for the $20 massages) but have to say we did not stay long. The beach was very busy but mainly with locals selling their wares and politely saying no thank you every few minutes was a pain. There are other beautiful beaches without the salesman where you can swim and relax and enjoy the Baja life

458181905.name: Swim beach a short drive from Todos Santos
458181905.author: a TripAdvisor user
458181905.reviewBody: You have to enter at Cerritos Beach and Surf Club. Parking is $5 which you get refunded with purchase of food or drink. Lots of English speakers. There was a band playing when we were there on a Sunday. Also, there is horse rental. Nice spot

455789601.name: Las Olas (the waves)
455789601.author: a TripAdvisor user
455789601.reviewBody: We stopped on our way to Todos Santos. It was fun watching the surfers. Todos Santos was such a cool little town, if you are staying in cabo it is so worth the trip. Quaint little town with nice shops and plenty of places to eat.

455043574.name: Giant Waves
455043574.author: a TripAdvisor user
455043574.reviewBody: We stopped here on a drive from Todos Santos.  The beach stretches for miles, but access seemed somewhat limited to the north end where the beach club is.  Lots of surfers out in the cove and we saw a number of whales spouting just offshore. Bring binoculars!   Big, pounding beach break on day were there so no swimming or playing n the waves for us.

453583604.name: One of the only beaches near Todos Santos that is okay for swimming.
453583604.author: a TripAdvisor user
453583604.reviewBody: It can get crowded here, but there is a pretty mellow vibe. Lots of hawkers, but they\'re not that aggressive. It\'s frequented by surfers and our grandchildren had a great time on their boogie boards. It\'s a very pretty spot.

453404200.name: Surf swim
453404200.author: a TripAdvisor user
453404200.reviewBody: Safe public beach. Surf or swim. Water cool in January.  Somewhat crowded on weekends in warmer weather.

452198732.name: We come every Winter
452198732.author: a TripAdvisor user
452198732.reviewBody: And do nothing, but relax, walk their beautiful beaches, watch the baby Tortuga release at Sunset, read booksss, ride horseback on the beach, fix BBQ dinners, sleep late, hear really good music in the cantinas and have an occasional meal out. \n\nThere\'s a new toll road from the SJD Aeropuerto, which bypasses Cabo, so TS is easy to get to in approx. 1 hour (it used to take 2 hours through Cabo. La Paz is 1 hour North on a fairly new road.

451057737.name: Typical tourist beach
451057737.author: a TripAdvisor user
451057737.reviewBody: Visited to see surfing.  We were disappointed by the dirty beach.  It really is more of a typical tourist hangout with locals walking the beach selling their wares.  Not our scene. Not very relaxing.

449750171.name: Sunday at cerritos
449750171.author: a TripAdvisor user
449750171.reviewBody: A singer with sense of humor compose Sunday at Cerritos, such a sticky tune...good place and terrific waves to surf....

449261954.name: Beautiful Beach for Surf Lessons
449261954.author: a TripAdvisor user
449261954.reviewBody: We took surf lessons here. The beach is beautiful and well worth the stop with or without the lesson.  Rocky outcrop on one end is great for pictures and viewing tide pool animals while the waves crash on them.

449059363.name: Romantic!!! Paradise for surfers!
449059363.author: a TripAdvisor user
449059363.reviewBody: One of the best spots for watching increadible Pacific sunsets! Paradise for surfing lovers, beach camping, beach running, swimming because of available entrance into the water! Here you can rent surfboard, have a snack or have lunch in the restaurant right on the beach! Big free parking! Great views!

445711199.name: Even on a cloudy day
445711199.author: a TripAdvisor user
445711199.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend the afternoon with good friends. A wonderful, mixed scene of surfers, families, and other ner-do-wells. We\'ve been to Tulum many times, and we look forward to exploring this area. Ask for Rodrigo as Asa server at the Beach Club.

445114174.name: Perfect!
445114174.author: a TripAdvisor user
445114174.reviewBody: This is a great beach for families, couples, anyone. Before driving straight to the beach, avoid pay parking and take a left to park with locals alongside the dirt road. Rented a surfboard and umbrella for $20 US. Beautiful beach for swimming, walking, reading. Not too crowded.

443523477.name: Lovely and Not Crowded
443523477.author: a TripAdvisor user
443523477.reviewBody: So fortunate to be staying a week on this beach. It\'s so lovely and shallow to walk when the tides out and the water warm enough to enjoy in December. Love watching the fisherman cast their nets or head out in the morning and return at night. Enjoy seeing the flying fish and whales off shore.

443510273.name: Great beach.
443510273.author: a TripAdvisor user
443510273.reviewBody: We had a great time here surfing and soaking up the sun. It\'s somewhat undeveloped right now but it\'s on track to be the next cabo before long.

442213498.name: Beautiful beach
442213498.author: a TripAdvisor user
442213498.reviewBody: Just a short drive from Todos Santos gets you to a wonderful beach with forever views, and when we were there, no one else.  It was gorgeous and the waves were really breaking hard, not for novices.

442177883.name: Great beach but super expensive!
442177883.author: a TripAdvisor user
442177883.reviewBody:
I am not sure why this is rated so high! 
Here my take on this place. It cost 100 peso's to park your car at a open beach. I bet they don't charge the Mexicans. You do get the 100 peso's back if you buy a drink at the bar. Here is my second beef.... The prices here were the highest we paid in Mexico! $17.50 for 4 beers.
If you love nature then go here for sure! It is beautiful, big surf, long long beach, dirt roads to beach. Cool place for sure!
Just felt that the local's seem to be taking full advantage of you in the middle of no where. 
Been there, done that, probably not going back!

441999301.name: beautiful beach,,,
441999301.author: a TripAdvisor user
441999301.reviewBody: and a surf lesson!!!! gorgeous beach,, great surf lesson,, super helpful instructors,, and a great way to end a day!!

441209579.name: Plain Jane
441209579.author: a TripAdvisor user
441209579.reviewBody:
No frills beach but it's one of the only places you can actually get into the water in the Los Cabos area. It's about 45 mins away from cabo and kinda hard to find, but keep our eyes peeled 

the beach club/restaurant will give you a table, chairs, and umbrella if you don't bring your own cooler. If you have your own food and drink, you can sit anywhere you want. 

Rent surfing and boogie board equipment on the beach, take lessons from locals who live there. 

It's HOT on the beach out there, so if you are bringing your own stuff, think about an umbrella. You can by food and drinks from the club.

441115720.name: Great Surf Beach
441115720.author: a TripAdvisor user
441115720.reviewBody: No longer a secret - this is a great surf destination with an old-school feel - a piece of history with great views.

440659838.name: Perfect beach to spend the day
440659838.author: a TripAdvisor user
440659838.reviewBody: you can park for free at the north end, or drive in and pay $5, but you can get that in a credit at the bar/restaurant. You don\'t need to bring anything; everything from towels, to chairs, to surfboards are available to rent. You can take surf lessons or get a massage on the beach. Nice place. be careful of the rip currents, though. Lifeguards are not always on duty, rip is strong. better swimming directly in front of the restaurant.

438182580.name: Best Beach in the Baja !
438182580.author: a TripAdvisor user
438182580.reviewBody: Sandy bottom, clear warm waters. Excellent for surfing (Beginners and advance), good body boarding waves. Excellent for both couples and families.  Close to Todos Santos, nice town with great restaurants!

438052564.name: Best beach in Cabo
438052564.author: a TripAdvisor user
438052564.reviewBody: Great surfing, big flat sandy crescent beach, free beach chairs with umbrellas (if you are buying cervezas), great sunsets, less crowded than locations closer to Cabo, cheap massages on beach, horse back rides, fewer (but not none) beach vendors, and a low cool breeze. Only downsides are that it is a one hour drive from Cabo and the parking sucks. We parked on the side of a sandy/dusty entrance road. It was free, but limited space. Drink and food prices were at tourist rates, but cheaper than Cabo. We rented four surfboards for $40 (all day) and massages were $30 for 30 minutes. Despite being a beginning surfer (third time), it was obvious where the beginner area was and the better surfers were accommodating.

437554693.name: GOOD AND BAD; Playa Los Cerritos and Cerritos Beach and Surf Club
437554693.author: a TripAdvisor user
437554693.reviewBody: Playa Los Cerritos is a nice beach at the north end of Cerritos Bay, south of Todos Santos.  The focal point tends to be the Cerritos Beach and Surf Club, but it is NOT the only way to get to the beach. The good, took my daughter and granddaughter so they could swim in the Pacific, we are from Seattle.  They had fun in the small waves.  Lots of surf boarders to avoid but fun.  The bad, Cerritos Beach and Surf Club charge for parking but you can get a refund if you spend $10 on drinks or food at the Beach Club.  Drinks are Seattle prices and the food has been ok in the past but expensive.  If you want to swim in the Pacific, Playa Los Cerritos is the only safe place.  As someone else suggested, you have an option to go to the Playa Cerritos - Pubic Beach just south of the Beach Club, parking is free and you can just walk about the same distance to the beach.  But not well mark or easy to find. Look at Google Maps. There is a small hotel just south of the public beach that has a nice pool and good food, although pricey.  If you want to safely swim in the Pacific whey in the Baja, Playa Cerritos can be a fun day.

436241669.name: Peace and quiet
436241669.author: a TripAdvisor user
436241669.reviewBody: Great crystal clear water.  No crowds.  The sea breezes feel so healthy, too.  Nature here is unspoilt.

435839676.name: "Fun beach"
435839676.author: a TripAdvisor user
435839676.reviewBody: Playa Los Cerritos is a fun beach with lots of activities. You can relax under an umbrella and order food and drinks from the restaurant located on the beach or ride horses/surf. There is something at this beach for everyone to enjoy.

433397175.name: a nice beach-scenic
433397175.author: a TripAdvisor user
433397175.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way back from Todos Santos.  We had a small group of people with us.  On one end there are a couple of hotels and some palapas.  People were swimming in the beach at the end of it.  There were a couple of people walking down the road with their surfboards.  There is also some construction on the beach which tells me that more development will be taking place.  Nice place to stop and walk the beach for a while

432728358.name: Scored epic waves
432728358.author: a TripAdvisor user
432728358.reviewBody: Cerritos has the best surf on the Pacific side is southern Baja, connected by a new toll road to the airport. It\'s about an hour and fifteen minute drive. Rent a board right on the beach for $15. The restaurant there has plenty to choose from but is expensive. Many people drive up from Cabo every day to hang out there. It\'s just over an hour drive to Cabo and La Pax is an hour drive up north. City of Todos Santos is a 15 minute drive north, and they have great restaurants and art galleries. Also the Villa Santa Cruz is a beautiful B&B a little north in front of the awesome winter surf break of La Pastura.\nYou can park at Cerritos for free if you buy more than $5 of food/ drinks at the restaurant.

423020051.name: Beautiful inviting beach, great service from food to surf
423020051.author: a TripAdvisor user
423020051.reviewBody: Please be advised not to free swim on the right side of beach near rocks. Extreme rip current. Oscar(surf instructor)saved my life today as a friend(she rented a boogie board) and I were swimming all of a sudden drifted down near to rocks. We found ourselves struggling to swim back to shore. Oscar and his friend spotted us after I yelled for help and ran out on their surf boards and brought us back to shore. We had guardian angels today. Thank you Oscar!\ud83d\ude18

421911636.name: So beautiful
421911636.author: a TripAdvisor user
421911636.reviewBody: This was a great beach! Had lunch and enjoyed the beach for the day and it was wonderful! Little tricky to find

417719591.name: A must see spot while in Todos Santos
417719591.author: a TripAdvisor user
417719591.reviewBody: I can easily see why this is rated the #1 attraction in Todos Santos.  Our hotel owner suggested it and we were very glad he did.  One of the few swimmable beaches in the area and full of activity the day we were there.  Families, couples, surfers, they were all there and having a great time. Nice little restaurant with big shade umbrellas made for a pleasant break from the heat.  The whole place had a nice local feel to it but we were told that big developments are slated for the future.

412038008.name: Beautiful Beach on the Pacific
412038008.author: a TripAdvisor user
412038008.reviewBody: Spent to days here while in Cabo. Took surf lessons one day. Ate at the little bar restaurant there, (they only take cash). Loved this beach, fun to play in the waves. Be careful and do not swim to far out along the rocks. There is a strong current there and before you know it you are almost as sea. The surfers use it to enter the water fast. They are always on the look out for swimmers who go out to far. We took surf lessons, very friendly and helpful locals who teach. We both were able to stand when we were done, but we were oh so tired! My best days were spent here.

411842464.name: We always stop in for a beach break
411842464.author: a TripAdvisor user
411842464.reviewBody: After a lunch up the road in Todos Santos we always make it down to this popular spot on a great left break surfing beach. Food is hot and beer is cold. Live entertainment is worth a hang out!

408929970.name: Surfing lessons, first time surfer
408929970.author: a TripAdvisor user
408929970.reviewBody: Great place for learning to surf in the summer.  Nice waves not to crowded and everyone was relaxed.  There is a place to park for free at the very end of the drive in...apparently the new Beach Club owners are not well liked by the locals...I was there with a local from the hotel I was staying in Todos Santos.

408074925.name: The place to surf in this area
408074925.author: a TripAdvisor user
408074925.reviewBody: Huge waves were crashing in when I was there and many surfers were taking advantage of them.  The beach itself was not that beautiful, but the views of the Pacific made up for the beach.

406577724.name: Good experience
406577724.author: a TripAdvisor user
406577724.reviewBody: Very peaceful, you can be there for fun, family, friends or couple. \nYou can surf or swim or just relax, great view of the Mexican beach.

406314301.name: Relaxing
406314301.author: a TripAdvisor user
406314301.reviewBody: We stopped on our way back from Todos Santos to Cabo and loved Cerritos Beach. There a couple of hotels we would like to find out about and maybe stay there in the future. The surfers looked like they were having a great time.

405358509.name: Great beach for boogie boards and body surfing
405358509.author: a TripAdvisor user
405358509.reviewBody: This is a very famous beach that was perfect for the kind of water play my family enjoys. There\'s not many beaches along this strip of the coast that are safe for swimming so this is a popular place. We went 4 times in the two weeks we were in Todos Santos. What I appreciated was that the beach has waves in two set of swells and the surfers stay out deeper than the body surfers, so no territorial issues for catching waves. \n\nSeveral caveats: First, you do pay $5 to park, but you get this back if you eat in the restaurant. Be sure to get the receipt when you pay and bring it with you to the restaurant. Second, you\'re going to want to at least get drinks at the restaurant so you can use the (only) restrooms. Finally, you are going to have to experience the constant stream of guys wanting to sell you stuff. If you show even the slightest interest or buy one thing from one, they will be insistent. Never pay more than less than half the first offered price. They are not as aggressive or frequent as the beach in Cabo, but they will come by. There\'s also people offering massages and surf stuff rentals.

404659880.name: Amazing Beach
404659880.author: a TripAdvisor user
404659880.reviewBody: The beach was absolutely awesome. The waves were just right to swim or to surf or body board. My wife had so much fun body boarding. Our chihuahua got to experience the sand and ocean for the first time and he had the time of his life. It was so great. Our hotel was right outside the beach. Two minute walk and the hotel overlooked it. It was spectacular. Will be back soon. People were of course selling things, just tell them no thanks and move on. You\'re not obligated to buy anything. If you want, go to the beach club and rent an umbrella or bring one with you.

399250181.name: Fun surf
399250181.author: a TripAdvisor user
399250181.reviewBody: Nice family friendly beach. Sand bottom. Good for bogey boarding and average but fun surf. Expensive and every time we went we were charged for something different like parking.

397461727.name: Gorgeous, gorgeous beach!
397461727.author: a TripAdvisor user
397461727.reviewBody: When I first camped on Cerritos Beach back in 2004 there was nothing there. Nada. Now there are boutique hotels, restaurants and bars, surf schools and even a timeshare. But the beach still goes on forever. By US standards it is uncrossed. The surfing is great, boogie boarding awesome and your can swim in it. The pale blue water is still so clear you can see fish swimming atop the waves as they break. And it\'s warm, even during the winter months. I love this beach. \n\nIf you park at the Cerritos Beach Club, you won\'t be charged if you buy a drink or some food at the restaurant. It\'s on the sand and you can even bring your dogs!

393683337.name: If you want to swim, go here, if not, keep going to Todos Santos.
393683337.author: a TripAdvisor user
393683337.reviewBody: We love Cerritos but ever since they have implemented all of these american rules you would expect at a beach club, it\'s not a place you go to relax. So many people flock there to let their kids in teh water for the first time, but if you want a private hangout, you just keep going til you get to Punta Lobas and just find a beach and chill. Cerritos is all about hawkers, money grubbing Timeshare salesman nad overpriced cocktails. If you want surf lessons, go to Rudy, he will help you out. But Cerritos is good if you don\'t mind people, rules and overpriced apps and cocktails. Tourists love it

387637291.name: Nice
387637291.author: a TripAdvisor user
387637291.reviewBody: It\'s a great looking beach , nice blue waters, you can get some service like massage maybe drinks , but their is no shade at all , that\'s I\'m with 3 stars bring your unbralla it\'s a must , we didn\'t stay long , we did pick up our staff and left the ocean was too rough and went to santa maria beach maybe 25 miles from here . Cerritos it\'s nice oh almost forgot the parking suck.

386817411.name: Great plan
386817411.author: a TripAdvisor user
386817411.reviewBody: Massages, ceviche, beers, boogie boards, surf classes... Incredible place! A bit over priced specially considering it\'s the only place around ... That\'s a bit abusive but there\'s no better plan for the day.

386785858.name: Food service sucks
386785858.author: a TripAdvisor user
386785858.reviewBody: Terrible service and mediocre food. Waited 45 min just to get a waiter to take a drink order. While the bar wasn\'t even busy. Will never go back. Way over rated

384594296.name: One of the Best Family Friendly Beaches in Baja
384594296.author: a TripAdvisor user
384594296.reviewBody: If you are looking for a secluded pristine beach, this is NOT your spot. Because Baja\'s Pacific beaches are notorious for undertow, riptides and shore breakers, there aren\'t a lot of family friendly beaches. The secret is definitely out on this one. Several surf instructors have tents set up and accommodate all ages of surfers. At the Cerritos Beach Club, you can get food and drinks brought right to your towel or eat in their restaurant. And there is every manner of beach house, bungalow, palapa, surf hut set up in the neighborhood behind. To get there, take Highway 19 and exit at mile marker 66, then work your way down the bumpy, dusty dirt road to the beach. Annoyance factor: once you hit the beach, there is a guy at a gate that wants five bucks to let you in to park.

383414034.name: Swimable Beach
383414034.author: a TripAdvisor user
383414034.reviewBody: If you are looking for a beach to actually swim in you need to go to Cerritos . You will see surfers there also . Great beach bar there too

372832401.name: Buy a drink or two at the beach and you can park for free
372832401.author: a TripAdvisor user
372832401.reviewBody:
This is a stunning stretch of beach where you can sit on loungers at the beach if you buy a few drinks or eat something. They give you a ticket for parking on the way in- just show your food receipt on the way out. 

The beach can get busy. If the vendors are slow they can continually approach you but if you are polite they will move on. 

The beach massages are cheap and very good. The surf instructors are absolutely brilliant and love their trade. For $60 US you can get all the equipment including wetsuit and boards AND an hour's instruction. They guarantee. You will get up or you don't pay. 

There's often an ambulance on location. The toilets are kept clean and Julio ensures the Beach goers are kept well hydrated and fed. Great spot.

371938690.name: go surfing! mind the current
371938690.author: a TripAdvisor user
371938690.reviewBody: cool cool... mind the current... but is a great back for pros and beginners. Thanks god their is no "local crowd", and is totally the oposite... people tells you the hot, dangerous, and sweets spots..

371425181.name: Nice stretch of beach
371425181.author: a TripAdvisor user
371425181.reviewBody: Nice place to spend some time, relaxing, listening to the surf and people watching.  The north side of the beach (to your right when facing the ocean) was much more crowded, but if you walk to the right you can have stretches of beach all to yourself.  \nThere were several surfers and you can rent boards, ATV\'s, umbrellas and chairs on the beach.  The sand is firm so you can easily walk a long way down this beach

368839023.name: Shells in the surf
368839023.author: a TripAdvisor user
368839023.reviewBody: Cost $100 pesos to park,they wanted $8 to sit under an umbrella.  The grandkids enjoyed looking for shells and rocks at the breaking wash line.  Snuck into the banos.

368256910.name: a little crowded but killer surf breaks
368256910.author: a TripAdvisor user
368256910.reviewBody: this resort is pretty cool. cheap massages on the beach, vendors that arent overly pushy, and best of all killer surf breaks! however the beers are pretty pricey so byob.

367641709.name: Nice day at the beach
367641709.author: a TripAdvisor user
367641709.reviewBody: Well a lot has changed here over the years, my 1st trip here was 13 years ago to camp at the trailer park. Now here are hotels, condos and beach clubs. It is still nice though to pack the cooler, load up the boards and just sit at the beach (trying to stay away) from the rest of that. Good swell that day, good lunch in the cooler and did not get a sun burn.

365376249.name: A glorious stretch of sand and surf.
365376249.author: a TripAdvisor user
365376249.reviewBody: We recently stayed at the Hacienda Cerritos for 2 weeks, and enjoyed our daily walks down the beach. The water is clean and blue, and the sand is compact and easy to stroll on.

365149470.name: Heat beach!
365149470.author: a TripAdvisor user
365149470.reviewBody: It\'s a very friendly beach for everybody from surfers to kids and dogs! There is a very relaxed atmosphere and if you are lucky you can even see some whales at the distance

362416748.name: Good surfing beach with all ammenities
362416748.author: a TripAdvisor user
362416748.reviewBody: Drove from San Jose to Cerritos looking for better waves for our teenager.  My husband and I spent time on the beach talking to locals:  the massage ladies, the hat seller, the fruit popsicle seller, the jewelry seller and the young men that transport surfboards daily to this beach from nearby El Pescador.  Great people from various places in Mexico and interesting life stories to tell.\nBeach is great for people of all ages.  Mostly foreigners were found there when we visited.

359553246.name: Best beach!
359553246.author: a TripAdvisor user
359553246.reviewBody: We came here after our trip to Los Todos and this beach was amazing. Everyone was so kind and the water was perfect for a nice swim! This beach was the perfect place to go outside of Cabo.

359196853.name: Nice beach
359196853.author: a TripAdvisor user
359196853.reviewBody: If you dont want to pay excesive prices in the restaurant, just parking at side. And go with your own unbrella, food and drinks.\nYou can go to take beautiful photos at the rocks by the right side. (Take care with the big waves) Or in the left side of that beach for a beautiful sunset.\nThere are little waves in the beach, perfect for kids.

359038451.name: Best Beach near Todos Santos !
359038451.author: a TripAdvisor user
359038451.reviewBody: Excellent spot !  Beach has soft sand, clear water and the waves are perfect for all levels of surfers and boogie boarders.  Great beach for chillin and enjoying the views of the Hacienda hotel on the rocks! Highly recommend this beach for anyone looking for something to do outside of Cabo.

359008094.name: Absolutely fun playa
359008094.author: a TripAdvisor user
359008094.reviewBody: Very picture perfect, NOT good for swimming as waves are huge and the current is STRONG. However, we loved watching the fishing boats power in over the waves, and our daughter walked and found lots of shells. It was quite pleasant.

358582938.name: Cerritos Beach Club
358582938.author: a TripAdvisor user
358582938.reviewBody: Spent a week in nearby Todos Santos and went to the beach club based on a recommendation.  The surf is good for body boarding, but avoid the beach club if possible.  Unnecessary amenities, rude staff and incredibly overpriced food.  They are the only facility in the area and act like it, but you don\'t need them.  Park for free on the dirt road just south of the club and walk to the beach.  Bring an umbrella and a cooler filled with drinks and food and enjoy your day.

357640016.name: Sunday with Dahline and Diego
357640016.author: a TripAdvisor user
357640016.reviewBody: Best part of this beach us the outdoor restaurant with live music from 2-5 on Sunday. Dahline and Diego are talented and will have you singing and dancing at some point\n,this beach allows dogs which was good for me but the swimming is iffy since it us primarily a surf beach and the riptide us strong! My friends were rescued by a surfer as they could not get back to shore.

357171256.name: Surf\'s up
357171256.author: a TripAdvisor user
357171256.reviewBody: This is a great spot to surf and paddleboard. Both the Locals and tourists are enamoured with beach.

355131573.name: Two weeks with no plans!
355131573.author: a TripAdvisor user
355131573.reviewBody: Spent 2 weeks at the Hotel Desert Moon on Cerritos and loved every minute. Long morning walks, beautiful sunsets, great people watching and many memorable moments. If you spend time in Cabo, this beach is a great break, even for just a day! Or check out the new Tortuga Villas or Cerritos Beach Inn, both are new and away from the crowds. Cerritos is a good mix of old Baja and fun beach time!

355012785.name: Great place to get away!
355012785.author: a TripAdvisor user
355012785.reviewBody: This IS NOT the party place of Cabo.  If you are looking to party stay in Cabo.  This is a family/quiet place.  Everything shuts down at about 9/10 pm.  Best value on Groupon!  Lots of kids. Romantic strolls on the beach...

354784802.name: great beach
354784802.author: a TripAdvisor user
354784802.reviewBody: So much fun for the kids to boogie board at and the adults to surf. You have to pay for parking if you park in front of the restaraunt (which is crazily overpriced) but if you take your last left before going into the pay lot you can drive right up to the beach and park for free very easily.

353089952.name: Strong rips don\'t swim
353089952.author: a TripAdvisor user
353089952.reviewBody: This is a rad beach that is actually very good for surfing (having the floatation is essential). There were beautiful breaks and plenty of surfers... On the right side of the beach!!!! DO NOT FREE SWIM. Avoid getting in the water near the beach entrance at all. I swam, accompanying my brother surfing, we took turns and were going to trade off swimming, and riding. He went first... and I nearly lost my life. The current is so powerful and unseen. After a few minutes enjoying the waves and loving that ocean power I realized I was getting farther and farther away from my brother, and I could no longer swim my way to touching the bottom with my feet. I slowly and surely was carried into a very dangerous situation. I was expending my energy trying to get free and it wasn\'t working. After some serious stress I called out for my brother surfing. After a few calls he noticed me but I was so far away, I signaled for help but he couldn\'t tell what I wanted. That\'s about when the water started pounding me and I was getting thrashed in the breaks. I was swallowing a lot of water and had a serious moment inside where I realized death was highly likely. Very scary. I managed to scream HELP! One time and by then a man on the beach noticed me. A local surfer and him paddled out and literally saved my life. I\'m a very good swimmer 26 and a avid snowboarder and skateboarder and thought I can do anything. This was a very close call and I\'m lucky to be alive.

351993623.name: Amazing surf beach
351993623.author: a TripAdvisor user
351993623.reviewBody: Had a wonderful few hours here. If u are roadtripping here for the day I recommend that u bring all that u need. Snacks, lunch, water, beers and an umbrella! A great beach, a local favourite, surfers enjoying the big rollers! My other half and friends swam, but unless u are a confident strong swimmer I do not advise swimming here!

351398828.name: Good surfing beach
351398828.author: a TripAdvisor user
351398828.reviewBody: Lots of tourists with kiddos but great flat beach with good waves. Cerritos is south of town so easy access from Cabo.

351339151.name: Awesome
351339151.author: a TripAdvisor user
351339151.reviewBody: You can get chairs and umbrella for $10.  Massage for $30.  So fun watching the surfers.  They were on 10 foot waves yesterday.  Byo because the restaurant/ bar is quite expensive

350815887.name: Great Surfer\'s Beach!
350815887.author: a TripAdvisor user
350815887.reviewBody: Spent the day at this beach watching the suffers and drinking margaritas :) There is only one restaurant and it is overpriced, but good. It\'s is the only place that has a bathroom (requires a pass for customers only) so well worth it. Great beach to people watch, play games, read books, relax. Had a 45 minute massage at the beach for $20 plus tip. Mercedes was our masseuse and she was fantastic. Can\'t swim here but great for surfers. There were 12-15ft  waves while we were there. Don\'t miss this place.

350355090.name: Cerritos beach -- great place to hang for the day
350355090.author: a TripAdvisor user
350355090.reviewBody: This is the only beach in the area that I know of that has a surf that won\'t hurt you.  It has a gently sloping beach and a sand bar farther out where the big waves break making the near surf very nice.  Not to mention that they have a full service restaurant with servers that bring cold beverages and food all day.  (to us lounging beach potatoes).  And the massages -- very nice and reasonable price.  I love the Baja!  For a Coloradan, the Baja is such a good deal -- short low priced airfare and lodging is also reasonable.  We stayed in a great AirBNB villa with a pool for cheap.

349005059.name: Certainly Cerritos!
349005059.author: a TripAdvisor user
349005059.reviewBody: This is one of the cool hidden gems between Cabo and Todos Santos .. at ~61 Kilometer marker. From surfing to beach massages, to horseback rides, Playa Los Cerritos is a great departure from Cabo. Go for the beach. Go for beers. Go to chill!

348325951.name: great surfing and safe swimming
348325951.author: a TripAdvisor user
348325951.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for stolling, only place we felt safe swimming, a few food and beverage spots.  Lots of people having massage on the beach at reaonable rates (we did not). Beautiful hotel on the hill where you could have a drink by the pool and watch ther surfers and sunset.

348176473.name: Good if you\'re a surfer
348176473.author: a TripAdvisor user
348176473.reviewBody: Had some Agua chile and guacamole at the beach restaurant. Not really a place to hang out unless you\'re in the surf scene as there\'s not a lot of ambience and there are so many other beautiful beach options.

348123121.name: Great fun surfing and boogie boarding!
348123121.author: a TripAdvisor user
348123121.reviewBody: Los Cerritos is a fun sheltered beach with terrific waves and lots of boarding activity, with reasonable rentals. The steady rotation of vendors can be ignored, or declined with a friendly \'no gracias\', no problem at all. Parking is cramped now that a private interest has gated the main previous parking area. Public parking is off to the side now.

347929143.name: Surf\'s Up!
347929143.author: a TripAdvisor user
347929143.reviewBody: Stopped here on the way back from Todos Santos to Cabo.\n\nSignage is not super obvious from the highway.  Rough dirt road getting in and out.  You may have to pay 100 pesos to park.  Dive bar right there at the beach for cold cerveza.  Eclectic, bohemian crowd.  Decent waves for surfing depending on the wind.  Good beach for people watching.

347603325.name: Best surfing around!
347603325.author: a TripAdvisor user
347603325.reviewBody: Surf and soak up the sun. Buy a drink at the beach club (overpriced, so if you can bring your own!), get a massage, get surf lessons with Mario, your day will be fun here!

347020395.name: Warm water, clean sand, great surfing
347020395.author: a TripAdvisor user
347020395.reviewBody: Mario surf school was fantastic.  This semi-secret beach was amazing.  FUll of life and great beach for swimming and watching the surfers.  There are some nearby hotels that seemed nice also.

346412862.name: great surfing!
346412862.author: a TripAdvisor user
346412862.reviewBody: Great surfing, lovely view from La Hacienda.  Board rentals on the beach - w some beach vendors that can be westerly - but all round great surf.

345629735.name: Its ok.
345629735.author: a TripAdvisor user
345629735.reviewBody: Beach is nice and rentals are reasonable.  Food and drink at the Beach bar is only so so and extremely expensive for what you get.

345387193.name: Parking IS free
345387193.author: a TripAdvisor user
345387193.reviewBody: You must park to the left of the restaurant up a small road for free parking. If you do park in the restaurant parking lot you have to buy. Get a beer and some fries for around 8 bucks. If you eat there you get a "washroom pass" to use their facilities. They actually have someone guarding the restrooms. Pretty funny..my waiter forgot to give me my pass and the smiling pleasant "guard" was NOT going to let me go...i had to hunt down my waiter.    \nBring all your own supplies including umbrella. A very nice beach.

345232904.name: Great swimming.
345232904.author: a TripAdvisor user
345232904.reviewBody: Great water and surf.  It\'s a little scruffy around the edges, but friendly, fun swimming and wave riding.  Water is shallow for a long way out.

344597980.name: Fantastic!
344597980.author: a TripAdvisor user
344597980.reviewBody: Love this beach! It is easy to walk around, the sand is very easy on the feet. The waves work for boogey-boarding and surfing, but it is pretty easy to swim too. I loved the music that the beach club had on Sundays.

344134336.name: Awesome surf and beach
344134336.author: a TripAdvisor user
344134336.reviewBody: Amazing surf, beautiful sandy beach. great place to relax on the way to Todos Santos. Road to the beach is all sand and a bit sketchy in places.

344078919.name: Calm In Rough Waves
344078919.author: a TripAdvisor user
344078919.reviewBody: Most of the beaches in the area have rough surf and almost violent waves most of the time. This was the only area where you can actually walk on the beach and go in the water in relative calm.

343674010.name: Pay to Park at the beach in Mexico?
343674010.author: a TripAdvisor user
343674010.reviewBody: Beaches are suppose to be open to the public in Mexico yet the owners here charge you to park.  Very sad because its a great beach.

343125860.name: Great surf for both beginners and pros
343125860.author: a TripAdvisor user
343125860.reviewBody: Outside break was worthy of a surf competition while we were there (January), while the inside whitewater was a great place for lessons and beginners.

342241970.name: Crowded and windy
342241970.author: a TripAdvisor user
342241970.reviewBody: My husband loved this beach, which was great for novice surfing.  Wasn\'t my cup of tea as it was very windy, crowded, and had dogs running everywhere (one of my kids is terrified of dogs.)

341985156.name: Classic maxi-beach and surf spot
341985156.author: a TripAdvisor user
341985156.reviewBody: A good place for newbie surfers. You can get lessons on big boards, rent boards pretty cheaply, and get out and get used to the water. More experienced surfers can enjoy bigger waves a bit further out. Can get windy in the afternoon, and also potentially crowded. Usually a good relaxed vibe, but occasional ugly Americans pop up believing it\'s their God-given right to share their music playlists at high volume. A lack of restrooms is an issue, unless you buy something at the restaurant.

341714505.name: Just don\'t go swimming.
341714505.author: a TripAdvisor user
341714505.reviewBody: I have been an avid swimmer most of my life. Was a lifeguard all through college and even I wouldn\'t go into the water. The waves are just too rough and the under tow would have taken one out to sea. Its a beautiful place, just not great for swimming.

340833260.name: A warm winter day
340833260.author: a TripAdvisor user
340833260.reviewBody: We drove out to Los Cerritos beach one afternoon.  The beach was much like others in Todos Santos area except that it was safe to swim here.  There were numerous enterprises on the beach and I was approached by several people selling different items.  The beach has food vendors and restrooms.

340579696.name: nice for a beach day
340579696.author: a TripAdvisor user
340579696.reviewBody: Actually, this is about the only place where you can relax on the beach. The waves are thunderous and break along the shoreline nearly everywhere else in the area. There are the usual folks selling their hats, silver, blankets etc., and there also masseuses, but some are far better than the others. Look for the ones with the green canopy. $20/40 minutes.

339601272.name: surf\'s up
339601272.author: a TripAdvisor user
339601272.reviewBody: this beach has changed so so much but is still beautiful and now there is a bar! No camping. Much surfing. Many dogs. No coolers. Free parking

337825669.name: A great beach-bring your own grub
337825669.author: a TripAdvisor user
337825669.reviewBody:
The beach is as described by so many others.  Wonderful surf, good swimming and during low tide the shallows are great for kids.  Surf and boogie board rental at a rate of @ $20 US and $5 US respectively.  Yes, dogs on the beach, watch your step.  Nearby construction confirms this beach is going to become much more crowded in the coming years.

Bring your own food and drink unless you like average food and have money to burn.  $18 US for a hamburger and $4.5 US for a Modelo is, quite frankly, insane. You will find much better food at a great price by making the short but bumpy drive back to the highway to nearby Pescadoro.  You are only a captive of this beach bar if you elect to be.  

Vendors aplenty-they are doing their job.  A brief "nada, gracias" and most usually move on.  If they don't then you likely are sending mixed signals.  Some sell okay souvenirs but if you plan to buy then  know they will haggle over price.

337422114.name: Great spot to watch the whales, beachcomb
337422114.author: a TripAdvisor user
337422114.reviewBody: Clean many miles long beach. Potentially good surfing with a mixed swell giving rise to peaky bowls. Offshore winds in am, side wind into the rights by noon. Crystal clear water.\nWatched tuna working bait balls just yards from shore. Grey whale moms and calves everywhere spouting and occasionally breaching.

336799926.name: Beautiful view, peaceful
336799926.author: a TripAdvisor user
336799926.reviewBody: This beach was very peaceful. It wasn\'t overcrowded with tourists, and there was plenty of room on the beach to lay out. The water is shallow for quite a distance out into the ocean, which allows for better swimming. Whales could be seen very far out into the distance. There was a peddler that was walking up and down the beach trying to sell hats and jewelry, but compared to larger tourist cities, one peddler is a very positive experience.

336497154.name: Bring a boogie board
336497154.author: a TripAdvisor user
336497154.reviewBody: Amazing beach with most people situated at the south end. Those looking for more seclusion need only walk a few minutes. Bring a boogie board and if possible beach umbrella as no natural shade. Waves are formidable but fun with boards. Local folks rent equipment if you do not have.

336049270.name: Best beach for surfing and boogie boarding
336049270.author: a TripAdvisor user
336049270.reviewBody: Cerritos beach is the perfect beach for surfers and for boogie boarding. We go there for a day on our annual family Christmas trip to Cabo San Lucas.\n  It\'s a great place for the whole family!!

335707983.name: this place is beatiful
335707983.author: a TripAdvisor user
335707983.reviewBody: This is beautiful place away the crowd from Los Cabos.\nThe beach the calm and very long. the surround club is very beautiful as well.\nstay couple day here to enjoy the quiet holiday.

335680415.name: Safe, crowded, warm water, good surf
335680415.author: a TripAdvisor user
335680415.reviewBody:
I have been coming to Todos Santos at Christmas time since 2009. Every time I am here others have gone to Playa Cerritos and raved about the trip. It took us about 20 minutes to drive from TS. The dirt road off the main highway is rutted and slow going.
When we arrived I was shocked to see so many parked cars! The beach certainly was beautiful but it was very crowded with people of all ages from very young to elderly. There were plenty of dogs and the mess they leave behind. One of them marked his territory on our beach bag! Vendors interrupted us every 5 minutes selling hats, jewelry, sunglasses, and hammocks! There were horses to ride....through the people playing at the water's edge.
There is a pretty good surf school for those who want to learn to surf, they are especially good with kids. The water was warm and the waves were perfect to learn on. We had a toddler with us and he really liked the ankle high waves at the shore to ride his boogie board. 
There is a beach restaurant serving food and drink, but we brought our picnic with us since we heard the prices were really high. They also rent umbrellas and chairs.
The beach is certainly extensive enough to get away from the crowds...and if you are looking for solitude you can find it by walking north.

334797341.name: Pretty touristy and a bit crowded on the weekends!!
334797341.author: a TripAdvisor user
334797341.reviewBody: Pretty touristy and a bit crowded on the weekends!! The waves are OK but generally there are a bunch of tourist surfers out so it is a fight to get a wave as always ... the bar food at the Cerritos Beach Club is decent but really overpriced (not a surprise as they have a captive market) ... just OK but it is an OK beach.

332167209.name: Good waves, warm water, no crowds
332167209.author: a TripAdvisor user
332167209.reviewBody: Absolutely pristine beach with few people. Gradually slopes out so good for swimming. The water was very warm. Much better than at San Jose del Cabo.

332155568.name: Great surfing beach
332155568.author: a TripAdvisor user
332155568.reviewBody: We ate at tables on the sand, under umbrellas. Good food and drinks at a reasonable price considering the setting. Great beach and usually surfing. Children should be supervised

329190525.name: Warm water, nice sand-Great Beach!
329190525.author: a TripAdvisor user
329190525.reviewBody: Cerritos is one of my all time favorite beaches.  Beautiful views, clean, warm water.  The nearby restaurant has fantastic Pina Coladas.  Had a surf lesson and LOVED it.

328529472.name: Waves!
328529472.author: a TripAdvisor user
328529472.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful but the corrents can get strong, so you better watch out in the water. The restaurants are very turistic and a bit expensive. Is not the quiet paradise beach, but you have all facillities, beach clubs, surf schools, massages..

326141319.name: Don\'t let the secret out
326141319.author: a TripAdvisor user
326141319.reviewBody: This beach is amazing.  Swimmable, great waves, bath tub temperature water, Beach club for drinks and fresh tacos, massage ladies on hand for $20 an hour, and the sunsets are breathtaking.

326098349.name: Beautiful Beach
326098349.author: a TripAdvisor user
326098349.reviewBody: It is a very nice beach were you can swim even with small kids (close to them). It is a little confusing not to park on a private property. There are a lot of surfers so it is nice to watch them.

326041439.name: Nice beach but a bit "Touristy"
326041439.author: a TripAdvisor user
326041439.reviewBody: If you are looking for a quiet, empty beach to chill on near Todos Santos then Playa Los Cerritos is probably not for you. You will get vendors trying to sell you hats, jewelry and such (although I am sure they are very tame when compared to Cabo San Lucas) and you will have to pay a 100 pesos minimum (you can buy a couple of beers in the bar to cover the charge) if you park in the Beach Club parking. \n\nThe beach is nice and you can swim, boogie board or surf with relative safety compared to the rough shore break waves you get on other nearby beaches. It is probably the most popular beach in the area because of this fact. The Beach Club serves food and drinks and has banos. Overall, a good place to spend the day for sun and surf but not necessarily solitude. If you want peace, quiet and no people, try Playa Los Palmas just south of Todos Santos accessible only by a pretty nasty dirt road.

325511642.name: Watching the surfers at Cerritos - a must do!
325511642.author: a TripAdvisor user
325511642.reviewBody: This fabulous beach is difficult to find off the main highway but totally worth the adventure.  If you want to get away from the tourist crowds and hang with the surfers, have a massage, or a drink at the bar on the beach - this is definitely the place to go!  You can take surf lessons as well, we heard that this is better for the beginner surfer then San Jose Del Cabo - safer and fewer rocks.

325109575.name: Warm water, gentle surf
325109575.author: a TripAdvisor user
325109575.reviewBody: We were here only for an hour or so as the sun was hot. You can rent sombrillos (beach umbrellas) for $10.00. The water had surf and surfers but it was gentle enough to swim in. The beach is very attractive like a tropical version of Tofino\'s Long Beach.

324128385.name: Surf & Sun
324128385.author: a TripAdvisor user
324128385.reviewBody: Stopped to play in the water at Cerritos. Has a restaurant that we did not try and beach vendors who were respectful. The waves were great. Could tell when the tide shifted and could feel the undertow a bit stronger as the afternoon went on. Would definitely recommend going for the day!

321183140.name: Best Beach
321183140.author: a TripAdvisor user
321183140.reviewBody: rent your umbrellas and chairs - stop at Walmart in Cabo and stock your cooler - pick up almost anything else along the way at the OXXO (our local version of a QT gas station)

319918030.name: A terrific find!
319918030.author: a TripAdvisor user
319918030.reviewBody: During our week-long visit to Cabo San Lucas, we took one day to check out Todos Santos.  On the way back to Cabo, we stopped a this terrific beach.  Unlike to Pacific beaches at Cabo, this one is swimable (albeit extremely rough).  There\'s a little bar and grill on the beach as well.  Loved this beach!

309981504.name: Always a blast
309981504.author: a TripAdvisor user
309981504.reviewBody: Been coming here for more than 10 years and it is interesting on how much it has changed. I have yet to decide if it is for the better or worse? Always bring your board or body board and a cooler with your own stuff and it feels like it was in the yesteryear. Or sit at one of the restaurants and cough up $$$. Still a problem with garbage on the beach.

306102877.name: Surfing
306102877.author: a TripAdvisor user
306102877.reviewBody: everything was easy from whale watching to lobster from the cafe to surfing with boards available.  Lovely long warm sandy beach not to empty but not too crowded.  Could spend every day there.

302246859.name: Amazing Beach!!!
302246859.author: a TripAdvisor user
302246859.reviewBody: Amazing beach. Great for attempting surfing or watching others! Can rent a surfboard for $10/day or a boogie board for less. \n\nBeers and food from the resort are really expensive, so I would recommend bringing your own. There\'s a store on the corner of Villas de Cerritos not far away.

300483630.name: Best Beach between Cabo and Todos Santos
300483630.author: a TripAdvisor user
300483630.reviewBody: Have been to this beach every year we have been in Cabo.  It used to be a real trek.  As more and more of highway is four lane it has gotten easier.  But still well off beaten path.  There is a luxury hotel overlooking beach, two condo complexes, and restaurant / beach bar.  This is only beach we have found that is safe swimming, and even then theirs a significant right to left rip current but it is manageable.  They have venders, a massage area,a place to rent surf equipment, and the last time we were there a ski doo place.  As I said this place is off the main road and half the fun is the drive in.  This is perfect day trip.  First beach in morning, lunch on the beach, in to Totos Santos for shopping and art galleries,  and the dinner at one of many good restaurants.  With more  of road done it is less than an hour and a half back to Cabo.  Do this soon as this place will not be the hidden highlight it is now.

298427292.name: Yes to the beach
298427292.author: a TripAdvisor user
298427292.reviewBody: What a great place to have fun in the sun!  We enjoyed the beach and were able to rent an umbrella and have a nice snack and drinks on the beach.

296160120.name: Cool Beach
296160120.author: a TripAdvisor user
296160120.reviewBody: We were introduced to this beach by a local and returned after initially trying El Faro Beach and Spa (which had a weird vibe). Don\'t try to bring a cooler: they are not allowed. The service at the restaurant on the beach - you take a table or chairs and an umbrella on the beach - is very good. The prices are a little marked up compared to Cabo - $4.50 for a beer or basic mohito. The food is respectable and similarly priced. The surfing and body surfing/swimming is really goaded the while place has a good feel.

293544121.name: great beach for traveling aussie family
293544121.author: a TripAdvisor user
293544121.reviewBody: This beach is a lot like the kind of beach we travel kilometres for (at home). The surf was reliable (so Mr 16 tells me), the atmosphere was chilled and relaxed. Of course you can take your own umbrella and towel, but my goodness it is easy to just pay the money and hire those already available. The food on the restaurant is a bit pricey (but that might have been largely a result of currency fluctuations), but tasty and very convenient.

292979866.name: Less Touristy Beautiful Beach Near Cabo
292979866.author: a TripAdvisor user
292979866.reviewBody: Los Cerritos is so laid back and has more of a local vibe, which is refreshing from the touristy Cabo San Lucas. I spent the day in Todos Santos a charming town just north and finished the day off with Coronas on Cerritos. Perfection!

291605301.name: Nice beah
291605301.author: a TripAdvisor user
291605301.reviewBody: This is one of the safer beaches in the Todos  Santos region.  Go here, and not to any todos santos beach (well, maybe Punta lobos for the fishermen and boats)

290873357.name: Great for Surfing, tough to swim in
290873357.author: a TripAdvisor user
290873357.reviewBody: I imagine that surfing here is spectacular.  But it\'s a bit rough for swimming.  Views are spectacular if you aren\'t looking at the faux spanish colonial condos going up.  I suspect that this, along with other beaches along Baja\'s Pacific coastline are going to get swallowed up with development.  Best to get here before that happens.

290245976.name: Fun place to hang
290245976.author: a TripAdvisor user
290245976.reviewBody: Had a wonderful time hanging out at the beach enjoying the food and music while people watching.  Loved the food.

289967299.name: Lovely beach, usually calm enough for a swim.
289967299.author: a TripAdvisor user
289967299.reviewBody: This is about the only safe beach for swimming near Todos Santo.  Its a fun place because there\'s a restaurant right on the beach with a shower attached....nice for rinsing off sand!  One downside to the restaurant....its VERY expensive.  But, there\'s lots of beach to walk and when the waves are calm its delightful.  And when the waves are up its great for bogey boarding, I hear.\n

289549196.name: Great Beach
289549196.author: a TripAdvisor user
289549196.reviewBody: One of the only swimmable beaches around. Great place to spend the day relaxing and enjoying the sun and surf. Cerritos Beach Club is a great place to grab a cold beer or cocktail and listen to the live music.

289351833.name: great location, staff beyond friendly and helpful.
289351833.author: a TripAdvisor user
289351833.reviewBody: Food is ok for a beach joint. Ambiance is cool, relaxed and joyful.\nWe loved spending a couple of afternoons being pampered.

287313322.name: Okay beach.
287313322.author: a TripAdvisor user
287313322.reviewBody: This beach was recommended but wasn\'t high on our list. Looking to get away from typical Mexican beach vendors selling silver and wrap around skirts?  Don\'t go here. The little taco shack, cute as it was, wanted $18 U.S. for 3 tacos. Skip it and go to las palmas closer to todos santos at KM87 where there is no one around except some wild horses. And you can bring your own cooler which you weren\'t allowed at Los Cerritos.

286425751.name: Just right
286425751.author: a TripAdvisor user
286425751.reviewBody: Definitely the calmest beach around the Todos Santos area. You will see a variety of activities taking place like swimmers, surfers (all ranges), fishermen, people enjoying massages, you name it. You\'ll most likely find an activity you\'ll enjoy, in or out of the water. When you get hungry or thirsty, there is the beach club for Cerritos that serves US priced food and bev.\nPretty safe beach with rentals for boards and umbrellas starting off at pretty cheap prices.\nWill be your go to beach in Todos Santos if you\'re not a world class surfer.

286075108.name: Great Beach
286075108.author: a TripAdvisor user
286075108.reviewBody: Something for everyone here. Surf, bodysurf, swim, walk,horseback riding.  Restaurant with public restrooms, massages and live music.  Rent an umbrella for 10 bucks for the day.

284286751.name: Simply the best beach for swimming and learning to surf on the Pacific side in southern Baja
284286751.author: a TripAdvisor user
284286751.reviewBody: Simply the best beach for swimming and learning to surf on the Pacific side in southern Baja. The hard-packed sandy beach is perfect for long walks. Surf is best in winter time, but even in June there was a good swell. Plenty of options to rent equipment and have a drink at the beach-bar. (not cheap any more) New beach accommodation is developed all the time and you will have plenty of choice.

278118209.name: Getting commercialized but still a fun time
278118209.author: a TripAdvisor user
278118209.reviewBody: My husband and I have been to this beach the past few years, and it still remains a good time. It\'s a bit more commercialized - this is the first year where when we arrived, we were given a white ticket that states that a 100 pesos minimum be met at the restaurant to be able to park there. Years prior, it has always been free.  We bought a beer and a coke and got "validated", but on our way out, no one bothered to retrieve the ticket. We brought our own umbrellas, snacks, drinks and towels and got a spot further away from the restaurant - and had a fantastic time in the water and relaxing on the beach. There are still vendors, but they leave you alone after a polite decline. Even if you don\'t have your own items, you can rent umbrellas, seats, surfboards, etc. I would definitely recommend.

277878339.name: Surfing lessons, cocktails on the beach!
277878339.author: a TripAdvisor user
277878339.reviewBody: It\'s all in the title! If you want surfing lessons, or to rent a surf board this is where to go. The bonus is the beach restaurant and bar. Good food and great drinks. We had live music on the sand on Sunday afternoon. Perfect!!

275402940.name: Great beach to watch surfers
275402940.author: a TripAdvisor user
275402940.reviewBody: Took a bit of a drive to get there off the main highway, but worth it. Wide beach, with great surf. Nice restaurant there, decent food, order beer not their mixed drinks

274797352.name: Great surf spot
274797352.author: a TripAdvisor user
274797352.reviewBody: We stumbled upon this place on our way from Todos Santos to Cabo. What a little gem - great surf spot (there was a contest happening) and great food! Will be back to stay in the future!

273874831.name: Surf and swim!
273874831.author: a TripAdvisor user
273874831.reviewBody: Was fun for surfing and also one of the only beach we visited where it was easy to go for a swim! Restaurant / bar on the beach is a good idea, but a bit overpriced compared to everything else around Todos Santos! Fun days at Cerritos!

273228570.name: Great off the beaten path
273228570.author: a TripAdvisor user
273228570.reviewBody: We had a rental jeep, otherwise we wouldn\'t have made it. It\'s a ways away from touristy Cabo, plus a dirt road from the highway to the parking lots. We were confused about parking. We had to take a ticket and buy a minimum at their bar. I was annoyed by that because I brought my own water & snacks. I wish you could just pay a lot fee. Anyway, there\'s more crowded areas to watch surfers and rent a chair or towel. Instead we went further along the beach & had our own space. One of us stayed at the towels (brought our own) & the other dipped in the waves and body surfed. We weren\'t sure if it was safe to leave our things unattended, though really hardly anyone was around. It\'s a beautiful, Pacific beach, very reminiscent of California\'s long stretches of sand, and rolling blue waves.

270736337.name: Ok beach
270736337.author: a TripAdvisor user
270736337.reviewBody:
The food at restaurant was okay.
The water was nice and waves would be okay for surfing.
 California beaches are just as nice.
 Long stretch of beach for nice walk.

270591123.name: Nice stretch of beach.
270591123.author: a TripAdvisor user
270591123.reviewBody: As it is one of the few safe swim beaches in the area, it can get crowded on the weekends but that added to some of  the fun as the restaurant on the beach has live music on Sunday and serves decent food.  Even on a very crowded day, walking a short distance on the beach provides empty stretches of beach for solitude.

268878627.name: Nice swimmable beach
268878627.author: a TripAdvisor user
268878627.reviewBody: Had a great time here. Not crowded and loved the view of the inn on the cliff. Easy to locate off of 19. Will definitely be coming back.

266885933.name: Stunning
266885933.author: a TripAdvisor user
266885933.reviewBody: For better or worse, the surf coming to the Todos Santos area is very, very, dangerous.  There are  posted beaches discouraging swimming.  \'Rogue\' waves from the north Pacific can "hump up\' and sweep people off beaches.  Playa Los Cerritos is in the \'wave shadow\' of a spit of land and is one of the few really same beaches on the Pacific side of the Baja Peninsula. There are still some fairly large waves, but they are ride-able with surfboards or belly boards or just body surfing.  This is a wonderful beach to take your kids to.  And, perhaps, one of the only safe beaches.

265279747.name: Gorgeous beachfront with something for everyone
265279747.author: a TripAdvisor user
265279747.reviewBody:
If you like to lay on a beach that feels like no one else is around for miles, you can easily find a place to get comfortable here and be free from the hustle and bustle that exists on the north end of the beach. Vendors are less likely to bother you in this southern part of the beach. 

If you want to be near to bathrooms and dining, then the north end of the beach is for you. There is a restaurant with live music and sunglasses-sellers and hat-sellers offering their wares here. Surf board rentals and lessons are also available here.

The water itself is cooler than the Sea of Cortez given that you're swimming in the Pacific Ocean. The tide was not as strong as that at Medano Beach in Cabo San Lucas, which meant there were a lot more families with little ones and dogs at the northern portion of this beach. The atmosphere is very peaceful and laid back here, even in the busiest parts of the beach.

Do bring an umbrella so that you don't have to rent one and a cooler full of cervezas to ensure a wonderful beach experience at Los Cerritos.

264942652.name: Good Beach by Todos Santos
264942652.author: a TripAdvisor user
264942652.reviewBody: Cerritos is a swimable/surfable beach by Todos Santos. There is a restaurant/bar here as well. \nKeep in mind that the Pacific side is colder and less turquoise than its\' neighbor to the south,  Cabo, and much of Todos Santos area beaches are just flat out unsafe-even for our born and raised beach family.\nSo, we had a nice afternoon at this spot. Just don\'t expect some postcard picture beach-that is different area all together.

264730278.name: A great beach for swimming and smaller crowds.
264730278.author: a TripAdvisor user
264730278.reviewBody: This is a great, long beach and a ton of fun for body surfing.  We should have bought some short boards at Walmart as the waves were perfect.  Lots of people surfing (I think you can rent there).  Sand was soft and water wasn\'t really cold once you were used to it.  The dirt road to get there is a bit bumpy, but worth it for the surfing, for sure!

264026110.name: Fabulous beach
264026110.author: a TripAdvisor user
264026110.reviewBody: The beach  was great for swimming, surfing.  The Cerritos surf colony was a wonderful way to end a day at the beach.  Delicious nachos and tasty drinks, while listening to a fabulous band, playing Bob Dylan style of music.  The pool and hot tub were very nice.  All accessible to us and we were not even staying there.

263427351.name: Most swimmable beach near Todos
263427351.author: a TripAdvisor user
263427351.reviewBody: We have been going to Lost Cerritos beach for years and have seen many changes as more and more housing is built nearby. This is our favorite beach for our family because it meets all of our needs: our child can swim here although their is a very strong riptide, my husband can surf (long and short board waves) and I can enjoy a long beach walk as their are miles of coastline. There is food service from the beach bar, you can expect typical beach bar food. It sure is nice to have cold drinks delivered on a hot Baja day. There is a large parking lot that is a paid lot - be prepared to pay with pesos. Lastly, the Hacienda is a large hotel that sits above Los Cerritos beach. The view from their hotel is epic and you can enjoy, as a non-hotel-guest, a drink in their outside bar while catching site of whales. Just take the stone staircase from the beach to the beautiful hotel above. By the way, there are board rentals available at Cerritos Beach.

262475703.name: Perfect Beach
262475703.author: a TripAdvisor user
262475703.reviewBody:
Perfect Mexico beach. 

We rented 2 surf boards ($10 each for the day!) and played in the surf all day. The folks that rent the boards are attached to the Cerriots Beach Club and allowed us to swap out boards throughout the day for the same price so we used a couple of different surf boards, bogie boards and skim boards all in one day.  

We had lunch at the Beach Club which is pricy ($18 for ceviche) but the food was good. 

We also used their beach chairs since we had lunch and drinks with them and it was a great way to spend the day. 

Safe and very few beach vendors made this a quite and relaxing day on the beach. Plus the drive out towards Todo Santos is worth seeing - True Sonoran desert landscape.

262032767.name: Sublime way to spend a day
262032767.author: a TripAdvisor user
262032767.reviewBody: This beach is a short drive from Totas Santos and is a great way to spend a day at the beach. We had some of the best fish of our entire vacation under an umbrella looking out on the sea. My husband had a massage on the beach and he said that Gabby is one of the best and the price is right.

261154421.name: The Way It Used To Be
261154421.author: a TripAdvisor user
261154421.reviewBody: REALLY enjoyed visiting Cerritos Beach ... reminded me of what Cabo used to be.  Nice big beach, surfable waves (and surf rentals), swimmable water, beach restaurant and free parking.  If you want to get away from the mayham in Cabo during spring break ... this is a nice place to visit.  10 min\'s south of Todos Santos down a dirt road.  There are even a few lazy lodging accommodations if you decide you want to stay here over night.

260644777.name: Getting to busy
260644777.author: a TripAdvisor user
260644777.reviewBody: Great beach for surfing but getting to built up for my taste beach restaurant expensive for what it is watch for blowing sand if it gets windy

260473925.name: Great beach, just lively enough
260473925.author: a TripAdvisor user
260473925.reviewBody: Great day trip!  There is just enough to keep you busy when you\'re not relaxing on the sand or playing in the water.  \n\nParking is tricky!  There are two spots that are not part of a hotel.  one on the north end near the restaurant, and one just south of that- that one looks more like the end of the road, and people just park on the sides.

260331120.name: Cerritos Beach
260331120.author: a TripAdvisor user
260331120.reviewBody: I just love this beach! It was a nice relaxing getaway for the day just 45 minutes north of Cabo. Very friendly people, surfboard rentals, nice breaks for beginners. Great Vibe overall! Will go back for sure!

257760529.name: Surfing beach outside of Cabo
257760529.author: a TripAdvisor user
257760529.reviewBody: We were here four years ago and our kids loved it and learned to surf.  They are older now and the waves were minimal this time of year (Feb. 2015). We just kinda lost that loving feeling that we had the first time.  We have to pay to park  (or spend $10 at the restaurant and remember to validate your ticket!) Parking is in a deep sand lot that we had to push to get out of.  The beach used to be great to run on and now it\'s slanted more.  There\'s LOTS of vendors peddling all kinds of wares.  We constantly were saying "no thank you".  The bar was slightly high, $5 for a beer.  The music was lots of Eagles. I felt like they were playing the same soundtrack 4 years ago. Highlight was hiking up to this gorgeous old hotel on the hill and having a fresh squeezed mango margarita in their outdoor bar with an incredible 360 degree ocean view!!  Wow!

257723736.name: Best in the area for safe swimming, watersports
257723736.author: a TripAdvisor user
257723736.reviewBody: We preferred to walk or hang out on other stretches of the long beach, but Cerritos is best for swimming. The surf is less intense here and children can play in the water safely. It\'s "crowded" by local standards but really not bad. We left the gorgeous beach we were staying on a few times to head over to Cerritos for a swim, but didn\'t hang out for more than a few hours at a time. It is also as the other reviews say a great place to surf or body board. You can also get chairs/umbrellas/drinks here so if you want.

257548489.name: Great spot for beginning surfing, beach lounging? Not so much
257548489.author: a TripAdvisor user
257548489.reviewBody: The beach is a great place for beginning surfers to go and get their wave on, but may not be the best spot for those just looking for beach lounging. There are a lot of sticks and debris on the beach still from the hurricane.

256449218.name: Great surfing beach
256449218.author: a TripAdvisor user
256449218.reviewBody: What a beautiful fun beach! Yes...it is true, if you dont surf dont bother, but if you do surf or want to learn how to surf this is the place...both of my kids learned there and this beach is amazingly fun since has great waves but shallow enough for kids! Saw more action here than in Bondi!

255120320.name: Nothing special
255120320.author: a TripAdvisor user
255120320.reviewBody: Beach is nothing special but I don\'t surf. Bare so unless you surf don\'t bother. The accommodations are mediocre and the places to eat are slim pickings. The restaurant at Cerritos surf club has terrible service but the food is edible. There is a new restaurant that is pretty expensive $20 pizza and $40 steak but the waiter Sergio was sweet and very attentive without being annoying.

253689298.name: Los Cerritos
253689298.author: a TripAdvisor user
253689298.reviewBody: This is an amazingly beautiful and quite place.  Sitting on the beach we watched whales jumping on the horizon and baby seals jumping in the waves.

251947356.name: Beautiful!!!!
251947356.author: a TripAdvisor user
251947356.reviewBody: This is a great place to learn how to surf, even kids can have safe fun here! Of course you must  keep a watchful eye on them! For many people this would be one of the very few places where they can dip in the Pacific Ocean, the waves constantly hit the sand but the water upfront is pretty shallow. Everything is there, an expensive restaurant on the beach, a must pay parking lot and a must pay bathroom. but it is really clean. Go to the bar, have a beer and have them stamp the ticket they give you at the parking entrance, then you can use the bathroom instead of having to find a bush or dipping in the Ocean every time you have to take a leak. ;-)\nIt is 70 km away from Cabo or so, and there is a different vibe there. \nHighly recommended!

251111288.name: Surfing for beginners or advanced
251111288.author: a TripAdvisor user
251111288.reviewBody: A group of 8 friends visited Playa Los Cerritos as part of a tour organized by Todos Santos Eco Adventures (Amazing).  In just a few hours, under the guidance of surfing instructors...all 8 of us were able to get up on our boards.  Yeeehoooo!!

251018906.name: nice beach
251018906.author: a TripAdvisor user
251018906.reviewBody: This is the best swimming beach in the area; others have riptides. It was pleasant enough when we were there--flat and pretty empty. The surfers are a hoot to watch! Not too many services available, though; you\'re kind of captive.

250995894.name: Fun for all levels of surfers
250995894.author: a TripAdvisor user
250995894.reviewBody: We had a great time at Cerritos.  Because of the bluff on the north side, the beach is pretty protected from the wind.  The break on the north side has an outer section, which connects on bigger waves with a fast section close to shore.  There\'s also a left towards the middle of the beach, which looked super fast.

249918942.name: Nice surf spot
249918942.author: a TripAdvisor user
249918942.reviewBody: A perennial favorite. You can rent a surfboard for $20 a day, and negotiate to a bit less for a couple of hours. Water warm enough for board shorts and rash guard, but a shorty wetsuit would work well too. Usually a reasonable crowd in the water, occasionally some irritable locals, but nobody really nasty. Waves 2-4 feet, occasionally a bit more. Lots of vendors on the beach, and a bar and restaurant only a few feet away. Often whales off the beach spouting and cavorting. A nice place to spend a few hours - or days!

248818591.name: great day at the beach
248818591.author: a TripAdvisor user
248818591.reviewBody: Cerritos is still up and running after the storm. Food is good and the beer is cold. They was still some debris  on the beach but we still had a great day. The hotel on the point was pretty beat up. We have always gone up there for a drink and they were open but didn\'t really have a full bar. very selective. Still it was a great day. The guys working at cerritos  were good at making sure you were happy. great service. They still have the massage tables on the beach, and the prices were attractive. Fun Day at the beach

248037581.name: Fantastic beach
248037581.author: a TripAdvisor user
248037581.reviewBody: A great beach to visit when in Todos Santos. There are long boards and surfboards to hire on the beach and a beach bar to utilise. Beautiful beach with safe swimming.  Perfect spot for sun-downers after a lazy day at the beach!

247633406.name: PERFECTION
247633406.author: a TripAdvisor user
247633406.reviewBody: Quiet, beautiful, and free, everything you could want in a beach day. Only drawback is a couple of locals hawking jewelry, but once you say no, they leave you alone.

247438502.name: For the surfer beach experience
247438502.author: a TripAdvisor user
247438502.reviewBody: If crowds don\'t bother you, and great waves without a trek off the beaten path is what you\'re looking for, then Cerritos is your spot.
