You can enjoy the beach on your own towel for free, or you can pay one of the beach clubs and they\'ll set you up with chairs, towels, food and drinks.\n\nThe surf here is fantastic. It\'s a large beach, so if you want to walk down a bit, you can get away from the crowds quickly. I always spend at least one day Cerritos for the atmosphere of a fun and social beach environment, but there are secluded and nearly empty beaches very close by.

246453213.name: Great place for kids/families to swim
246453213.author: a TripAdvisor user
246453213.reviewBody: We loved this beach.  The kids loved being able to swim all day.  Minimal vendors, fantastic weather.  We didn\'t pay for parking or go to restaurant, hotel, or bar.  We brought our own picnic and gad a great time.

244865710.name: Awesome place
244865710.author: a TripAdvisor user
244865710.reviewBody: We visited Playa Los Cerritos, and must say that we loved! Quite beach, with not to much hassle from the vendors, nice breaks for beginner surfers, and best of all nice warm water!

243546220.name: One of our fav beaches
243546220.author: a TripAdvisor user
243546220.reviewBody: Yes, love this beach. Great swimming, surfing, take lovely long walks along the water\'s edge. Nice amenities with a surf club, surfboard rentals, restaurants, and lodging.

243356291.name: Gorgeous! Favorite day excursion from Cabo!
243356291.author: a TripAdvisor user
243356291.reviewBody: Cerritos is fantastic!  The beach stretches for quite a ways, with large expanses of sand great for sunbathing or watching surfers.  The beach club offers a wide variety of options for lunch, as well as many different beers and amazing margaritas (they are strong)!  The water was warm and clear, and we had a blast jumping in and out of the waves for hours.  I look back now and wish we had spent more time there - this will definitely be a priority on my list for our return trip.

242982990.name: Nice swim and people watching beach
242982990.author: a TripAdvisor user
242982990.reviewBody: Beach has lots of branches and debris left over from the Hurricane.  I\'m sure it will be much nicer once its cleaned up.

242815602.name: Saw it and left...
242815602.author: a TripAdvisor user
242815602.reviewBody: The first thing we noticed about the beach was the crowd and the smell. Some locals contributed the smell to rotting tree pulp that blew in from the hurricane while others directly stated it\'s from a septic take that became damaged and ran down the hill from the elaborate hotel that sits on the bluff. Since we weren\'t really interested in getting a definitive on it we jammed to some other spots. \n\nA lot of people seemed to like this place though. It just felt super touristy, smelled terrible and was really crowded. Just not my scene but you might really like it.

242597313.name: touristy but still a nice beach
242597313.author: a TripAdvisor user
242597313.reviewBody: Imagine this beach, before the large hotel on the hill, the palapas and surf shops, casitas and beer bar. When the beach was peppered with tents of local and snowbird surfers..that\'s when I was there. To see it grow into what it is now, and the Mexican hito land for sale all the way out to the highway is quite a change. Its still a nice beach if somewhat touristy.

242022717.name: Nice beach
242022717.author: a TripAdvisor user
242022717.reviewBody:
We took a beautiful, scenic drive from Cabo San Lucas to Todos Santos.  Based on the reviews on this site, I decided to find this beach.  There weren't a lot of easy-to-find directions on this page so I figured I would focus on that.  The entrance was a few dozen meters after kilometer marker 64 (if you are driving south). I've attached a photo of a building across the street. 

The restaurant at the end of road has a parking lot and they will let you park there if you spend $100 pesos in the restaurant.  

The beach is really big. There is no shade other than the umbrellas at the tables at the restaurant so you DEFINITELY want to bring an umbrella or a little pop tent.  I don't think there was anyone renting umbrellas. 

There was people giving massages on the beach under a few 10x10 tents.  That looked pretty cool.  

I definitely recommend this beach.

241742968.name: Lovely Place to Hang out
241742968.author: a TripAdvisor user
241742968.reviewBody: We have been to Playa Los Cerritos for the past three years and we absolutely love this beach.  My husband surfs while I go for a walk or read a book or get a massage.  The water is a beautiful blue.  This year, it is a little less pristine due to the hurricane, but it\'s still beautiful and lively.  The restaurant provides chairs and a restroom if you are a customer.  The only drawback is that there are several people who come by and ask if you would like to purchase jewelry or a massage but I totally understand that they are trying to make a living; they have all been polite when met with a "no, gracias."

240569128.name: Cool Beach to Kick Back & ENJOY!!!
240569128.author: a TripAdvisor user
240569128.reviewBody: Great place to have a beer and great nachos or tortilla soup and watch the surfers. Or go surfing yourself. Long beach, maybe two miles, for walking. It has pretty easy access, good parking and a nice beach to lounge on. The restaurant is small & serves cold beer, has restrooms, its all you need is this part of Mexico.

238379944.name: Still needs cleaned up after the storm
238379944.author: a TripAdvisor user
238379944.reviewBody: Another one of the many "famous" beaches in the Todos area that is difficult to find.  Took us several times to find the turn off.  The beach itself still needs a lot of clean up after the Hurricane in Sept 2014.  A few surfers to watch, but not as many as expected.  Don\'t think the surf school is back open 100% yet so perhaps why not as many surfers?  There are several cliffs near the beach.  Drive up the roads, park and start hiking up the bluffs.  Not necessarily any set trails, but the views will not disappoint!  Where the beach disappointed, the views from our hike nearby made up for it!

237586121.name: great beach if you are looking for food & drink choices
237586121.author: a TripAdvisor user
237586121.reviewBody: The beaches at Todos Santos were true primitive beaches, beautiful,  un spoiled, etc.   Los Cerritos  was a welcome addition as it had one tiny beach place to have drinks and food,  without spoiling the natural setting.

237142722.name: Fantastic Beach
237142722.author: a TripAdvisor user
237142722.reviewBody: A lot of surfers from Cabo drive up to catch the waves here. Surf board rentals and lessons are right here. More sun seekers though, lazing in the sand or at on one bar on the beach. This is a fantastic bar with great drinks and food. Recently a few huts have been added along the shore line for nightly rental. I haven\'t stayed there but they look like a cool place to stay, listening to the waves at night.. Enjoy

234272766.name: Sun & Surf
234272766.author: a TripAdvisor user
234272766.reviewBody: Great place to learn how to surf!  When you go to the bar ask for a bucket with your beers and extra ice, they allow you to bring them over to where you\'re sitting on the beach.  Ignore the  vendors walking around selling FAKE Cohiba cigars. The guy got pissed when I pointed out that they were obviously counterfeit.

227592416.name: Great beach for lounging, swimming
227592416.author: a TripAdvisor user
227592416.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this beach on 2 separate vacations and hands down it\'s my favorite beach in the area (better in my opinion than the other Todos Santos beaches and also better than La Paz). You can rent umbrellas and chairs which is really nice and there is a grill/bar to buy food and drinks. Great to watch surfing but there is a very shallow surf so you can also very safely swim.

226721422.name: Great for Families
226721422.author: a TripAdvisor user
226721422.reviewBody: If you buy drinks or food at the restaurant you can use their chairs, bathroom and park for free. Clean beach, close parking so great for families with lots to carry.

219289702.name: Surf\'s up
219289702.author: a TripAdvisor user
219289702.reviewBody: It you surf; board, body or boggie, then this is the place to go in the southern Baja. The beach is huge and most days you can catch a gentle curl off some modest point break. The bottom is sandy and compared to pretty rocky at Zippers in San Jose or Monuments in Cabo.\nAs you move farther south down the beach and if conditions are right you may find some nice steamers. All and all this spot is a good ride most days. There is free parking if you come off the highway and use the dirt road on the south end of the beach. Winter time use a 3mm surf suit and you will be warm. This is an awesome spot that dates back to the day when some of old guys came here as kids and rode long boards.\nHave fun and be safe.

218581778.name: Gorgeous Beach
218581778.author: a TripAdvisor user
218581778.reviewBody: This beach is secluded, clean, and peaceful. The shore is rather shallow at least 50 yards out and is safe for families and beginner-surfers.

216880682.name: Nice beach day
216880682.author: a TripAdvisor user
216880682.reviewBody: Easy to get to, lots of services. We were there in the off season (July) and it was hot, the water was pleasant and not too crowded. We were advised to take the dirt path at the Surf Colony sign to park for free without registering. We did so, found the "parking" area easily with direct access to the beach, but a little bit south from the crowd, which was what we wanted. If you have kids, want a lifeguard, or want to be near the food and drinks, take the main entrance and park in the main lot. Good beach.

213211088.name: Beautiful Beach
213211088.author: a TripAdvisor user
213211088.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful especially when there are less people there.  We were there in June (low season) and it is so tranquil and quiet.  Even with the small crowds it\'s like you have the beach to yourself.  Riding a horse along the beach is a great way to appreciate it.

212847786.name: Great expansive beach- could get crowded
212847786.author: a TripAdvisor user
212847786.reviewBody: lovely beach that goes on for miles, there is plenty of parking and other services (i.e. restrooms). But it probably gets crowded (not when we were there), and you do get the beach vendors coming every once in a while. The access road, like pretty much every one in the area, is bumpy, but doable, though it seems to go on for a while. If you want a quieter more secluded beach, try Las Palmas, up the road, closer to Todos Santos. None of this are marked, so definitely ask the locals and even then, pay close attention, easy to get lost in that dessert.

211689018.name: Perfect Beach Spot!
211689018.author: a TripAdvisor user
211689018.reviewBody: It was my first time to Todos Santos area, so we did not know what to expect. As we headed to Playa Los Cerritos, I was a little nervous as our car bumped along the dirt road to get there. \n\nWow, but what a place. It was a wonderful, uncrowded spot. Great surfing and very friendly, well run cafe right on the beach. It is clean, well maintained with great fish and shrimp tacos. We went everyday we were in todos santos and got to know the waiters by name. This is my new favorite vacation spot and we can\'t wait to go back.

211583229.name: Great Beach and worth the drive
211583229.author: a TripAdvisor user
211583229.reviewBody: Cerritos is a sandy bottom beach and it\'s perfect for kids. If you like to surf or you are wanting to learn, this is the perfect spot. It\'s about a 30 minute drive from Cabo and the road is 4 lane the entire way. It is sometimes a little chilly up the pacific so pack a sweatshirt and the water is cooler too so you may need a 2mm top or even a wetsuit in the winter months. You can rent boogie boards and surfboards there. There is a restaurant also.

210928212.name: If you like to swim and surf
210928212.author: a TripAdvisor user
210928212.reviewBody: This beach has it all, restaurant, surfing and a terrific beach for swimming. Just a half hour drive north from Cabo San Lucas. Great views

209415623.name: Great swimming & surfing beach
209415623.author: a TripAdvisor user
209415623.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for walking, swimming, surfing or sitting  in a beach chair watching the world go by... With a cerveza or margarita to pass the time.

208936911.name: Beach games
208936911.author: a TripAdvisor user
208936911.reviewBody: Went to Beach club at Cerritos and enjoyed the music, food and drinks. Rosita made the day enjoyable for our group of 80, thank you! Awesome beach.

208274784.name: Love it here!
208274784.author: a TripAdvisor user
208274784.reviewBody: Great beach to learn how to surf! Nice little restaurant on the beach with great margaritas too! When we were there some girls were giving massages on the beach for $20/hr as well. Lots of fun!!

207640858.name: Nice for a day trip from Cabo
207640858.author: a TripAdvisor user
207640858.reviewBody: Soft sand, shallow water, nice surf! Cerritos Beach Club had live music the day we were there, the margeritas and fish tacos were great! A very pleasant place to spend the day!

207601018.name: Beautiful deserted beach
207601018.author: a TripAdvisor user
207601018.reviewBody: I was there with friends and there was no one else as far as you could see in either direction. You can walk to a fresh water lagoon and there are whales everywhere.

206474249.name: cool beach
206474249.author: a TripAdvisor user
206474249.reviewBody: nice place to spend the day for sun sand and surf the waves are great and the sand is soft and there is a place for drinks and food good stuff

205345342.name: Best little beach around!!!!!!
205345342.author: a TripAdvisor user
205345342.reviewBody:
We were looking for a public beach in our way from Todos Santos to Los Cabos.  We saw the sign and stop there.
Wow what a beautiful beach!!!!
Restaurant, bar, music on the sand, chairs, umbrellas, the whole enchilada :)) 
You can get very affordable and good massage right there!!!!
Also you can have surfing classes... the waves are right for beginners,.
We couldn't stay long there, but the time we spent was great!!! we are going back.....

203919563.name: awesome beach for small children
203919563.author: a TripAdvisor user
203919563.reviewBody: Waves are gentle & water is shallow for a good distance. We were there on a Monday & had the beach all to ourselves!

203645968.name: 12 Great Days at the beach
203645968.author: a TripAdvisor user
203645968.reviewBody:
We were down for two weeks in March, great weather, water was perfect, lots of folks enjoying themselves.  I made it to the beach on 10 of the 12 days I was in town. 

Although it was Spring Break for some, I never found it crowded. Nor are there crowds of vendors on the beach, if you are not interested, they get the message and leave you alone.

We are fortunate that there are life guards on this beach, and yes they are watching out. I saw them see  a group in a little bit of stress, and they were johnny on the spot.

Unlike most beaches in Los Cabos, you can actually swim on this one. Just pay attention to the flags,  they mark the safer area to swim when the current gets a little strong.

If you want to keep budget a little lower, I recommend stopping and picking up some of your refreshments before you hit the beach.  Although I have always had great food and service at the Beach Club it can get pricey. Everything in US dollars and they get 6 bucks for a beer.  Stop at Brody's on the last dirt road to the beach. They are located about half way to the beach.

During this trip, there were lots of surfers, many giving it a try for the first time. We took advantage of the massages on the beach.  A great experience.  They get about $40.00 US,  A whole lot cheaper than the resorts in Cabo, and a much more unique experience. I had a couple during the trip. Gaby does a great job.

The beach club charges a $5.00 parking fee, unless you spend a few bucks with them.  You can park for free on either side of the beach club for free.

There are several options for surf boards and bogie boards on the beach,  you might want to comparison shop.

Another great benefit of this beach, is that when it gets real hot in Cabo, it is about 10-15 degree F, cooler on this beach.  It makes it real comfortable in the heat of the summer.

There are several options for staying on the beach, or just a quick walk away, I would recommend planning an outing on Cerritos Beach during your next trip.

202968676.name: Great surf beach, don\'t eat at beach restaurant!
202968676.author: a TripAdvisor user
202968676.reviewBody:
The surf beach at Cerritos is amazing.  I am still a beginner and loved and and there were plenty of more experienced surfers at the back.  Beware of the currents though, you can quickly be swept along from where you went in, but as long as we were aware this wasn't a problem for us.

There are a number of different outlets for renting boards, we went to the one behind the hotel, where you can also used the showers there.  We found the surf shack to have good quality boards and our stuff was secure there to leave whilst we surfed.

Don't eat at the restaurant on the beach, the food is not good and very overpriced.  There is a restaurant just up the dirt road from the beach called coco loco which offers excellent fresh food at reasonable prices.

202159058.name: Nice beach on the Pacific
202159058.author: a TripAdvisor user
202159058.reviewBody: Despite the peddlers (less than Medano Beach) we really liked this place.  Shallow area with gentler surf for boogie boarding and my teenager learned to surf with the help of a lesson.  The beach club is average but if you agree to spend 100 pesos (about $8 US) you park for free (beware the soft sandy areas though).  They will get you under umbrellas and into chairs.  There is an outdoor shower to rinse off and the bathrooms are clean.  Beer is cold and food is ok.  Walk up the stone steps to the Hotel Cerritos and have a cocktail by the pool overlooking the Pacific!

202094633.name: Fun beach
202094633.author: a TripAdvisor user
202094633.reviewBody: We spent an afternoon hanging at Playa Los Cerritos. Walking the beach, playing in the surf and just relaxing. The surf can be a bit rough for those that are inexperienced, but it is still a lot fun. The water was colder here on the Pacific coast than in the Sea of Cortez, much colder than Jamaica or Hawaii I thought. Still, refreshing and good service from the beachside restaurant.

199987039.name: Boogie Boarding
199987039.author: a TripAdvisor user
199987039.reviewBody: No trip to the area would be complete without getting on a boogie board (for those of us who don\'t surf) and getting into the waves at Cerritos.  If you\'re going to go a couple times would recommend getting a board in Los Cabos or you can rent them on the beach. What a blast!

198689525.name: finally, waves to play in!
198689525.author: a TripAdvisor user
198689525.reviewBody: This is a great beach for getting in the water and having fun.  Also have a variety of services including food and drinks, places to sit under shade, and rentals of boogie boards.  As about to leave met Durio who gives surf lessons and got his info to make sure we get together next year.  If you are like me and miss beaches in B.C.S. where it\'s safe to actually get in the ocean and enjoy the waves this is the place.

196628168.name: Great beach, great surf...without the Cabo crowds
196628168.author: a TripAdvisor user
196628168.reviewBody: First trip to Cerritos and we really enjoyed it.  Camped out and Cerritos beach club with chairs, umbrellas, etc and a good if not overpriced lunch.  Surf is serious so not a place for young kids.

195774520.name: Nice Beach
195774520.author: a TripAdvisor user
195774520.reviewBody: We stop by between Todos Santos and Cabo San Lucas for the house made tequila margaritas.  The place has deteriorated over the years and the chairs are worn and the fire pits no longer work, bummer because the location after dark is very peaceful.  Seems they do not want to be open after sunset. As usual in Mexico there are sand vendors passing by every few minutes peddling their wares.  We will stop again in hopes the location gets some needed refurbishing!

195535466.name: excellent place for my first surfing experience
195535466.author: a TripAdvisor user
195535466.reviewBody: learned to surf here with david from surfincabo.com. i will always come back; the waves were AMAZING to learn and surf in!!!!

195514322.name: surfing lessons
195514322.author: a TripAdvisor user
195514322.reviewBody: Great lessons, I was able to stand on the board my first time. The instructions were clear and concise. The instructor was there with me in the water at all times making comments.\n

194895243.name: Best beach in southern Baja
194895243.author: a TripAdvisor user
194895243.reviewBody:
This beach has it all. Calm swimming beach good for children and adults, great surfing, awesome scenery, horse back riding and a nice Beach Bar.
It had been twenty years since I was on a one of those blow up wave riders and I caught my self smiling as I rode a good size wave to the beach.
As far as vendors I saw only one ice cream vendor and one sun glass vendor the hole time we were there.
What a big difference from Cabo San Lucas. The water was clear and warm. The Beach was clean. 
Bring chairs, umbrella, sun screen, ice chest. There is a small market called Brodys on main dirt road coming in. 
I think this area will explode soon there seemed to be a lot of houses being built and there are already three hotels on the beach. And I can see why its so beautiful and laid back like Cabo was in the 80s and mid 90s.
You can walk 5 min.s south and have the beach all to yourself.
I looked into property while I was there and was surprised how cheep it was $30,000 for a 2000 square meter lot.
In southern California you could not touch a lot in a area like  this for under $250,000.

193009644.name: too many vendors
193009644.author: a TripAdvisor user
193009644.reviewBody:
For our initial visit to the well known 'surfer beach', it was a bit too commercial for our tastes. 
The bar was fine, and the beach had 'a different look' than the beaches of Villa Santa Cruz, near the town of Todas Santos. I mean the sand itself.
There were the Mayan huts where people can rent to stay & experience the surf all the time. But they looked very rudimentary and not exactly vacation-like. The huge hotel next to the beach was grand, but pricey in appearance. Then there were spaces close to the beach also, behind the Mayan huts to rent / for mobile homes or tents? [we didn't inquire].  Just not enough space to feel uncrowded at that space. I am not a surfer, so I don't know what to expect in order to be on the water as much as you want. That is, all day long, I suppose.  
The grounds could be cleaner, a garbage can would be helpful.

192857088.name: Nice Beach Near Todos Santos
192857088.author: a TripAdvisor user
192857088.reviewBody: Our adult children and friends (ages ranged from 27-34) wanted to find a beach where they could lay out, hit the water and get a drink when the wanted. We decided to take the whole group (7) to Los Cerritos for a day. The younger set liked it so much they went back for a second day. The beach does have a club where you can get decent meals and drinks. They do take credit cards so that is a plus. This is more of a wading beach because the waves do get pretty high. Lots of young people surfing and on boogie boards. It\'s a good place to watch people. Parking is free if you spend over 100 pesos on your visit (that\'s easy)

192679936.name: Nice beach, food not.
192679936.author: a TripAdvisor user
192679936.reviewBody: Great spot, you see a lot of surfers, the restaurant has a really good Singer. The only downside is the food, since they donta have competition the food is really expensive and mediocre.

192178116.name: great place to learn to surf
192178116.author: a TripAdvisor user
192178116.reviewBody: not crowded, medium sized waves, plenty of boards to rent and lessons available. Waters warm, sun is plentiful, and the beach is wide and beautiful

191393106.name: Fun surf beach for beginners/intermediate
191393106.author: a TripAdvisor user
191393106.reviewBody: I\'m an intermediate surfer and really enjoyed hitting the waves at Los Cerritos.  I rented a board from Mario for about 2/3rds the asking price and enjoyed the consistent waves and sandy bottom.  La Pastora is fun, but a significant step up in challenge since the bottom is rocky and the water, shallow.  Have fun!

190288969.name: Best Beach on the Pacific in the south Baja!
190288969.author: a TripAdvisor user
190288969.reviewBody: Great surfing beach. At low tide, the sandbars stretch for miles, great for walking and one of the few safe swimming beaches in the area. Beach services at the 3 hotels and beach bar including horseback riding, surfing, food, bar etc. Taking a walk a few kms south towards Rancho Nuevo takes you to a wonderfully secluded area of beach.

189266567.name: Dont miss the little restaurant just as you exit the highway, up the hill
189266567.author: a TripAdvisor user
189266567.reviewBody:
Tip: as you are turning off the highway and onto the dirt road that leads you to the north end of the beach, there is a great mexican place to grab breakfast or lunch. It's just a few hundred feet or so from the highway, on the left and up the hill, with visible signs out front that say breakfast/lunch (desayuno, almuerzo)--it's small place with just a few tables, but the food is excellent, full entrees, with complimentary flan at the end. The pineapple water (agua pina, or something like that) is so refreshing! 

Tip #2: Don't pay for parking, you don't have to. You can park at the north end along the headland for free, and also there's a free place just south of the restaurant. 

As for the beach: Nice, wide, long beach. Good and safe for folks who like to splash around in the shallow white water, or play with their kids. Good for surfers, boogie boarders, and body surfers too. Sandy bottom. Several breaks. Lot's of people trying to sell you stuff.

188529209.name: Fabulous!
188529209.author: a TripAdvisor user
188529209.reviewBody: Picture perfect surfing beach.  Take "swimming" with a serious warning, though: my wife\'s surf instructor Perry (outstanding, btw) pulled two drowning tourists out of the rip tide, and said it was pretty much a weekly occurrence that he had to save somebody.  Next day a guy nearly drowned after his board snapped in half and he couldn\'t get back to shore. The waves here are big, they cross from different directions in big sets, and as a result they create massively powerful, fast moving rip tides that move up and down the beach, so you have to pay constant attention. Ignorant swimmers are suckered in and drawn to the quieter surf where the rip knocks down the breakers, precisely where they shouldnt be swimming at all.  When the surfing is good, the swimming is potentially deadly for the stupid.  There\'s no life guards here, you\'re on your own.\n\nGreat spot in every other way!

184923715.name: Wonderful beach and amenities!
184923715.author: a TripAdvisor user
184923715.reviewBody: This is probably the most swimmable and beach around Todos Santos and many surfers come here to learn surfing or just continue enjoying the beautiful clear ocean waters here. Gorgeous casitas, hotels and lodgings around and the beach area has a few bars and restaurants. There is a fee to park there, but it gets refunded if you get your ticket validated at the restaurant - not hard to do! Recommended!!

183450486.name: Beautiful Beach/Great surf!
183450486.author: a TripAdvisor user
183450486.reviewBody: My family and I spent several days enjoying this beach and exploring! We brought a picnic with us...but ended up walking over to a hotel for drinks and a different view! We had a great time...Nice beach for surfing, swimming, walking, relaxing!

181938816.name: Off the Beaten path
181938816.author: a TripAdvisor user
181938816.reviewBody: What a great find, this beach was so beautiful!  There was a nice little restaurant/Bar with beach chairs, you could swim, boggie board or surf in the pacific.  There are some vendors, but not too bad, my favorite part was the massage on the beach.  What a great way to end a relaxing vacation.

181268794.name: great waves for swimming - fun, fun, fun!
181268794.author: a TripAdvisor user
181268794.reviewBody: This continues to be a great swimming beach though it is being developed fast.  I loved swimming there and also had fun riding the waves on a boogie board.  Much safer than Todos Santos beaches for swimming.

181070247.name: Excellent beach!
181070247.author: a TripAdvisor user
181070247.reviewBody: Visited Playa Los Cerritos for 6 nights. Stayed at the Surf Colony and spent hours at this beach! Had boogie boards, walked the beach every day, nice surf! You can body surf, nice sandy bottom no rocks! Loved it! North end is ideal for surfers..lifeguard and surfboard  rentals available plus there is a beach restaurant/bar...can get a massage too right on the beach!  Restroom available at the restaurant.

180316534.name: Off Season Robbery
180316534.author: a TripAdvisor user
180316534.reviewBody: First mistake was renting a car. Drove from our hotel in San Jose del Cabo to see a quaint artist town/tourist trap. We visited near the end of the slow season so many businesses were closed. The artwork is subjective and overpriced. After two hours of looking and lunch we headed home. I am not a skilled Spanish speaker, but I can marginally communicate. I understand what ALTO means on a sign and to stop at a red light. Sadly just as we pulled out of town, a large police pick-up truck with lights flashing motioned me to pull over. My license demanded I was informed I ran a red light (here?). He is going to write me a ticket unless I pay a fine now. The fine amounted to the day\'s exchange rate tor $100USD. With visions of Midnight Express we paid them the $90USD we had left for the day and were sent on our way, ticketless. Did you know Mexican rentl cars come plastered with the rental company name on the trunk lid? Gee how did the officer know the gringo was a tourist?\nLesson learned.

174423074.name: Get here soon
174423074.author: a TripAdvisor user
174423074.reviewBody: A great place to learn how to surf with excellent instructors. Get here soon as i have a feeling it will develop poorly like Cabo has with highriese and crowds to match.

173524647.name: The only swimming beach in the Baja south Pacific
173524647.author: a TripAdvisor user
173524647.reviewBody: Cerritos Beach is great for families, is the only swimming beach in the area. There are lifeguards on duty, restaurant, waves and no rocks.\n\nGreat place!!!

170333868.name: Fun in the sun....
170333868.author: a TripAdvisor user
170333868.reviewBody: Great surfing, beautiful friendly people.  Rented two body boards for 80 peso and played for a couple hours.  Surf lessons available right on the beach.

170219546.name: Another great trip to a swimming beach on Pacific in Baja
170219546.author: a TripAdvisor user
170219546.reviewBody:
Just got back from another great week at Cerritos Beach.  The water was warm and the families were swimming and trying out their buggy board skills.

The massages on the beach are fantastic. The gals do a great job, I paid 400 pesos plus a a big tip.  Sure beats the prices in Los Cabos.

Although the food options aren't great, the Beach Club is always consistent, but expensive, bring your own refreshments and sit on the beach next to the beach club.

I hope to try my surfing skills next trip in the fall.

You can park to either the right side or the left side of the beach club, don't pay them to park.

169744944.name: Great Beach
169744944.author: a TripAdvisor user
169744944.reviewBody: This is the only true "swimming" beach in the Todos Santos area.  Complete with lifeguards, Beach Club restaurant/bar, surf shops and lodging options, this is our go to beach spot during the winter months that we live in TS.  The surfing can be quite good here on a south swell beach break or on a northwest swell point break.  The beach is also excellent for walking and is approximately 5 miles long.  Tremendous whale watching from Dec. through Feb.

168614990.name: Great beach
168614990.author: a TripAdvisor user
168614990.reviewBody: Stopped by on the way back from Todo Santos and it was great.  We lucked out and didn\'t have to pay a parking fee.  We were there on a saturday and they had a stage set up and had local bands playing for the people hanging out.  The did some fun games with everyone and kept things moving.\nWe just really wanted to chill and watch the waves and people. Surfed a little and drank margaritas!!

168404400.name: Fantastic Natural Beach!
168404400.author: a TripAdvisor user
168404400.reviewBody: I walked this gorgeous beach most every day when we stayed at Sol Pacifico Cerritos and it is one of the cleanest natural beaches (vs. groomed at a resort) that I\'ve ever visited.  The sand is soft!  Not baby-powder soft, but also not gritty or gravelly like some beaches can be.  I\'d walk from the condo to the Cerritos Beach Club and back in my bare feet ~ no shoes required. :). The surf is gentle enough for little ones to play in, but great for beginner surfers as I\'ve watched them take lessons at the beach club.  Lots of swimmers and apparently no undertow like in Cabo and San Jose del Cabo!  Definitely bringing our grandchildren to this beach on our next visit!  The Cerritos Beach Club was amazing ~ great food, WONDERFUL service, and live music on weekends. Oooh, and try the Cerritos Tequila, my husbands new favorite! :)

168341669.name: Big surf
168341669.author: a TripAdvisor user
168341669.reviewBody: This is not really a swimming beach. Have to catch it on a good day or surf will trash you. Went two different days and very different character both times

168291614.name: Surfing!!
168291614.author: a TripAdvisor user
168291614.reviewBody: Great for all surfing levels, board rentals on the beach, and a couple of places for good food value.

168099896.name: Super spot for lunch, cocktails, and learning to surf
168099896.author: a TripAdvisor user
168099896.reviewBody: We enjoyed a few hours at the beach where our kids took surf lessons from Mario.  The beach was fun and had a great restaurant/bar with outdoor seating.  He highly recommend stopping by here before or after a trip to Todos Santos.

167066406.name: Great beach to just chill
167066406.author: a TripAdvisor user
167066406.reviewBody: We stopped by here after we left Todos Santos, this beach was great.  We didn\'t order anything to eat. We did have beer and margaritas. We brought our own cooler. The waiter helped us set us umbrellas and lounge chairs. There was a band playing with beach games going on. Mostly a local hangout . Very dog friendly. We stayed and listened to music all afternoon. I have never seen a tuba and an accordion on the beach. Probably our best beach day while we were there. We didn\'t make it to Chilleno beach due to tropical storm, but this beach day was just what we were looking for and we didn\'t have to pay to park?

166842188.name: Wonderful place to swim
166842188.author: a TripAdvisor user
166842188.reviewBody: We were staying in a rental on the beach in Todos Santos where the ocean was too rough for swimming.  Los Cerritos was recommended to us, and it was wonderful.  It is a large beach with fine white sand, and the refreshing ocean is not dangerous.  There is a surf club on the beach with lounge chairs and umbrellas.  The staff brings reasonably priced beverages while you enjoy the ocean.  They also serve lunch.  A wonderful day trip from the town of Todos Santos.

165023517.name: Don\'t Bother
165023517.author: a TripAdvisor user
165023517.reviewBody: Overpriced below average food, my wife ordered nachos and there were fly eggs on the cheese. Snooty waiters didn\'t want to take it back and tried to pad the bill. This place is the worst.

160889217.name: Can\'t believe they are charging $100 pesos to park!
160889217.author: a TripAdvisor user
160889217.reviewBody: We have been visiting this beach for about 5 years. It was a great place to come and hang out with the locals. The surf is usually good and the atmosphere was wonderful. Minimal vendors on the beach and you could get a massage for $25 bucks from people that set up their tables on the sand. You could rent surf boards and body boards. People bring their dogs sit and relax and enjoy. Now another great beach experience has been ruined by the greed of another land owner in Mexico!!! They have taken away another fun place to visit and enjoy. They have put up chain link fences and are charging to park your car unless you go to the restaurant and bar at Los Cerritos. I spoke with a waiter and he said they started charging for parking in Feb. He showed me where you could park for free. It was in between the surf colony and the condo area.  It\'s just sad!

157654940.name: Super Surf & Swimming Beach
157654940.author: a TripAdvisor user
157654940.reviewBody: This beach is lovely! It\'s about 30minutes driving out of Cabo, on a super nice highway. We missed the sign for the turn off the first time we drove there, so pay attention. The beach is great for children who want to body surf with one of those little foam body boards, and the water is shallow enough that it\'s relatively safe and warm, but fun waves. When I return next year, I\'m keen to try surfing lessons with Azul Surf School. \n\nThe restaurant on the beach is very pricey so best to bring your own lunch as there are no other options. There is a washroom at the restaurant and free parking.

157019993.name: Great Beach, Bar and restaurant!!
157019993.author: a TripAdvisor user
157019993.reviewBody: Having a house in Cabo, we love to get away to a casual, laid back beach once a trip and Los Cerritos fits the bill perfectly!! We have been going to Los Cerritos for 7 years and, yes, it has changed - condos, beach surf villas, etc. But we still love to go, and the new 4 lane highway has certainly made the trip out much safer and faster! The restaurant is not the cheapest beach restaurant I have ever been to, but the service and food, especially for a pretty remote location, are consistently good. The $40 an hour beach massages are an added bonus! Great beach for the kids- bring the boogie/surf boards or rent them there. Great Sunday Jazz concert starts around 1 in the afternoon is a favorite!!

156302863.name: great quiet safe surf and swim beach
156302863.author: a TripAdvisor user
156302863.reviewBody: We (4 guys) spent the saturday of easter weekend here. Rented surfboards for the day from the shack in front of the surf colony ($30). Parking at that end of the beach is free, take the straight dirt road about 1km south of the one that goes to the main area (10 minutes walk on the beach if you want to join the crowd there). Great surf, and easy to learn at low tide since there is a sandbank that runs way out, you just walk out and point the board shorewards and then ride the white water. Beautiful clear water, flecked with gold. Wetsuits useful for prolonged immersion and sun protection. Very uncrowded, we sat under a beach umbrella associated with the colony and were never hassled. Enjoyed a band playing on the adjacent stage; all very low key and sober, local families and kids and a few gringos; far away from the Cabo madness.

155831010.name: Great beach to learn to surf
155831010.author: a TripAdvisor user
155831010.reviewBody: We learned to surf here and loved it! We felt safe parking the car and everyone on the beach (locals and tourists) were very friendly

155028464.name: wow waves that never stop
155028464.author: a TripAdvisor user
155028464.reviewBody: we went here after a day of whale watching and boy am I grateful we did. it was the highlight of the trip so far. HUGE waves that never stop and look as though they are in a movie. My  husband daughter rented buggy boards and both boards fell apart so we went back and got new ones that were not much better. even with crap equipments a blast and the water looks like it has gold flakes in it from the sand. STUNNING.  I took over 100 pictures of the beautiful waves and only wish there was a great resort nearby so we could stay on that side of the peninsula.

154779269.name: Fun Surf day
154779269.author: a TripAdvisor user
154779269.reviewBody:
This is one of the few surf beaches in the area and you will want to come here!  It is less than an hour from Cabo San Lucas at the newly built  Cerritos Beach Surf Colony Resort.  There are two surf groups available to rent right off the beach.  For $50 I rented Mario and a surfboard for a one-hour lesson.  I could have kept the board longer, on  my own, for that price but I was done! after an hour's lesson.  They have boogie boards, wave boards and wet suits too.  They also provide a sun umbrella and seat for those watching you surf.

There is public parking between the Resort and the pay parking - it is safe...park there, walk down the short path to the beach and there will be one rental group at the foot of the path and one to the right at the far end of the beach.  Both are about the same price.  

Mario was very patient and I was up and riding the waves (this is my second lesson) early.  It is safe and when you fall (and you will) you land on sand..not rocks like in Hawaii.  There is a beach restaurant nearby but we didn't go.  Bring a cooler and plan to plant yourselves there for the day.  Very few, non-pushy vendors -- if any.

154335819.name: A great beach day
154335819.author: a TripAdvisor user
154335819.reviewBody: If you want away from the crowds and tourists, this is a Great way to have breakfast/lunch on the beach with a friend.  Not crowded, quite and a beautiful spot only to be out done by a great place to stroll through the streets of when you are done at the beach. Not co-located but only 5 minutes away... The sleepy town is worth the stroll through.

154280984.name: Surf!!!!
154280984.author: a TripAdvisor user
154280984.reviewBody: Is the right place were to learn surfing. The only beach I know in Todos Santos where you\'ll find baywatchers. Safe place where to bring kids to swim. Really well organized, from the drinks, food, massages and relax time.

153740585.name: Fine hidden beach club!
153740585.author: a TripAdvisor user
153740585.reviewBody: A secluded secret beach club with big beautiful waves, a two mile beach, comfy beach loungers, friendly attentive service, icy cold beer and masseuses with beautiful hands. What more do you want?

153139854.name: Watch the surfers
153139854.author: a TripAdvisor user
153139854.reviewBody: My husband and I went on a VERY chilly Sunday afternoon.  Patio furniture set in the sand.  Live band.  Kind of kitschy, but fun.  We watched some surfers and had a beer.  Laid back.

152472504.name: Nice beach!
152472504.author: a TripAdvisor user
152472504.reviewBody: I went to this beach to take surfing lessons and we stayed for awhile afterwards. The water was beautiful and crystal clear. I could see whales playing in the water not far from the beach. Some of the waves in the middle of the beach were huge! The beach itself is large and clean. There are some men selling the usual jewelry on the beaches but they are very nice and not at all a pain if you tell them no. This is the only beach in the area ( that I know of) that has lifeguards. If you plan to swim in the water in this area, I would only swim in front of the lifeguard stand on this beach. \nThere is a $5 parking fee for this beach.

152031393.name: Great for walking.
152031393.author: a TripAdvisor user
152031393.reviewBody: The water was cold, but the sand is lovely to walk along. Then took a break at the beach bar to watch the surfers.  Also saw whales playing off the beach.  Great place to relax for an afternoon.

152024784.name: The best beach in todos santos!!
152024784.author: a TripAdvisor user
152024784.reviewBody: Surfers, enormous waves, long  beach to walk, friendly beach bar, tequila! What\'s not to like?  We checked out several other beaches after this one , but this is our favorite!

151923238.name: Stunning!
151923238.author: a TripAdvisor user
151923238.reviewBody: Huge, beautiful beach that isn\'t crowded.  Swimmable and great for surfing and boogie boarding.  Also has a restaurant/bar right on the beach.

150882325.name: A Nice Little Surf Spot
150882325.author: a TripAdvisor user
150882325.reviewBody: Though it\'s a little hard to find (follow signs to the Cerritos Surf Club) it\'s a great little beach with lots of space to swim and seemingly endless waves for surfing. Board rentals run $10-20/day.

150520963.name: Too expensive
150520963.author: a TripAdvisor user
150520963.reviewBody: Weird menu, too expensive for what it is (you\'re paying to eat/drink on the beach, basically). DELICIOUS chips and salsa (three different salsas and fresh tortilla chips), but that\'s literally the only vegetarian option.

150518916.name: Glorious sunset
150518916.author: a TripAdvisor user
150518916.reviewBody: This place is really cool, worth the drive away from Los Cabos and the big resort hotels. A place for a nice dinner by the sea, to see the sunset.

150462057.name: Beach for surfing, whale watching. No free parking.
150462057.author: a TripAdvisor user
150462057.reviewBody:
The beach is fantastic and beautiful. The wave was good for surfing, not so much for snorkeling. The sand is smooth and clean. Stay for sunset if you can, and keep your eyes on the water. You'll see whales spouting and jumping in the water.

It is a public beach, but right in front of the beach, there is an area which is blocked off that says private parking. Fee is 50 peso or $5 USD.

If you are driving down from Todos Santos, there is no clear sign where to turn. You look for marker 64 and about 30+ feet after that, there is a big dirt road. Turn in there and follow you logical sense to the beach.

While you are there, I suggest you also visit Hacienda Cerritos Resort. Once you are on the dirt road, you'll see the sign on how to get there. The resort is breathtaking, go sit by the pool and order a drink and watch the sunset. This place is so beautiful that you will not want to leave!

149379857.name: Amazing Day
149379857.author: a TripAdvisor user
149379857.reviewBody:
Booked surf lessons (65$) at the Costa Azul hut. Included an hour lesson, rash guard, and surfboard rental (all day if you want). 
Amazing place to learn to surf, as there is no coral, and very minimal rocks.
Great beach, great atmosphere. 

Bathroom at the beach club can be used by everyone even though it says "exclusive"

149378475.name: Loved Cerritos!!
149378475.author: a TripAdvisor user
149378475.reviewBody: We loved this place! I think I can say the day we made it out to Cerritos was a highlight of our trip. The beach is lovely and perfect for playing in the waves. Really cool vibe and a must do when in the area! If you pay the $5 parking, you can use it towards your bill.

149122570.name: Great beach for the whole family
149122570.author: a TripAdvisor user
149122570.reviewBody:
This is one of the few beaches where the undertow isn't dangerous.  Very shallow beach slope with (usually) nice waves.  It can be as crowded or as desolate as you want just by walking a few hundred meters from the concentration of people near the rocky point.

There are surf boards, body boards, umbrella and other rentals on the beach.

There is also some very overpriced beachside eating and drinking.

The turnoff is not well marked and the road is beat up enough that if you aren't familiar with local roads you might not believe this is the right road.  Ask someone in Pescadero, where to turn.  (When we went, the turnoff onto a steep dirt road was marked with unlettered flags on either side.  We also recognized the hotel on the beach in the distance.)

148750249.name: Don\'t pay the $5 parking walk instead down the stairs
148750249.author: a TripAdvisor user
148750249.reviewBody: Beautiful beach fun to watch the surfers.  The drinks were a bit pricey.  $12 for a not so good margarita

147851009.name: Swiming beach close to Todos Santos
147851009.author: a TripAdvisor user
147851009.reviewBody: Nice restaurant on the beach with great margaritas, live music on a sunday afternoon. Warm water and beautiful sunset

146626274.name: Great trip advisor find ! Thanks TA
146626274.author: a TripAdvisor user
146626274.reviewBody: We spent a day driving into Todos Santos. The highlight of this day was trip to Cerritos beach. Great surf, amazing sand !  If you have vehicle and are looking for a swim able beach this is most. We will be making this part of our stops for future Cabo trips.

146591653.name: Nice beach
146591653.author: a TripAdvisor user
146591653.reviewBody: Very wide open beach with surf break. Excellent view right next to Hacienda Hotel and cerritos surf colony.

146493868.name: Fabulous beach but restaurant on beach ridiculously expensive
146493868.author: a TripAdvisor user
146493868.reviewBody: A great place to go boogie boarding and play in the waives.  The lady that rents the boogie boards and umbrellas is friendly and reasonably priced.   We went for a bite to eat at the beach bar/cafe - salsa and chips great, but tacos ridiculously expensive.

146439888.name: excellent beach for all!
146439888.author: a TripAdvisor user
146439888.reviewBody: The only swimmable beach in Todos Santos/Cerritos.  Fantastic surfing, boogie board.  Two restaurants at beach , expensive but good food.

146386692.name: great day at the beach!
146386692.author: a TripAdvisor user
146386692.reviewBody: great surf for kids and there is a great , yet expensive snack bar restaurant right there. On weekends there is music!

144179170.name: Love this beach!
144179170.author: a TripAdvisor user
144179170.reviewBody: I\'ve visited a lot of beaches throughout the world, and I really loved Cerritos! Top notch for surfers, or those of us who enjoy watching surfers and just strolling the beach.  One of the only swimming beaches in Baja.  Check out the whale watching bar at the Hacienda Cerritos during whale migration season - what a fabulous treat!

142763457.name: Nice for surfing but bring your own food ...too many flies
142763457.author: a TripAdvisor user
142763457.reviewBody: Nice family fun beach. Easy to miss the entrance from the the highway. Overall very nice but the food experience could be better..tons of flies all over my food.

141920557.name: What a hidden gem
141920557.author: a TripAdvisor user
141920557.reviewBody: After going to Todo Santos, I remember a friend told me about a beach at K65.  As we were driving south, the marker popped into view, and away we went down this long dusty road.  My wife thought I was crazy.  We drove 3 or 4 miles, not sure, and came up over a ridge and there it was.  Probably the most beautiful beach we had seen.  There was a small cantina on the beach with a beautiful palaypa.  We had a beer or two and then we looked at the menu and had a great Chili Relleno.  \n\nVery relaxing.  We are going back this year in November and we are planning a trip to K65 again!

140564923.name: Great for kids!
140564923.author: a TripAdvisor user
140564923.reviewBody: This beach is maybe about 45 minutes north of Cabo San Lucas on the pacific side (almost to Todos Santos... it is unmarked, but its by KM marker 65).  Most of the beaches on this side are not swimmable which makes cerritos even more appealing.  Free parking.  It has tons of waves of all sizes, we heard that it was good for all levels of surfing as it has waves for everyone.  This is a HUGE beach that goes on forever.  The water was gloriously warm.  There were tons of families there which was sweet.  The water was REALLY shallow for a long way out so even very small children were having a blast playing in the 6 inch deep water.  There is a restaurant (overpriced and mediocre but at least it is available) and there are boogie boards and surfboards for rent and it sounds like there are people who give surf lessons too.  We agreed this would be a place to return to one day with our kids to teach them to surf... the waves and the water temp make it the perfect spot.

136734746.name: Nice Beach - A good place to stop for views en route to Todos Santos
136734746.author: a TripAdvisor user
136734746.reviewBody: A really nice beach with wonderful views in all directions. Plenty of fantastic sand and miles of coastline. The water is calm enough for swimming and we have even seen whales jumping out of the water just off the coast.  Enjoy!

135827434.name: Swimming was a blast!
135827434.author: a TripAdvisor user
135827434.reviewBody: We had a blest swimming here but it seemed a little sketchy.  I don\'t think I would eat here for fear of bugs.  They charged me $10 for an umbrella and $10 for a boogie board which I thought was a little high since I only used them for 3 hours

134915113.name: Great Beach, chill scene
134915113.author: a TripAdvisor user
134915113.reviewBody: super mellow, clean and beautiful beach.  worth the visit for sure

132776379.name: lovely beach - overpriced bar/restaurant
132776379.author: a TripAdvisor user
132776379.reviewBody: this beach is lovely. also, it\'s one of the only ones where you can swim in the todos santos area so it\'s worth a stop. sadly, some developers are flocking in so the place might soon start to look like the bad part of the california coast.\nwe had 2 strawberry juices each at the restaurant on the beach and we paid almot twice of what we paid for our dinner in a mexican restaurant in town - which included 2 mains and 3 cocktails!\nthe restaurant on the beach is definitely designed for American tourists - and not surprisingly all prices are in USD. So, if you plan to be in mexico and meet the locals... well, here the only locals work at the bar.... sad but true.

132764601.name: Great Beach for Kids
132764601.author: a TripAdvisor user
132764601.reviewBody: This is one of the only beaches in the area that actually has lifeguards on duty most of the day.  Great beach for kids!

132397154.name: Beautiful beach
132397154.author: a TripAdvisor user
132397154.reviewBody: Bar service very good on the beach with Margaritas to blow you away

132054253.name: Good surfing spot.
132054253.author: a TripAdvisor user
132054253.reviewBody: A few hundred meters of dirt track off highway nineteen, Playa Los Cerritos is a popular surfing spot with several developments popping up along the shores. This is not the most scenic beach near Todos Santos, but it is probably the most accessible. It is also a very good place to surf, especially for beginners like myself. Recommended for that alone.

131270312.name: One of few swimable beaches in area
131270312.author: a TripAdvisor user
131270312.reviewBody: The beach was clean, had a few places to eat on the beach. Make sure you say between the red flags, where it is safe. 4-year daughter had fun collecting these orange/purple seashells. Ate at the Surf Camp Los Cerritos. Food was good and portions Large.  There are men on the beach selling Jeweler, which can be annoying but not many compared to Cabos. And if there is something you like, you can work out a deal with them.

129941894.name: Great swimming beach!
129941894.author: a TripAdvisor user
129941894.reviewBody: Beautiful beach neat Todos Santos! The water was a little cold this time of year but, the view was nice as well as the bar service!

129603553.name: great beach day
129603553.author: a TripAdvisor user
129603553.reviewBody: the beach is one of the few swim able in the todos santos area. We spent all day there surfing and enjoying the food at the restaurant on the beach. Beers were cold and the food was great. Coastal Azul rents surf boards and wetsuit and they were really good quality boards.

128617337.name: Laid back surfer beach
128617337.author: a TripAdvisor user
128617337.reviewBody: We stopped by the beach on the way home from Todos Los Cabos - it had a chilled atmosphere and was nice and quiet. The new surfer villas that have been set up there look a great place to stay with a nice swim up bar and hot tub.

128029921.name: Nice beach, decent waves
128029921.author: a TripAdvisor user
128029921.reviewBody: Pretty spot and relatively easy to get to.  Not too many other travellers, just enough to make one feel comfortable.  Restaurant on the beach but we didn\'t eat there.

127271054.name: Great place to swim or surf.
127271054.author: a TripAdvisor user
127271054.reviewBody: Fun place to relax and watch the surfers, swim, or grab a beer and bite to eat.

127141444.name: Great place to relax and play in the water
127141444.author: a TripAdvisor user
127141444.reviewBody: Great waves and great place to frolic in the water.  Fabulous place to try to surf.  The restaurant on the beach serves great mango daqueries, and the food is pretty good

126810751.name: A virtual diamond in the rough
126810751.author: a TripAdvisor user
126810751.reviewBody: We have been to this beach many time over the years.  Fell in love with it the first time we went.  So much in fact that we bought one of the many properties that are available all around.  Now we have a beatiful ocean view and can watch the famed pacific coast sunset.  The beach itself is great for swimming, playing, surfing whatever.  You can also also cross the little mountain to the north which takes you to a much more secluded beach.  Takes 5 minutes.  This beach is  long and beautiful as well.  There is a sandbar out about 75ft but be careful.  only suggested for good swimmers on calmer days.  if its rough, stay out.  You can fish off the rocks here as well.  Overall great area and very safe to.  We have never had any problems whatsoever.  Lots of Amercian\'s and Canadian\'s own homes in the area along with locals too.

126515972.name: Nice wide beach
126515972.author: a TripAdvisor user
126515972.reviewBody: The beach is really wide and not crowded. Lots of surfers and people swimming and playing in the water and on the beach made it welcoming. \nThe only downside is that the only restaurant on the beach is very pricey, and priced in US dollars.

126419287.name: Surf and Waves
126419287.author: a TripAdvisor user
126419287.reviewBody: We have been going to Cabo San lucas for 6 years now.  Our 1st year there we rented a car and drove to Todo Santos.  On our own we decided to drive down a dirt road that lead us to a day of being in heaven. Absolutly beautiful beach, there were mabe 4 other people there that day ( all surfers) . We surfed and enjoyed the waves. Very clean beach.  Six years in a row we have gone back to a our #1 beach in Cabo.

125415299.name: a picture is worth 1000 words
125415299.author: a TripAdvisor user
125415299.reviewBody: do i have to eat at a place again to write a review when the 1st time i went to this place i was sicker then a dog for 2 weeks till i got home and got some antibiotics to kill the parasite i got from this place?..veiw the pics to see an open sewer overflowing threw hole in the broken septic tank (floating in sewage) behind the beach club where the flies are so thick you keep ur mouth shut for fear of swallowing a fly..every restarant in the area is a health hazard!!

124664082.name: Tourist Beach
124664082.author: a TripAdvisor user
124664082.reviewBody: The safest beach to swim and surf. Resturant, bar, and live entertainment.Sometimes crowded..drive is bumpy..but worth the effort!

124090424.name: Laid Back and Beautiful
124090424.author: a TripAdvisor user
124090424.reviewBody: Great place to have a beer and great nachos or tortilla soup and watch the surfers.  Or go surfing yourself.  Long beach, maybe two miles, for walking.  Easy access.

123925664.name: Nice beach
123925664.author: a TripAdvisor user
123925664.reviewBody: This is a nice swimming beach. It is crowded with tourist, vendors, surfers and swimmers though. I\'d say this beach is great for families, but for a more private experience, visit another beach.

123606737.name: A little of everything
123606737.author: a TripAdvisor user
123606737.reviewBody: Los Cerritos is maybe just a tad too far to hike from Todos, but it\'s worth catching a ride.  It\'s one of the few beaches in the area where you can swim, body surf, regular surf AND have margaritas delivered to you.  Or how about a one-hour massage for $20?  Sold.

122926903.name: kids loved it
122926903.author: a TripAdvisor user
122926903.reviewBody: We went here mostly for our kids. The swimming is safe and they had a great time making new friends.

122891028.name: Fantastic beach for surfing or boogie boarding
122891028.author: a TripAdvisor user
122891028.reviewBody: I don\'t think this beach would be as good for expert surfers -- though there were some on the primary break further out, those waves were *very* short -- but for beginners it was *fantastic*.

121401835.name: Boogie Boarding, Swimming, Surfing, Snorkeling ...
121401835.author: a TripAdvisor user
121401835.reviewBody: Public Beach just south of Todos Santos.  Located next to Cerritos Surf Colony with a beach restaurant.  Swim, Surf, Snorkel, Boogie Board, lay in the sun or walk the beach.  I assume that pets were welcome as there were dogs with their owners enjoying the beach.

120936892.name: Consistant surf for a premium
120936892.author: a TripAdvisor user
120936892.reviewBody: It usually works when the other spots don\'t work but the local bar/restaurant is kind of pricy...

120440480.name: Laid back swim able fun
120440480.author: a TripAdvisor user
120440480.reviewBody:
Easy to get to
Not a ton of people
Easy chair umbrella rental
Beach club with food/drink a little pricey but super convenient
Hope new condos under construction does not mean an overbuilding extravaganza awaits

120310736.name: What a great beach
120310736.author: a TripAdvisor user
120310736.reviewBody: The sand go on forever and the surf breaks are like SoCal\'s . The band plays on the beach and the outside resturant is perfect !

120122902.name: Learn how to surf and camp on the beach
120122902.author: a TripAdvisor user
120122902.reviewBody: rental equipment is available on the beach, you can camp there, feels like a private beach, restaurant on the beach has showers and water for you to use throughout the day. Check out the new overnight amenities they offer.

116680143.name: worth traveling to
116680143.author: a TripAdvisor user
116680143.reviewBody: we stayed in Todos Santos for a weekend in June and went to this beach twice!  It was wonderful!  You can pack a cooler or enjoy the great beach bar with chairs and umbrellas...there was live music on Sunday afternoon.  Great surfing...the beach is endless if you love to walk!  Get out of Cabo and see the real Baja!!!!

114991257.name: Nice beach area.
114991257.author: a TripAdvisor user
114991257.reviewBody: A nice beach and relatively clean. We hung out near the bar/grill that was built within the last 18 months. If you have kids and want to be near a restroom, umbrellas, food and drink, this is a nice option. If you\'re looking for something more pristine, go elsewhere.

94289574.name: Consistant surf
94289574.author: a TripAdvisor user
94289574.reviewBody:
Keep coming back here purely because you can always find surf. May not always be the best, but beats having nothing breaking, which is common in Cabo.

If youre looking to rent boards, visit Cost Azul surf shop...they have a caravan on the end of the beach. They are way, way more friendly and accomodating and offer better boards than the shop next to the restauarant on the beach. Thats run by a bunch of stone heads who dont give a crap about your business and only want to surf themselves. Not sure who owns that operation, but it seriously should take some tips from Costa Azul!

Absolutley love that there is a bar on the beach and can suck a cold one after a surf session. Will keep coming back!

71430352.name: A perfect beach - right now!
71430352.author: a TripAdvisor user
71430352.reviewBody: We discovered this beach by accident returning from Todo Santos to Cabo. The beach is perfect with a charming beach restaurant with tables on the sand. However, you may want to visit it soon because if the developers succede in building a huge condo development I believe the beach will become so commercialised and be spoilt.

33507217.name: How to destroy the perfect beach
33507217.author: a TripAdvisor user
33507217.reviewBody: If you drove all the way from Cabo to escape the chaos, the noise, the high prices, the annoying local vendors on the beach, you do not want to end up at Cerritos! A formerly magnificent beach (and sea turtle nesting ground), Cerritos has been completely ruined by the development of a pretentious looking "Hacienda Inn", a condo structure that lacks any original or appealing architectural design and a crowded bar/restaurant. And I hear there\'s more construction coming up soon. There are many beautiful and peaceful beaches around Todos Santos, where you can enjoy the sound of the waves rather than the noise produced by loudspeakers and drunk bikers yelling. Good surfing spot, though.

24023724.name: This is THE beach in the Cabo area!
24023724.author: a TripAdvisor user
24023724.reviewBody:
After being slightly disappointed with beaches around Cabo (no surf or dangerous surf, rough sand) this beach was recommended by our hotel owner.   I have to say I was a little skeptical about the 35-40 minute drive from Cabo San Lucas, however, it was exactly what we were looking for!

Now, the one complaint - there is a dirt road to access the beach from the main highway.  It is a bit rough, but it is well worth the trip.  The beach is a long crescent with rock formations on either end.  The sand is super fine.  The surf was excellent for surfing and boogie boarding.  My husband who is an excellent swimmer and my son who was a beginner boogie boarder both had a GREAT time in the water.  You can wade out a long way.  There is some type of restaurant/bar on the beach, but we did not visit it.  There were shower/restroom facilities as well.  

This was a cool beach with many people in RVs and tents - also many families brought their dog along, so there were quite a few dogs playing in the ocean.  

Overall, this was the best beach experience we had in Cabo!

11052884.name: Changing Fast
11052884.author: a TripAdvisor user
11052884.reviewBody: For those who like mainstream resorts like those found in Cabo, Waikiki, or Miami, Cerritos is a nice comming attraction.  In the works are a 5 story condo and a 1,000 room hotel.  Already there is a California sports bar.  The rocky point has been shared off to build someone\'s 22,000 square foot beach cottage.  Chain link fences run all over the area around the beach.  Obviously, not for everyone, but if you love package tours and timeshares, Cerritos is for you.\n\nThe beach itself is still a great place to swim or surf.  But don\'t be mislead by the "relatively safe" comments.  There are strong rip currents on some days - very strong.

10035545.name: Amazing Beach - Perfect Sand and Surf
10035545.author: a TripAdvisor user
10035545.reviewBody:
This beach is Amazing!!! Just minutes from Todos Santos and Cano San Lucas!!! It has one of teh only swimable beaches in all of cabo san lucas. you can wade way out easily. It is great for kids!! Also the sand is powder soft and perfect unlike other Cabo San Lucas Beaches that are rough with large sand particles. The outer surf break is fantastic for all levels of surfing.

This is hands down the best Beach in cabo san lucas or todos santos area.

There is a full restruant and bar and Hotels are going in soon!!!
